en: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
hmr: A tîrin Pathienin hnuoi le vân a siem a.

en: And the earth was waste and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi hi a sie le a ruok ngawt a na, tui inthûktak chung chu ân thim mup a. Pathien Thlarau chun tui chunghai chu a awp zing a.

en: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Var hung um raw se,” a ta; chuongchun, var a hung um tah a.

en: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin var chu a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a: chuongchun, Pathien chun var le inthim chu a ṭhe tah a.

en: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And there was evening and there was morning, one day.
hmr: Pathienin var chu “Sûn” ân bûk a, inthim chu “Zân” ân bûk a. Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a; chu chu ni khatna.

en: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Tui le tui kâra chun boruok lientak um sienla, chu chun tui le tuihai chu ṭhe raw se,” a ta.

en: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin boruok lientak chu a siem a, boruok lientak hnuoia tui umhai le boruok lientak chunga tui umhai chu a ṭhe tah a: chuong angtak chu a lo ni tah a.

en: And God called the firmament Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, a second day.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin boruok lientak chu “Vân” ân bûk a. Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a; chu chu ni hnina.

en: And God said, Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Vân hnuoia tui umhai chu hmun khatah luong khâwm sienla, khawmuol chu inlang raw se,” a ta: chuongchun, chuong angtak chun a hung ni tah a.

en: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.
hmr: Pathienin khawmuol chu “Hnuoi” ân bûk a, tui um khâwmhai chu “Tuisuoriethai” ân bûk a: Pathienin chu chu a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a.

en: And God said, Let the earth put forth grass, herbs yielding seed, and fruit-trees bearing fruit after their kind, wherein is the seed thereof, upon the earth: and it was so.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Hnuoi hin hlo dâm, thlai chi nei dâm, thei kûng hnuoi chunga mâni chi um dân ding anga ra, a ra sûnga a chi um dâm chu hung insuo raw se,” a ta: chuong angtak chun a hung um tah a.

en: And the earth brought forth grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, wherein is the seed thereof, after their kind: and God saw that it was good.
hmr: Hnuoi chun hlo dâm, thlai mâni um dân ding anga chi nei dâm, thing mâni chi um dân ding anga ra, a ra sûnga a chi um dâm chu ân suo tah a: Pathienin a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a.

en: And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.
hmr: Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a, chu chu ni thumna.

en: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years:
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Sûn le zân ṭhêna dingin vân boruok lientaka chun varhai um sienla, chuonghai chu inchikna dâm, hunbi dâm, ni dâm, kum dâm hrietna ding ni raw se;

en: and let them be for lights in the firmament of heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
hmr: hnuoi chung elvar dingin vân boruok lientaka chun varhai ni bawk raw hai se,” a ta: chuong angtak chun a hung ni tah a.

en: And God made the two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin var ropuitak pahni khi a siem tah a; var ropui lem chu sûn rorêltu dingin, var ropui naw lem chu zân rorêltu dingin: arasihai khawm a siem bawk a.

en: And God set them in the firmament of heaven to give light upon the earth,
hmr: Pathienin chuonghai chu vân boruok lientaka khin a sie tah a: hnuoi chung sukvar ding le,

en: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
hmr: sûn le zân chunga rorêl ding le var le inthim chu ṭhe dingin. Pathien- in chu chu a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a.

en: And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
hmr: Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a, chu chu ni lina.

en: And God said, Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Tuihai chun thilsiem chângthei hringna neihai tamtak insuo ṭeu hai sienla, vatehai khawm chu hnuoi chunga vân boruok lientaka hin vuong raw hai se,” a ta.

en: And God created the great sea-monsters, and every living creature that moveth, wherewith the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind: and God saw that it was good.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin tuisuo- rieta thilhring lientak takhai chu a siem a, thilsiem hringna nei le chângthei tinrêng tuiin a insuo ṭeuhai chu anni chi um dân ding ang sengin a siem bawk a, vate thla nei tinrêng khawm anni chi um dân ding ang sengin a siem a: Pathienin chu chu a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a.

en: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Chi tamtak inthlain hung pung unla, tuisuoriet tuihai suksip ro, vatehai khawm hnuoiah pung raw hai se,” tiin mal a sâwm a.

en: And there was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
hmr: Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a; chu chu ni ngana.

en: And God said, Let the earth bring forth living creatures after their kind, cattle, and creeping things, and beasts of the earth after their kind: and it was so.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Hnuoi chun thilsiem hringna neihai, anni chi um dân ding ang sengin: ran, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwnhai le ramsahai, anni chi um dân ding ang sengin insuo raw se,” a ta: chuong angtak chu a hung ni tah a.

en: And God made the beasts of the earth after their kind, and the cattle after their kind, and everything that creepeth upon the ground after its kind: and God saw that it was good.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin, ram sa anni chi um dân ding ang sengin, ran dâm anni chi um dân ding ang sengin, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwnhai po po, anni chi um dân ding ang sengin a siem a: Pathienin chu chu a en a, ṭha a ti hleh a.

en: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the heavens, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, “Ei angpuiin, eini angtakin, mihriem siem inla, anni chu tuisuorieta nga chunga dâm, chunglêng vate chunga dâm, ran chunga dâm, hnuoi chung po poa le thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn po po chunga dâm, thu inneitir ei tiu,” a ta.

en: And God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin ama angpuiin mihriem a siem a, Pathien angpui ngeiin a nih a siem chu, pasal le nuhmeiah a siem a nih.

en: And God blessed them: and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it; and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the heavens, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin anni chu mal a sâwm a, Pathien ma chun an kuomah, “Chi tamtak thlain hung pung unla, hnuoi hi hluo sip unla, in thu thuin inumtir ro; tuisuorieta nga chunga dâm, chunglêng vate chunga dâm, thilhring hnuoi chunga bawkinvâka lâwn po po chunga dâm thu nei bawk ro,” a ta.

en: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for food:
hmr: Chun, Pathien bawkin, “Ngai ta u, hnuoi chung po poa um thlai chi nei tinrêng le thing tinrêng chi nei ra um hai chu ka pêk cheu a nih: in bu ding nîng an tih.

en: and to every beast of the earth, and to every bird of the heavens, and to everything that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for food: and it was so.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia sa tinrêng kuoma dâm, chunglêng vate tinrêng kuoma dâm, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn tinrêng kuoma dâm, hringna nei taphawt kuoma chun, an bu ding- in hlohna tinrêng ka pêk a nih,” a ta: Chuong angtak chu a hung ni tah a.

en: And God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a thilsiem tinrêng chu a en a, ngai ta, ṭha a ti êm êm a. Chuongchun, zântieng a um a, zîngtieng a um bawk a, chu chu ni rukna.

en: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, namely, of Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
hmr: Hieng hi Noa naupasal, Sem, Ham, le Japheth thlahai chu an nih; tuilêt hnunga naupasal an ineihai chu.

en: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
hmr: Japheth naupasalhai chu: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Mesek le Tiras an nih.

en: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
hmr: Gomer naupasalhai chu: Askenaz, Riphath le Togarma an nih.

en: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
hmr: Javan naupasalhai chu: Elisa, Tarsis, Kittim le Dodanim an nih.

en: Of these were the isles of the nations divided in their lands, every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
hmr: Chuonghaia inthawk chun a nih tuipui kama hnamhai chu anni ram ramah an indar ta chu: anni ṭawng ang pei le, anni hnam ang peiin, anni chihai laia seng chun.

en: And the sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.
hmr: Ham naupasalhai chu: Kush, Mizraim, Put le Kanaan an nih.

en: And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.
hmr: Kush naupasalhai chu Seba, Havila, Sabta, Raama le Sabteka hai an nih. Raama naupasalhai chu Sheba le Dedan an nih.

en: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
hmr: Kush chun naupasal Nimrod a nei a: ama chu hnuoia mi hrât hmasatak a nih.

en: He was a mighty hunter before Jehovah: wherefore it is said, Like Nimrod a mighty hunter before Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA hmaha ramsuok mi hrâttak a nih; chulei chun a nih, “LALPA hmaha ramsuok mi hrâttak Nimrod ang a nih,” an ti hlak chu.

en: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
hmr: Ân lal phutna chu Sinar rama Babel, Erek, Akkad le Kalne khuo a nih.

en: Out of that land he went forth into Assyria, and builded Nineveh, and Rehoboth-Ir, and Calah,
hmr: Chu rama inthawk chun a suok a, Assuriaah a lût a, Ninevi, Rehoboth-Ir, Kala le,

en: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city).
hmr: Ninevi le Kala inkâra Resen khuohai a siem a (chu Resen chu khaw ropuitak a nih).

en: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
hmr: Chun, Mizraim chun Lud, Anam, Lahab, Naphtu,

en: and Pathrusim, and Casluhim (whence went forth the Philistines), and Caphtorim.
hmr: Pathrus, Kaslu (Philistinhai suokna) le Kaphtor mihai a thlah a.

en: And Canaan begat Sidon his first-born, and Heth,
hmr: Kanaan chun a nau lutîrah Zidon a nei a, Heth khawm a nei bawk a;

en: and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
hmr: Jebus-hai, Amor-hai, Girgas- hai,

en: and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
hmr: Hiv-hai, Arko-hai, Sin-hai,

en: and the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanite spread abroad.
hmr: Arvad-hai, Zemar-hai, Hamat- hai, a thlah a; chu hnunga chun Kanaan hnamhai chu an hung indar lien pei tah a.

en: And the border of the Canaanite was from Sidon, as thou goest toward Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest toward Sodom and Gomorrah and Admah and Zeboiim, unto Lasha.
hmr: Chun, Kanaan hnamhai ramri chu Zidona inthawkin Gerar pan zâwngin Gaza chenin; Sodom, Gomorra, Adma le Zeboiim pan zâwngin, Lasa chenin a nih.

en: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, in their nations.
hmr: Chuonghai chu Ham thlahai chu an nih, anni hnamhai ang pei le anni ṭawng ang peiin, anni ram rama le anni chi lai chun.

en: And unto Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, to him also were children born.
hmr: Sem, Eber nau po pohai thlatu, Japheth u khawm chun nauhai a nei veh a.

en: The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arpachshad, and Lud, and Aram.
hmr: Sem naupasalhai chu: Elam, Assur, Arpaksad, Lud le Aram an nih.

en: And the sons of Aram: Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
hmr: Aram nauhai chu: Uz, Hul, Gether le Mash an nih.

en: And Arpachshad begat Shelah; and Shelah begat Eber.
hmr: Arpaksad chun naupasal Sela a nei a; Sela chun naupasal Eber a nei a.

en: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
hmr: Eber chun naupasal pahni a nei a: pakhat hming chu Peleg a na, a dam lai chun hnuoi hi ṭhein a um ta sih a, a sang hming chu Joktan a nih.

en: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
hmr: Joktan chun naupasal Almodad, Seleph, Hazarmaveth, Jera,

en: and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
hmr: Hadoram, Uzal, Dikla,

en: and Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
hmr: Obal, Abimael, Seba,

en: and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
hmr: Ophir, Havila le Jobab a nei a: chuong po po chu Joktan naupasalhai an nih.

en: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.
hmr: Chun, an umna chu Mesaa inthawkin khawsak tlâng Sephar pan zâwngin a nih.

en: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
hmr: Chuonghai chu Sem thlahai chu an nih a, anni hnamhai ang pei le anni ṭawnghai ang peiin, anni ram ramhaiah, anni chihai ang pei chun.

en: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations: and of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
hmr: Chuonghai chu Noa thlahai hnamhai an nih a, an thlahai ang peiin, an chihai lai chun: tui lêt hnungin chuonghaia inthawk chun a nih, hnuoia hin chi tin an indar ta chu.

en: And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia mi po po chu ṭawng hmunkhat le thu hril dân hmunkhat an ni vawng a.

en: And it came to pass, as they journeyed east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a na, khawsak tienga an insawn pei lai chun Sinar ramah phaizâwl an hmuh a; chutaka chun umhmun an khuor tah a.

en: And they said one to another, Come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.
hmr: “Thaw ro, ṭêklei siem ei tiu, ṭhatakin rawng ei tiu,” an inti tâwl a. Chuongchun, lung aiah ṭêklei chu an siem a, lungchârna aiah lawnghnai an nei bawk a.

en: And they said, Come, let us build us a city, and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven, and let us make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
hmr: Chun, “Thaw ro, khawpui siem ei ta, in insâng a sîpin vân tawng dingin bâwl bawk ei tiu a, ei hming sukthang ei tiu; chuong naw chun hnuoi chung po poa hin sukdarin um rawi ei tih,” an in tih a.

en: And Jehovah came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu mihriem nauhaiin khawpui le in insâng an siem vêl chu en dingin a zu ṭum a.

en: And Jehovah said, Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do: and now nothing will be withholden from them, which they purpose to do.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Ngai ta u, mihai hi pumkhat an nih a, an rêngin ṭawng hmunkhat an nei bawk sih a; hi thil an thaw phut a ni hi; tuhin chu an thilthaw tum hrim hrim hi khappêk ruol ni ta naw ni hai.

en: Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
hmr: Thaw ro, zu fêng ei tiu a, ṭawng an inhriettuo thei nawna dingin khutaka khun an ṭawng zu suk- tumpêk ei tiu,” a ta.

en: So Jehovah scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off building the city.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPAIN anni chu chutaka inthawk chun hnuoi chung po poa chun a sukdar tah a; chuongchun, an khaw siem khawm chu an tâwpsan tah a.

en: Therefore was the name of it called Babel; because Jehovah did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did Jehovah scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
hmr: Chuleichun, a hming chu Babel an tih a; LALPAIN chutaka chun hnuoia mi po po ṭawng chu a suktumpêk ta leiin: chutaka inthawk chun LALPAIN anni chu hnuoi chung po poa chun a sukdar ta bawk a.

en: These are the generations of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old, and begat Arpachshad two years after the flood:
hmr: Hienghai hi Sem thlahai chu an nih: Sem chu kum za mi a niin tui lêt hnung kum hni hnunga chun naupasal Arpaksad a nei a:

en: and Shem lived after he begat Arpachshad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Chun, Arpaksad a nei hnung chun Sem chu kum za nga a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Arpachshad lived five and thirty years, and begat Shelah:
hmr: Arpaksad chun kum sâwmthum le panga a niin naupasal Selah a nei a:

en: and Arpachshad lived after he begat Shelah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Selah a nei hnung chun Arpaksad chu kum za li le pathum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Shelah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
hmr: Selah chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Eber a nei a:

en: and Shelah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Eber a nei hnung chun Selah chu kum za li le pathum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
hmr: Eber chun kum sâwmthum le pali a niin naupasal Peleg a nei a:

en: and Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Peleg a nei hnung chun Eber chu kum za li le sâwmthum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
hmr: Peleg chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Reu a nei a:

en: and Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Reu a nei hnungin Peleg chu kum za hni le pakuo a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
hmr: Reu chun kum sâwmthum le pahni a niin naupasal Serug a nei a:

en: and Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Serug a nei hnungin Reu chu kum za hni le pasari a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
hmr: Serug chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Nahor a nei a:

en: and Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Nahor a nei hnungin Serug chu kum za hni a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
hmr: Nahor chun kum sâwmhni le pakuo a niin naupasal Tera a nei a:

en: and Nahor lived after he begat Terah a hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Tera a nei hnungin Nahor chu kum za khat le sâwm le pakuo a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
hmr: Chun, Tera chun kum sâwmsari a niin naupasal Abram, Nahor le Haran a nei a.

en: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
hmr: Chun, hienghai hi Tera thlahai chu an nih. Tera chun naupasal Abram, Nahor le Haran a nei a. Haran chun naupasal Lota a nei a.

en: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
hmr: Haran chu a piengna rama Kaldaihai khuo Urah, a pa Tera hmaa chun a thih a.

en: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
hmr: Chun, Abram le Nahor chun nuhmei an nei a; Abram nuhmei hming chu Sarai a na; Nahor nuhmei hming chu Milka le Iska pa Haran naunu Milka a nih.

en: And Sarai was barren; she had no child.
hmr: Chun, Sarai chu a ching a, nau hrim a nei nawh a.

en: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
hmr: Tera chun a naupa Abram le, a naupa naupasal (Haran naupa) Lota le, a mo, a naupa Abram nuhmei Sarai chu a ṭhuoi a; Kanaana fe dingin Kaldaihai khuo Ura inthawk chun an suok tlâng tah a; nisienlakhawm, Haran an hung tlung a, chutaka chun umhmun an khuor tah a.

en: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
hmr: Tera dam sûng chu kum za hni le panga a nih; chun, Tera chu Harana chun a thi tah a.

en: Now Jehovah said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto the land that I will show thee:
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Abram kuoma chun, “I khuoa inthawk le i laibunghai laia inthawk le i pa ina inthawk chu suok la, ram ka lân entir ding che tieng chun fe rawh:

en: and I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and be thou a blessing:
hmr: Chuongchun, chi ropuitakah siem ka ti cheh a, mal khawm sâwm ka ti cheh a, i hming sukropui bawk ka tih: nang malsâwmna nîng i tih.

en: and I will bless them that bless thee, and him that curseth thee will I curse: and in thee shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
hmr: Chun, malsâwmtu che taphawt chu malsâwm ka ta, ṭawngsie inphurtu che chu ṭawngsie inphur ka tih: nangmaa chun hnam tin la thawveng an tih,” a tih a.

en: So Abram went, as Jehovah had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abram chu LALPAIN a kuoma a hril angin a fe tah a; Lota chu ama leh a fe veh a. Abram chu Harana inthawka a suok lai chun kum sâwmsari le panga mi a nih.

en: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
hmr: Chun, Abramin a nuhmei Sarai le, a unaupa naupasal Lota le an sum themsuok po po le, Harana an mi neihai chu a ṭhuoi a; Kanaan rama fe dingin an suok a. Kanaan ram chu an tlung chun,

en: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Shechem, unto the oak of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
hmr: Abram chu chu rama Sekem hmun chen, More thingsaisuo hmun chen chun a fe pei a. Chuong lai chun Kanaan mihai chu chu rama chun an um a.

en: And Jehovah appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto Jehovah, who appeared unto him.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu Abram kuomah ân lâr a, “Hi ram hi i thlahai kuomah la pêng ka tih,” a tih a; chuongchun, chutaka chun a kuoma inlâr LALPA ta ding chun mâichâm a siem a.

en: And he removed from thence unto the mountain on the east of Beth-el, and pitched his tent, having Beth-el on the west, and Ai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto Jehovah, and called upon the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chun Bethel saktienga tlânga chun ân tâwl a, chutaka chun puon in a zar a, a thlangtieng chun Bethel chu a um a, a sak tieng chun Ai khuo a um a; chutaka chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem nâwk a, LALPA hming chu a lam a.

en: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the South.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu Negeb panin a lân tâwl ta rawp a.

en: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was sore in the land.
hmr: Chun, chu rama chun ṭâm a hung tlah a; chu rama chun ṭâm chu a nasa êm leiin Abram chu Aiguptaa um hri dingin a zu fe tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
hmr: Aigupta a lût ding lai chun a nuhmei Sarai kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, nuhmei hmêl ṭhatak i nih ti ka hriet;

en: and it will come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they will say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
hmr: chuleiin, Aigupta mihaiin an hmu pha che chun, ‘Hi hi a nuhmei a ni hi,’ tîng an ta, kei chu mi that an ta, nang ruok chu hlâng an ti che.

en: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister; that it may be well with me for thy sake, and that my soul may live because of thee.
hmr: I zâra ṭhataka ka um theina ding le, nangma leia ka hring theina dingin, ‘A farnu ka nih,’ ti pei rawh aw,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu Aigupta a lût chun Aigupta mihai chun nuhmei chu an hmuh a, a hmêl chu ṭha an ti êm êm a.

en: And the princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
hmr: Pharao milienhai khawmin an hmuh a, Pharao kuomah a ṭhatzie an hril a; chuongchun, nuhmei chu Pharao inah an ṭhuoi lût tah a.

en: And he dealt well with Abram for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he-asses, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and she-asses, and camels.
hmr: Chun, ama chun Sarai lei chun Abram chu ṭhatakin a thawh a; chuongchun, berâm dâm, bâwng dâm, sabengtung chal dâm, suokpa dâm, suoknu dâm, sabengtung pui dâm, sanghâwngsei dâm a nei pha tah a.

en: And Jehovah plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun Abram nuhmei Sarai lei chun Pharao le a sûnghai chu namênin a sawisa ta nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharao chun Abram chu a ko a, “Ka chunga i thilthaw hi iengtizie am a ni ta leh? I nuhmei a nih ti iengdinga i mi hril naw am a na?

en: why saidst thou, She is my sister, so that I took her to be my wife? now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
hmr: Iengdinga ‘ka farnu a nih’ i ti? Chu lei chun an nâwm ka nuhmeia ka lo nei ta hiel hi: en rawh, taka hi i nuhmei, ṭhuoi la, fe hmang dai rawh,” a ta.

en: And Pharaoh gave men charge concerning him: and they brought him on the way, and his wife, and all that he had.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun a chung- châng thua chun mi kuomah thu a pêk a; chuongchun, ama an hang inthla tah a, a nuhmei leh, a nei po po le chun.

en: And Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the South.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu Aiguptaa inthawk chun a suok a, ama le a nuhmei le, a nei po po, ama ruolin Lota leh, Negeb-a chun an hang fe tah a.

en: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu ran dâm, tang- ka dâm, rângkachak dâmin a hausa êm êm a.

en: And he went on his journeys from the South even to Beth-el, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Beth-el and Ai,
hmr: Chun, Negeba inthawk chun Bethel tlung rakin a fe pei a, Bethel le Ai khuo inkârah, a tîrtaka a puon in umnaa khan;

en: unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of Jehovah.
hmr: a tîra a mâichâm siemna ngeia khan; chun, chutaka chun Abram chun LALPA hming a lam a.

en: And Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
hmr: Chun, Lota, Abram le fe ve khawm khan berâm ruol dâm, bâwng ruol dâm, puon in dâm a nei veh a.

en: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
hmr: An um rêlna dingin ramin a dai ta nawh a, an thil nei chu a nasa hle sih a; chuongchun, an um hmunkhat thei ta dêr da el a.

en: And there was a strife between the herdsmen of Abram’s cattle and the herdsmen of Lot’s cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelt then in the land.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abram ran puhai le Lota ran puhai inkâra chun insêlna a hung suok tah a: chuong lai chun Kanaan le Periz mihai chu chu rama chun an um a.

en: And Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdsmen and thy herdsmen; for we are brethren.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abramin Lota kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin, kei le nanga inkârah, ka ran puhai le i ran puhai inkâra khawm, insêlna um naw raw se; unau ei ni sih a.

en: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou take the right hand, then I will go to the left.
hmr: Ram chu a pumin a um duoi a ni naw am a nih? Lunginsiettakin, ka kuoma inthawk hin insuktum el rawh: nang vawitieng i fe chun kei changtieng fêng ka ta, annawleh, nang changtieng i fe chun kei vawitieng fêng ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the Plain of the Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before Jehovah destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Jehovah, like the land of Egypt, as thou goest unto Zoar.
hmr: Chuongchun, Lota chu a dâk suok a, Zoar pan zâwng chun, Jordan phaizâwl po po chu LALPA huon ang, Aigupta ram ang khan ram tina tui um furna hmun a nih ti a hriet a, LALPAIN Sodom le Gomorra a suksiet hma kha a ni sih a.

en: So Lot chose him all the Plain of the Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.
hmr: Chuongchun, Lota chun Jordan phaizâwl po po chu a thlang tah a; chun, Lota chu saktieng chun ân tâwl tah a: chuongchun, an inṭhe tah a.

en: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelt in the cities of the Plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.
hmr: Abram chu Kanaana chun a um a, Lota chu phaizâwl khuohaia chun a um a, a puon in chu Sodom chenin a tâwl pei a.

en: Now the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners against Jehovah exceedingly.
hmr: Chun, Sodom mihai chu Pathien mithmuin nasataka ṭha naw le suolin an um a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art, northward and southward and eastward and westward:
hmr: Chun, a kuoma inthawka Lota a tuma a um hnung chun, LALPAIN Abram kuomah, “Dâk la, i umnaa inthawk khan hmârtieng dâm, sim- tieng dâm, saktieng dâm, thlangtieng dâm en rawh:

en: for all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.
hmr: i ram hmu po po hi i kuoma le i thlahai kuomah kumkhuoa dingin ka pêk ding che a nih.

en: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then may thy seed also be numbered.
hmr: Chun, i thlahai chu hnuoia pilvut ang elin la siem ka tih: chuongchun, miin hnuoia pilvut hi an tiem sêng chun i thlahai khawm chu tiem sêng ni bawk an tih.

en: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for unto thee will I give it.
hmr: Tho la, ram hi a dung a khangin fang suok rawh; i kuomah ka pêk ding che a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Abram moved his tent, and came and dwelt by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built there an altar unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abram chun a puon in chu a tâwl a, Hebrona um Mamre thingsaisuo kâwlhaia chun umhmun a va khuor a, chutaka chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem a.

en: And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim,
hmr: Chun, Sinar lal Amraphel, Ellasar lal Ariok, Ellam lal Kedorlaomer le, Goiim lal Tidal dam lai chun hieng hi a na,

en: that they made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar).
hmr: anni chun Sodom lal Bera chu an rûn a. Gomorra lal Birsa, Adma lal Sinab, Zeboiim lal Semeber le Bela lal chu an rûn bawk a. (Bela khuo chu Zoar khuo a ni tah).

en: All these joined together in the vale of Siddim (the same is the Salt Sea).
hmr: Chuonghai po po chu Siddim ruoma chun an ṭhang ruol a (chu chu Tuipui Al a ni tah).

en: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
hmr: Kum sâwmpahni sûng chu Kedorlaomer hnuoiah an um a, a kum sâwm pathumnaa chun an hel tah a.

en: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim,
hmr: A kum sâwm palinaa chun Kedorlaomer le a kuoma lal umhai chu an hung a, Asteroth-karnaim khuoah Rephaimhai an that a, Ham khuoah Zuzimhai, Kiriathaim zâwlah Emimhai,

en: and the Horites in their mount Seir, unto El-paran, which is by the wilderness.
hmr: an umna Seir tlângah Elparan chenin Hormihai an that a, (Elparan chu thlalêr depa um a nih).

en: And they returned, and came to En-mishpat (the same is Kadesh), and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.
hmr: Chun, an kîr nâwk a, En-mispat an tlung a (chu chu Kades a ni tah). Amalekhai rama mi po le, Hazazon- tamara um, Amorhai khawm chu an that nâwk a.

en: And there went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar); and they set the battle in array against them in the vale of Siddim;
hmr: Chuongchun, Sodom lal, Gomor- ra lal, Adma lal, Zeboiim lal le Bela lal chu an suok a (Bela khuo chu Zoar khuo a ni tah); chun, anni chu thaw dingin Siddim ruoma chun an ṭhang tlat a.

en: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.
hmr: Elam lal Kedorlaomer, Goiim lal Tidal, Sinar lal Amraphel, le Ellasar lal Ariok chu thaw dingin, lal paliin lal panga an thawh a.

en: Now the vale of Siddim was full of slime pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and they fell there, and they that remained fled to the mountain.
hmr: Chun, Siddim ruom chu lawng hnâi khurin a sip a; chun, Sodom le Gomorra lalhai chu an tlânseh a, chu- taka chun an tlah a, a tla mahlahai chu tlânga chun an tlân hmang tah a.

en: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sodom le Gomor- ra mihai sum po po, le an fâk ding po po an lâk a, an kîr tah a.

en: And they took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
hmr: Lota, Abram unaupa naupa, Sodoma um chu, a sumhai leh an lâk bawk a, an fe tah a.

en: And there came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew: now he dwelt by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were confederate with Abram.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat tlânsuok chu a hung a, Hebrai mi Abram chu a hril a; ama chu Amor mi Mamre thingsai- suohai kâwla chun a um a, Mamre chu Eskol le Aner unau a na; chuong mihai chu Abram le ṭhang hmunkhat an nih.

en: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.
hmr: Abramin a nau chu salah an ṭhuoi ti a hriet phingleh a ina pieng, ama mi, inchûk thiemsa tah, za thum le sâwmpariet a ṭhuoi suok a, Dan chenin a hnawt tah a.

en: And he divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
hmr: Chun, zâna chun anni chu thaw dingin ama le a suokhai chu an insem dar a, annirawi chu an that a, Hoba chenin an hnawt a (Hoba chu Damaska hmâra um a nih).

en: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought back his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.
hmr: Chun, sum po po chu a hung lâkkîr nâwk vawng a, a naupa Lota le a sumhai chu a hung lâk nâwk vawng bawk a, a nuhmeihai khawm a hung ṭhuoi kîr a, mi danghai po po leh.

en: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him, after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings that were with him, at the vale of Shaveh (the same is the King’s Vale).
hmr: Chun, Kedorlaomer le a kuoma lal umhai chu thata a kîr nâwk chun, Sodom lal chu Save ruoma chun Abram tuok dingin a suok a (Save ruom chu lal ruom a ni tah).

en: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was priest of God Most High.
hmr: Chun, Salem lal Melkizedek chun bei le uoin a hung lâk a; ama chu Pathien Chunghnungtak thiempu a nih.

en: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth:
hmr: Chun, ama chun Abram chu mal a sâwm a, “Abram chu hnuoi le vân neitu, Pathien Chunghnungtak mal- sâwmin um sien;

en: and blessed be God Most High, who hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him a tenth of all.
hmr: i hmêlmahai i kuta petu Pathien Chunghnungtak chu inpâkin um raw se,” a ta. Abram chun ama chu iengkim sâwma pakhat a pêk a.

en: And the king of Sodom said unto Abram, Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.
hmr: Chun, Sodom lal chun Abram kuomah, “Mihriemhai hi mi pe la, sumhai hi chu nangin nei rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lifted up my hand unto Jehovah, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,
hmr: Abram chun Sodom lal kuoma chun, “Hnuoi le vân neitu LALPA Pathien Chunghnungtak tieng chun ka bân ka phar tah a nih;

en: that I will not take a thread nor a shoe-latchet nor aught that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:
hmr: pat zai khat khawm, ke- kawkhrui hlek khawm, i nei hrim hrim chu la dêr naw ning, chuong naw chun, ‘Abram chu keia sukhausak annâwm,’ ti rawi i tih:

en: save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men that went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.
hmr: tlangvâlhai fâk hmang le ka mi fepuihai chanvo bak naw chu la naw ning; Aner, Eskol le Mamre chun an chanvo chu la raw hai se,” a tih a.

en: After these things the word of Jehovah came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun, “Abram, ṭi naw rawh; kei hi i phaw le i lâwmman nasatak el chu ka nih,” tiin LALPA thu chu Abram kuomah mang angin a hung tlung a.

en: And Abram said, O Lord Jehovah, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and he that shall be possessor of my house is Eliezer of Damascus?
hmr: Abram ruok chun, “Aw LALPA Pathien, iengam mi pêng i ta? nau nei loin ka um sawng ding a na, ka ro inkhâwmtu ding chu Damaskaa mi Eliezer hi a ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.
hmr: Abram bawk chun, “Ngai ta, chi hrim hrim i mîn thlatir si nawh a; en ta, ka ina pieng siehlaw hi ka rohluotu ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And, behold, the word of Jehovah came unto him, saying, This man shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, “Ama kha i rohluotu ding ni naw nih, nanga rîla hung ra ding ngei chu i ro hluotu ding ni lem a tih,” tiin LALPA thu chu a kuomah a hung tlung tah a.

en: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and number the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
hmr: Chun, ama chu tuolah a ṭhuoi suok a, “Vân tieng khi en la, arasihai khi i tiem thei chun tiem ta khai,” a ta. Chun, ama bawkin, “I thlahai chu khieng zât khi la nîng an tih,” a ta.

en: And he believed in Jehovah; and he reckoned it to him for righteousness.
hmr: Chun, ama chun LALPA chu a ring a; chuongchun, ama chun chu chu a felnaah a ruotpêk tah a.

en: And he said unto him, I am Jehovah that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Hi ram hi hluo dinga pe ding cheha, Kaldaihai khuo Ura inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu che LALPA kha ka nih,” a ta.

en: And he said, O Lord Jehovah, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
hmr: Ama chun, “Aw Lalpa PATHIEN, hluong ka tih ti iengtin am hrieng ka ta?” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, Take me a heifer three years old, and a she-goat three years old, and a ram three years old, and a turtle-dove, and a young pigeon.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Bâwngla kum thum mi, kêlpui kum thum mi, berâmchal kum thum mi, le vaṭhu le pârva te mi hung lapêk rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he took him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each half over against the other: but the birds divided he not.
hmr: Chuongchun, chuong po po chu a hung lâk a, a laitakah a khawi seng a, a her pakhat chu a her khingtieng zâwna chun a sie seng a, vatehai ruok chu a khawi ve nawh a.

en: And the birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
hmr: Chun, vate sa-sel fa mihai chu saruonghai chunga chun an zu fu hlak a, Abram chun a lo hâwl hmang pei a.

en: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, a horror of great darkness fell upon him.
hmr: Nisa a tla dier dier laiin Abram chu a lo in dêr el a; chun, ngai ta, inthim nasatak thil râpthlâktak el hin ama a hung inkhum a.

en: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be sojourners in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Abram kuomah, “I thlahai chu anni ram ni loah mikhuolin la um an ta, chutaka chun suokin um an tih ti chiengtakin hre raw khai; chun, kum za li sukrinum an ta;

en: and also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
hmr: chun, an rawng an ibâwlpêk ding hnam chungthu khawm chu la ngaituong ka tih, chu hnunga chun sum tamtak neiin la hung suok an tih.

en: But thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
hmr: Nang ruok chu i thlatuhai kuom- ah thlamuongtakin fêng i ta, i lua kêlsam ṭo vawngin phûm an ti che.

en: And in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full.
hmr: Chun, suon linaa chun hitaka hin hung kîr nâwk an tih, Amorhai suolnahai hi a la kim hri si nawh,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch that passed between these pieces.
hmr: Chun, nisa a hung tlah a, khuo a hung inthim chun, ngai ta, rawtuina mei khu mup mup le chuong saherhai kâra chun meiser chawk vung vung inlawn inlawn a um a.

en: In that day Jehovah made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
hmr: Chu ni chun LALPA chun, “Hi ram hi Aigupta vadunga inthawka vadung lientak (Euphrates vadung) chenin i thlahai kuomah ka pêk tah.

en: the Kenite, and the Kenizzite, and the Kadmonite,
hmr: Ken-hai, Keniz-hai, Kadmon-hai,

en: and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Rephaim,
hmr: Hit-hai, Periz-hai, Rephaim-hai,

en: and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Girgashite, and the Jebusite.
hmr: Amor-hai, Kanaan-hai, Girgas- hai le, Jebus-hai ram le hin ka pêk bawk a,” tiin Abram kuoma chun thu a thlung tah a.

en: Now Sarai, Abram’s wife, bare him no children: and she had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
hmr: Chun, Sarai, Abram nuhmei chun, nau hrim hrim a neipêk dêr nawh a, Sarai chun Aigupta mi suoknu pakhat a nei a, a hming chu Hagar a nih.

en: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, Jehovah hath restrained me from bearing; go in, I pray thee, unto my handmaid; it may be that I shall obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
hmr: Chun, Sarai chun Abram kuom- ah, “Ngai ta khai, LALPAIN nau a mîn neitir phal naw hi, lungin- siettakin ka suoknu hi pâwl el rawh; amaa inthawk chun nauhai ka nei duoiin,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Abram chun Sarai thu chu a zâwm tah a.

en: And Sarai, Abram’s wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her handmaid, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu Kanaana kum sâwm a um hnung chun, Abram nuhmei Sarai chun a suoknu Aigupta mi Hagar chu a ṭhuoi a, a pasal Abram kuoma chun a nuhmeia um dingin a pêk tah a.

en: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
hmr: Ama chun Hagar chu a lo pâwl a: amanu chu ân rai tah a; chun ân rai ti ân hriet phingleh a pi chu a hung hmusit el tah a.

en: And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee: I gave my handmaid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: Jehovah judge between me and thee.
hmr: Chun, Sarai chun Abram kuomah, “Ka thil tuor hi nangin a maw phur rawh: ka suoknu chu i pawm dingin ka pêk cheh a; chun ân rai ti ân hriet phingleh a mi hmusit el tah a; LALPA chun kei le nanga thu hi ngaituo raw se,” a tih a.

en: But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her that which is good in thine eyes. And Sarai dealt hardly with her, and she fled from her face.
hmr: Abram ruok chun Sarai kuomah, “Ngai ta, i suoknu chu i kuta um annâwm, nanga remti ang ang chu a chungah thaw ta la,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Sarai chun a sukrimsi ta hleh a, chuleiin, a tlânhmangsan tah a.

en: And the angel of Jehovah found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Vântirko chun thlalêra tuikhur kâwl, Sur panna lampuia tuikhur kâwla chun a lo hmuh a.

en: And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s handmaid, whence camest thou? and whither goest thou? And she said, I am fleeing from the face of my mistress Sarai.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Hagar, Sarai suoknu, khawlaia inthawka hunga khawlaia fe ding am i nih a?” a ta. Ama chun, “Ka pi Sarai kuoma inthawkin ka tlânhmang a nih,” a ta.

en: And the angel of Jehovah said unto her, Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands.
hmr: LALPA vântirko chun a kuomah, “I pi kuomah kîr nâwk la, a thu thuin um rawh,” a ta.

en: And the angel of Jehovah said unto her, I will greatly multiply thy seed, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
hmr: LALPA vântirko chun a kuomah, “I thlahai chu tiem sênglo khawp hiela tamin la sukpung ka tih,” a ti bawk a.

en: And the angel of Jehovah said unto her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son; and thou shalt call his name Ishmael, because Jehovah hath heard thy affliction.
hmr: LALPA vântirko bawk chun a kuomah, “Ngai ta, nau i vawn tah a, naupasal nei i ta, LALPA chun i rimsikzie hi a hriet ta leiin a hminga chun Ismael i sak ding a nih.

en: And he shall be as a wild ass among men; his hand shall be against every man, and every man’s hand against him; and he shall dwell over against all his brethren.
hmr: Ama chu mihriem laia ram sabengtung ang nîng a ta, ama chun mi tin do a ta, mi tinin ama khawm do bawk an tih; a unau po po hnaiah um bawk a tih,” a ti nâwk bawk a.

en: And she called the name of Jehovah that spake unto her, Thou art a God that seeth: for she said, Have I even here looked after him that seeth me?
hmr: Chun, Hagarin ama betu LALPA hming chu, “Nang hi hmu theitu Pathien i nih,” tiin ân bûk a. “Hitaka ngei hin a mi hmutu chu ka hmu takzet am a nih aw?” a ti a nih.

en: Wherefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
hmr: Chuleichun, tuisunsuo chu “Beer-lahai-roi” inbûk a ni tah a; Kades le Bered khaw inkârah a um.

en: And Hagar bare Abram a son: and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bare, Ishmael.
hmr: Chun, Hagar chun Abram chu naupasal a neipêk a; chun, Abram chun a naupa Hagarin a nei chu a hmingah Ismael a sak tah a.

en: And Abram was fourscore and six years old, when Hagar bare Ishmael to Abram.
hmr: Chun, Hagarin Abram ta dinga Ismael a nei pêk lai chun Abram chu kum sawmriet le kum ruk mi a nih.

en: And when Abram was ninety years old and nine, Jehovah appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am God Almighty; walk before me, and be thou perfect.
hmr: Chun, Abram chu kum sawm- kuo pakuo mi a niin LALPA chu Abram kuomah a hung inlâr a, a kuomah, “Kei Pathien Iengkim- thawthei ka nih, ka hmaah um la, ṭha famkimin um rawh.

en: And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
hmr: Chuongchun, nang le ei kârah thu thlung ka ta, nasatakin sukpung ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And Abram fell on his face: and God talked with him, saying,
hmr: Chun, Abram chu a bawkkhup tah a; chun, Pathienin ama chu a biek a,

en: As for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be the father of a multitude of nations.
hmr: “Ngai ta, kei chun ka thuthlung chu i kuomah a nih ka thlung chu: chuongchun, chi tum tum, chi tamtak thlatu ni tâng i tih.

en: Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for the father of a multitude of nations have I made thee.
hmr: I hming khawm Abram ni ta naw nih a, i hming chu Abraham ni ta lem a tih, chi tamtak thlatu dingin ka siem ta che hi.

en: And I will make thee exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.
hmr: Nasatakin chi inthlatir ka ti cheh a, nangmaa chun chi ti khawp hiel dâm siem ka ta, nangmaa inthawkin lalhai hung suok bawk an tih.

en: And I will establish my covenant between me and thee and thy seed after thee throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God unto thee and to thy seed after thee.
hmr: Chun, kei le nang le i hnunga i thlahai an thla sâwng peihai chen inkârah kumkhaw thuthlung dingin ka thuthlung hi sukdet ka tih, i ta ding le i hnunga i thlahai ta dinga Pathien ka nina dingin.

en: And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land of thy sojournings, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.
hmr: Chun, i kuoma le i hnunga i thlahai kuoma chun, i khuolchâmna ram, Kanaan ram po po hi, kum- khaw ro dingin ka pêk ding cheu a nih; chun kei hi an Pathien nîng ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And God said unto Abraham, And as for thee, thou shalt keep my covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee throughout their generations.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bawkin Abraham kuoma chun, “Chun, nang chun chu, ka thuthlung hi i zâwm ding a nih; nang le i hnunga i thlahai an thla nâwksâwng pei chen khawmin in zâwm ding a nih.

en: This is my covenant, which ye shall keep, between me and you and thy seed after thee: every male among you shall be circumcised.
hmr: Hi hi kei le nang le i hnunga i thlahai kâra ka thuthlung i zâwm ding chu a nih: nangni laia pasal taphawt chu ser tan ding a nih.

en: And ye shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of a covenant betwixt me and you.
hmr: Chuongchun, in ser hmawr vuna chun sertanin in um ding a nih; chu chu nang le ei inkâra thuthlung inchikna chu nîng a tih.

en: And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every male throughout your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any foreigner that is not of thy seed.
hmr: Nangni laia ni riet mi chu in thla sâwng peihai chen khawmin, i thla ni kher lo, i ina pieng amani khawm, mikhuol kuoma tangka suma inchâwk amani khawm, pasal taphawt chu ser tan ding a nih.

en: He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
hmr: I ina pieng le i tangka suma i închâwk khawm ser tan ngei ding a nih: chuongchun, ka thuthlung chu kumkhaw thuthlung dingin in tisaa chun um tâng a tih.

en: And the uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken my covenant.
hmr: Chun, pasal ser tan lo, a ser hmawr vun tisaa sertana um naw chu, chu ngei chu a chipui laia sukbohmang nîng a ta: ama chun ka thuthlung chu a bawsiet a nih,” a ti nâwk a.

en: And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bawkin Abra- ham kuomah, “I nuhmei Sarai chu a hmingah Sarai ti ta naw ti nih a, a hming chu Sara ti ni ta lem a tih.

en: And I will bless her, and moreover I will give thee a son of her: yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; kings of peoples shall be of her.
hmr: Ama chu mal sâwm ka ta, chu bâka khawm amaa inthawk naupasal pêng ka ti che: anih, ama chu mal sâwm ka ta, chi tum tum thlatunu ni tâng a tih, hnam tum tum lalhai amaa inthawk chun la hung suok an tih,” a ti nâwk a.

en: Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a child be born unto him that is a hundred years old? and shall Sarah, that is ninety years old, bear?
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu a bawkkhup a, ân nui a, a lungrilin, “Kum za mi hin nau a nei ding am a nih? Sara kum sawmkuo mi chun nau a nei ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: And Abraham said unto God, Oh that Ishmael might live before thee!
hmr: Chun, Abraham bawk chun Pathien kuomah, “Ismael hi i hmaah um thei sienla aw!” a tih a.

en: And God said, Nay, but Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son; and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant for his seed after him.
hmr: Pathien chun, “Ni lo e, i nuhmei Sarain naupasal neipêk lem a ti che: a hmingah Isak i sak ding a nih: chun ka thuthlung chu ama hnunga a thlahai ta dinga kumkhaw thuthlung dingin a kuoma chun sukdet ka tih.

en: And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.
hmr: Ismael chungthu khawm hi ka ngaipêk che a nih: ngai ta, ama chu mal ka sâwm tah a, chi tamtak inthlatir ka ta, nasatakin sukpung bawk ka tih; ama chun lal sâwmpahni thlâng a ta, ama chu chi ropuitakah la siem ka tih.

en: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.
hmr: Ka thuthlung ruok chu, Sarain kum nâwk hieng ang huna a neipêk ding che, Isak chungah sukdet lem ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
hmr: A kuoma thu a hril zo chun Pathien chun Abraham chu a kai san tah a.

en: And Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all that were born in his house, and all that were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham’s house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as God had said unto him.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chun a naupa Ismael le a ina pieng po po le, a tangka suma a închâwk po pohai le Abraham sûnghai laia mi pasal taphawt chu a ṭhuoi a, Pathienin a kuoma a hril ta ang ngeiin, chu ni ngei chun an ser hmawr vun tisa chu a tanpêk tâwl a.

en: And Abraham was ninety years old and nine, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
hmr: Abraham chu a ser hmawr vun tisa an tan lai chun kum sawmkuo pakuo mi a nih.

en: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
hmr: Chun, a naupa Ismael chu a ser hmawr vun an tan lai chun kum sâwmpathum mi a nih.

en: In the selfsame day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his son.
hmr: Chu ni ngei chun Abraham le a naupa Ismael chu sertan an lo ni tah.

en: And all the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
hmr: A sûnghai laia pasal po po, a ina pienghai le ram dang mi tangka suma a în châwkhai khawm chu, ama ruol chun an ser tan a ni ta vawng a.

en: And Jehovah appeared unto him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day;
hmr: Abraham chu sûn nisa lum lai taka puon in kawtkhâr bula a ṭhung laiin, LALPA chu Mamre thingsaisuohai kâwla chun a kuomah a hung inlâr a.

en: and he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood over against him: and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself to the earth,
hmr: A hang dâk a, a thlîr a, a kâwl ela mi pathum lo ngir zing chu a hmuh a; a hmu phingleh puon in kawtkhâra inthawk anni chu tuok dingin a va tlân a, hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk a,

en: and said, My lord, if now I have found favor in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
hmr: “Pu, i mi lunginsiet thei chun lunginsiettakin in siehlaw hi mi fe khel lul naw ro khai,

en: let now a little water be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:
hmr: tui tlâwmte bêk hung la hai sienla, in kehai sâwp unla, thing hnuoia hin châwl hri ta u;

en: and I will fetch a morsel of bread, and strengthen ye your heart; after that ye shall pass on: forasmuch as ye are come to your servant. And they said, So do, as thou hast said.
hmr: bei tlawmte bêk va lâng ka ta, in lungril sukhar ro khai, chu hnunga chun fe pei de ti niu, in siehlaw hi in mi hung sir ta si si hin chu,” a tih a. Anni chun, “I hril ang chun va thaw rawh,” an tih a.

en: And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said, Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu puon in sûnga Sara kuoma chun a va lût vak a, “Beiphit indi tak tekhâwng thum siem la, hmet la, beiphêkhaiah siem rawh,” a ta.

en: And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetched a calf tender and good, and gave it unto the servant; and he hasted to dress it.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chu bâwngruol tieng a va tlân a, bâwngte ṭhatak hi a hung lâk a, siehlaw kuomah a pêk a; ama chun a lo siem vat vat a.

en: And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat.
hmr: Chun, nenetui kîng dâm, nenetui dâm, a bâwngte sa siem dâm chu a lâk a, an hmaah a va pêk tah a; chun, an fâk lai chun an kâwlah thing hnuoia chun a ngîr zing a.

en: And they said unto him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he said, Behold, in the tent.
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “I nuhmei Sara khawlai am a um a?” an tih a. Ama chun, “Saw puon ina sawn,” a tih a.

en: And he said, I will certainly return unto thee when the season cometh round; and, lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Hi hun hi a hung tlung nâwk pha chun i kuomah hung nâwk ngei ka tih, chun, i nuhmei Sara chun naupasal nei a tih,” a ta. Chun, a hnunga puon in kawtkhâr bula inthawk chun Sarain a lo hriet a.

en: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, and well stricken in age; it had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
hmr: Abraham le Sara chu upatak, tartak el an ni tah a; nuhmei dân pângngai chu Sara chun a nei ta nawh a.

en: And Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?
hmr: Chuongchun, Sarain, “Tar ka ni ta hnung hin, lâwmna nei ka ti maw, ka lalpa hlak tar a ni ta sih a?” tiin a lungrilin ân nui a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of a surety bear a child, who am old?
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Abraham kuomah, “Iengdinga Sarain,’ Tar ka ni hnung hin nau nei ka ti maw?’, tiha ân nui am a na?

en: Is anything too hard for Jehovah? At the set time I will return unto thee, when the season cometh round, and Sarah shall have a son.
hmr: LALPA ta dingin thil hrim hrim intak taluo a um am a nih? Hun ruotah, hun a tlung tiktik chun, i kuomah hung nâwk ka tih, chun Sara chun naupasal nei a tih,” a ta.

en: Then Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not; for she was afraid. And he said, Nay; but thou didst laugh.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sara chun, “Kân nui nawh,” tiin ân phah a; a ṭi sih a. Chun, ama chun, “Awi lo lo chu, în nui de kha,” a tih a.

en: And the men rose up from thence, and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
hmr: Chun, mihai chu chutaka inthawk chu an tho a, Sodom tieng chu an en a; chun, Abraham chu anni inthla dingin anni lai chun a fe veh a.

en: And Jehovah said, Shall I hide from Abraham that which I do;
hmr: LALPA chun, “Ka thilthaw ding hi Abraham kuoma hin ka ip ding am a ni aw?

en: seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
hmr: Abraham hi chi ropui le thilthawtheitak a la hung ni ngei ding a ni sih a, amaa chun khaw- vêla chi tin an la thawveng ding a ni sih a.

en: For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of Jehovah, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that Jehovah may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him.
hmr: LALPA lampui an hraw theina dingin, a hnunga a nauhai le a sûng- hai, thil feltaka thaw ding le rorêl anga thaw dinga thu a pêk theina dingin ama chu ka ruot ta sih a, a chungchâng thu a hril chu LALPAIN Abraham chunga ân tlungtir theina dingin,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous;
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun, “Sodom le Gomorra khêkri a nasa hlein, an suol a nasa êm êm a ni ngei a nih;

en: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.
hmr: tuhin zu fêng ka ta, an khêkri ka kuoma hung tlung ang hin an thaw ngei le an thaw ngei naw en ka ta; an thaw naw chun hre el ka tih,” a ta.

en: And the men turned from thence, and went toward Sodom: but Abraham stood yet before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, mihai chu chutaka inthawk chun an inher a, Sodom tieng an pan tah a; Abraham ruok chu LALPA hmaa chun a la ngir zing a.

en: And Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou consume the righteous with the wicked?
hmr: Chun, Abraham chun a va hnai a, “Mi felhai chu mi suolhai lai chun i sukbohmang ve ding am a nih?

en: Peradventure there are fifty righteous within the city: wilt thou consume and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are therein?
hmr: Khaw sûnga chun mi fel sâwmnga bêk an um el rawi mawh, a sûnga mi fel sâwmnga umhai lei chun khuo chu hla loin i sukbohmang el ding am a nih?

en: That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked, that so the righteous should be as the wicked; that be far from thee: shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
hmr: Nang êm chun, chuong ang êm chun, mi felhai chu mi suolhai anga an um vena dinga mi felhai chu mi suolhai laia sukhlum ve el chu i thaw awm êm si nawh a; nang êm chun i thaw âwm êm si nawh a: hnuoi chung po po Rorêltu chun feltakin a thaw naw ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sake.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Sodom sûnga chun mi fel sâwmnga khawm ka hmu chun anni lei chun khaw pumpui chu hla el ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord, who am but dust and ashes:
hmr: Abraham chun, “Ngai ta, kei pilvut le meivâm el hin Lalpa chu ka biek pawp sa ta che chu:

en: peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous: wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five? And he said, I will not destroy it, if I find there forty and five.
hmr: mi fel chu pangain sâwmnga an tling naw a ni rawi mawh; Pangaa an tling naw leiin khaw pumpui chu i sukbohmang ding am a nih?” a tih a. Chun, ama chun, “Chutaka chun sâwmli le panga khawm ka hmu chun sukbohmang naw ning,” a tih a.

en: And he spake unto him yet again, and said, Peradventure there shall be forty found there. And he said, I will not do it for the forty’s sake.
hmr: Ama chun ama chu a biek nâwk pei a, “Chutaka chun sâwmli bak i hmu el rawi mawh,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Sâwmli lei khawm chun sukbohmang naw ning,” a ta.

en: And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak: peradventure there shall thirty be found there. And he said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw, Lalpa chu lunginsen naw la, hril nâwk ka tih: chutaka chun sâwmthum chau i hmu el rawi mawh,” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Chutaka chun sâwmthum khawm ka hmu chun sukbohmang naw el ka tih,” a ta.

en: And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord: peradventure there shall be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for the twenty’s sake.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ngai ta, Lalpa chu ka biek pawp sa ta che; chutaka chun sâwmhni bak i hmu el rawi mawh,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Sâwmhni lei khawm chun sukbohmang naw ning,” a ta.

en: And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once: peradventure ten shall be found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for the ten’s sake.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw Lalpa, lunginsen naw la, vawikhat bak hang hril nâwk ka tih; chutaka chun sâwm bak i hmu el rawi mawh,” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Sâwm lei khawm chun sukbohmang naw ning,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah went his way, as soon as he had left off communing with Abraham: and Abraham returned unto his place.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu Abraham le an inbiek zo phingleh a fe tah a, Abraham chu ama umna tieng a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And the two angels came to Sodom at even; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom: and Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them; and he bowed himself with his face to the earth;
hmr: Vântirko pahni chu zântieng chun Sodom khuo an tlung a, Lota chu Sodom khaw kul kawtkhâra chun a lo ṭhung a: Lotain anni a lo hmu chun lâwm dingin a ngîr a, a hmaia hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk tah a;

en: and he said, Behold now, my lords, turn aside, I pray you, into your servant’s house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your way. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.
hmr: chun, “Puhai, lunginsiettakin in siehlaw ina hin lût phawt unla, riek unla, in kehai sâwp ro khai: chun, inhmatakin tho in ta, fe nâwk de ti niu,” a tih a. Anni chun, “Ni lo e, khawlaiah riek lem kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And he urged them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his house; and he made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun a thlêm a thlêm a; chuongchun, ama chu an zui a, a ina chun an lût a: chun, ama chun hme a siempêk a, chawl ṭhanglo bei a zeu a, an fâk tah a.

en: But before they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom, compassed the house round, both young and old, all the people from every quarter;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an zâl hmain khuoa mi, Sodoma mi ngei, vêng tina mi po po, alien achînin in chu an inhuol khup el a;

en: and they called unto Lot, and said unto him, Where are the men that came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may know them.
hmr: chun, Lota chu an ko a, a kuomah, “Vawizâna i kuoma mi hung lûthai kha khawlai am an um a? Anni kan pâwl theina dingin kan kuomah hung ṭhuoi suok rawh,” an tih a.

en: And Lot went out unto them to the door, and shut the door after him.
hmr: Lota chu kawtkhâr bulah an kuoma chun a va suok a, kawt chu a khâr nâwk a.

en: And he said, I pray you, my brethren, do not so wickedly.
hmr: Chun, “Ka unauhai, lunginsiet- takin chuong ang êm êm chun suol da ta unla;

en: Behold now, I have two daughters that have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing, forasmuch as they are come under the shadow of my roof.
hmr: ngai ta u, pasal la pâwl ngailo naunuhmei pahni ka nei a: mi lunginsiet unla, anni chu in kuomah hung ṭhuoi suok ka tih, ṭha in ti ang peiin an chungah thaw de ti niu: hihai chunga ruok hin chu iengkhawm thaw lul naw ro khai; achu lei taka chu ka in sûnga hin hung lût an ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And they said, Stand back. And they said, This one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a judge: now will we deal worse with thee, than with them. And they pressed sore upon the man, even Lot, and drew near to break the door.
hmr: Anni chun, “Inkieng el rawh ie,” an tih a. Anni bawk chun, “Hi mipa hrep hi hitaka um ding hin a hung inpêm lût a, rorêltua um a tum vei a! Tuhin chu anni chunga thaw nêk hmanin i chungah kan thaw ṭha naw nâwk zuol ding a nih,” an tih a. Chun, mi (Lota) chu an hung baw huk a, kawtkhâr chu sukse dingin an hung hnai a.

en: But the men put forth their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and shut to the door.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mihai chun an kut an pur dawka Lota chu an kuomah in sûnga chun an kei lût a, kawt chu an khâr ta tlat a.

en: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great, so that they wearied themselves to find the door.
hmr: Chun, kawtkhâr bula mihai chu alien achînin, an mit an sukdelpêk a; chuongchun, kawtkhâr chu an hmu zo ta nawh a.

en: And the men said unto Lot, Hast thou here any besides? son-in-law, and thy sons, and thy daughters, and whomsoever thou hast in the city, bring them out of the place:
hmr: Chun, mihai chun Lota kuom- ah, “Hienghai naw hi hitaka hin sûnghai dang i nei am? I mâkpahai, i naupasalhai, i naunuhmeihai le khaw sûnga i nei taphawt chu hi hmuna inthawk ṭhuoi suok rawh.

en: for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxed great before Jehovah; and Jehovah hath sent us to destroy it.
hmr: LALPA hmaa chun an khêkri chu a lo nasa ta hle leiin hi khuo hi kan sukbohmang ding a nih; sukbohmang dingin LALPA chun a mi tir bawk sih a,” an tih a.

en: And Lot went out, and spake unto his sons-in-law, who married his daughters, and said, Up, get you out of this place; for Jehovah will destroy the city. But he seemed unto his sons-in-law as one that mocked.
hmr: Chuongchun, Lota chu a fe suok a, a naunuhmeihai neitu a mâkpahai kuoma chun a va hril a, “Tho unla, hi hmuna inthawk hin suok ro; LALPAIN khuo hi a sukbohmang ding a nih,” a tih a. Nisienlakhawm, a mâkpahai ngaia chun fiemthu hril ang chau a nih.

en: And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife, and thy two daughters that are here, lest thou be consumed in the iniquity of the city.
hmr: Vârṭien a hung ni chun vântirkohai chun, “Tho la, i nuhmei le i naunuhmei pahni umhai hi ṭhuoi rawh, chuong naw chun, hi khaw hremnaa hin bohmang ve rawi in tih,” tiin Lota chu an tur tah a.

en: But he lingered; and the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his wife, and upon the hand of his two daughters, Jehovah being merciful unto him: and they brought him forth, and set him without the city.
hmr: Ama hlak chu a la muong hle sih a; chuongchun, LALPAIN ama chu a lunginsiet leiin mihai chun a kuta le a nuhmei kuta le, a naunuhmeihai pahni kuta chun an chel a, chuong- chun, an ṭhuoi suok a, khawhnâwma chun an sie tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said, Escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the Plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed.
hmr: Chun, khawhnâwma an ṭhuoi suok hnung chun, “I hringna dingin tlân suok rawh: i hnungtieng ngha naw la, phaizâwla hrim hrim hin châwl bawk naw rawh; tlânga sawn tlân rawh, chuong naw chun, bohmang rawi i tih,” a tih a.

en: And Lot said unto them, Oh, not so, my lord:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Lota chun a kuomah, “Chuongchu ni lo e, Pu,

en: behold now, thy servant hath found favor in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy lovingkindness, which thou hast showed unto me in saving my life; and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest evil overtake me, and I die:
hmr: ngai ta, i siehlaw hin i lungin- sietna a hmuh a, ka hringna hi humhimin i zângaina chu nasatakin i suklang a; nisienlakhawm, tlânga sawn chu tlân thei naw ningah: thil ṭha nawtak hin mi hung nangin thi hlau rawi ka tih.

en: behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one. Oh let me escape thither (is it not a little one?), and my soul shall live.
hmr: En ta, saw khuo saw tlânna dingin a hnai tak a, khaw chite a ni bawk siha, chutaka chun (khaw chite ni lo am a nih?) mîn tlântir lem rawh, chuongchun, dam ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which thou hast spoken.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Ngai ta, chu thil kawnga khawm chun ka zâwm che a nih, khuo i hril chu sukbohmang naw el ka tih.

en: Haste thee, escape thither; for I cannot do anything till thou be come thither. Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
hmr: Inhmaw la, chutaka chun tlân rawh, chu chu i tlung hmakhat chu iengkhawm ka thaw thei âwm si nawh a,” a tih a. Chuleiin, chu khaw hminga chun Zoar an inbûk tah a.

en: The sun was risen upon the earth when Lot came unto Zoar.
hmr: Lotain Zoar a tlung chun hnuoi chunga chun nisa a hung suok tah a.

en: Then Jehovah rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from Jehovah out of heaven;
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Sodom le Gomorra chunga chun vâna LALPA kuoma inthawk kât le mei ân sûrtir a;

en: and he overthrew those cities, and all the Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.
hmr: chuongchun, chuong khuohai chu, phaizâwl po po, khuoa mi po pohai le, hnuoia thil mâwnghai le chun a sukbohmang ta vawng a.

en: But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.
hmr: A nuhmei ruok chu Lota hnunga inthawk chun a ngha kîr a, chikhâwn banah a lo inchang tah a.

en: And Abraham gat up early in the morning to the place where he had stood before Jehovah:
hmr: Chun, Abraham chu zîngkâr inhmatakin LALPA hmaa a ngirna hmuna khan a hang feh a;

en: and he looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the Plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace.
hmr: Sodom le Gomorra khaw tieng le, phaizâwl po po tieng chu a thlîr a, a en zing a: chun, ngai ta, chu rama meikhu chu rawtuina meikhu ang elin a khu tung lui lui el a.

en: And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot dwelt.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin phaizâwl khuohai chu a sukbohmang lai chun, Pathienin Abraham chu a hriet zing a, Lota umna khuohai a sukbohmang laiin Lota chu bohmangnaa inthawk a tir suok a.

en: And Lot went up out of Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.
hmr: Chun, Lota chu Zoara inthawk chun a hang feh a, tlânga chun a um a, a naunuhmeihai pahni chu a kuomah an um veh a; Zoarah a um ngam si nawh a: chun, ama le a naunuhmeihai pahni chu pûkah an um tah a.

en: And the first-born said unto the younger, Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth:
hmr: Chun, a upa lem chun a naupang lem kuoma chun, “Ei pa hi a upa tah a, khawvêl po po dân anga eini mi pâwl dingin hnuoi chunga hin pasal pakhat khawm an um ta si nawh a:

en: come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
hmr: thaw rawh, ei pa hi uoin indâwntir ei ti khai, chuongchun, ei pa suonmawng loa ei siem theina dingin a kuomah zâl ei tih,” a tih a.

en: And they made their father drink wine that night: and the first-born went in, and lay with her father; and he knew not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu zân chun an pa chu uoin an indâwntir tah a; chun, a upa lem chu a lût a, a pa kâwla chun a va zâl a; ama chun amanu hung zâl lai chu a hriet nawh a, a tho nâwk lai khawm chu a hriet bawk nawh a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the first-born said unto the younger, Behold, I lay yesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun a upa lem chun a naupang lem kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, zâni zân khan ka pa kâwlah ka zâl a; vawizân khawm hin uoin indâwntir nâwk ei ti khai; chun, nang lût la, ei pa suonmawng loa ei siem theina dingin a kâwlah va zâl ve rawh,” a ta.

en: And they made their father drink wine that night also: and the younger arose, and lay with him; and he knew not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu zân khawm chun an pa chu uoin an indâwntir nâwk a: chun, a naupang lem chu a tho a, a kuomah a va zâl tah a; ama chun amanu hung zâl lai chu a hriet nawh a, a tho nâwk lai khawm chu a hriet bawk nawh.

en: Thus were both the daughters of Lot with child by their father.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Lota naunuhmeihai pahni chun an paa inthawk chun nau an lo vawn tah a.

en: And the first-born bare a son, and called his name Moab: the same is the father of the Moabites unto this day.
hmr: A upa lem chun naupasal a nei a, a hmingah Moab a sak a: ama chu tulaia Moab mihai thlatu a nih.

en: And the younger, she also bare a son, and called his name Ben-ammi: the same is the father of the children of Ammon unto this day.
hmr: A naupang lem khawm chun naupasal a nei veh a, a hmingah Ben-ammi a sak a; ama chu tulaia Ammon thlahai thlatu a nih.

en: And the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
hmr: Chuongchun, hnuoi le vân chu an chunga umhai po po le chun siem zo a ni tah a.

en: And on the seventh day God finished his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin ni sari nia chun a thilsiem chu a thaw zo a; ni sari nia chun a thilsiem po po chu a châwlsan tah a.

en: And God blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it; because that in it he rested from all his work which God had created and made.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin ni sari ni chu mal a sâwm a, ân ser tah a: chu ni chun Pathienin a thilsiem po po, thu ngawta a siem le kuta a siemhai chu a châwlsan ta leiin.

en: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Jehovah God made earth and heaven.
hmr: Hnuoi le vân siem an ni lai khan an thlahai chu hieng hi an nih, LALPA Pathienin hnuoi le vân a siem nia khan.

en: And no plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Jehovah God had not caused it to rain upon the earth: and there was not a man to till the ground;
hmr: Hnuoia hlo hrim hrim hi hnuoiah a la um nawh a, hnuoia thlai hrim hrim khawm hi a mâwng bawk nawh. LALPA Pathienin hnuoi chungah ruo a lân sûrtir si nawh a, hnuoi inlettu dingin mihriem hlak an la um bawk nawh;

en: but there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
hmr: amiruokchu, hnuoia inthawkin sûm a hung suok a, hnuoi chung po po chu a sukhnâwng a.
