en: And Jehovah God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathienin hnuoia pilvutin mihriem a siem a, a hnâra chun hringna thuok chu ân thuok lût a; chuongchun, mihriem chu mi hring a hung ni tah a.

en: And Jehovah God planted a garden eastward, in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathienin sak- tieng Edena chun huon a siem a; a mihriem siem chu chutaka chun ân umtir a.

en: And out of the ground made Jehovah God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia inthawkin, LALPA Pathienin thing mitlatak le fâkmi tinrêng ân mâwngtir a; hringna thing khawm huon lailung taka chun ân mâwngtir bawk a; a suol le a ṭha hrietna thing khawm.

en: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became four heads.
hmr: Chun, Edena inthawkin huon sukhnâwng dingin vadung a luong suok a; chutaka inthawk chun ân ṭhe dar a, pali a hung ni tah a.

en: The name of the first is Pishon: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
hmr: A pakhatna hming chu Pison a na; chu chu Havila ram po po luong huoltu chu a nih; chutaka chun rângkachak a um a;

en: and the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
hmr: chu rama rângkachak chu ṭhatak a nih; chutaka chun delium le onik lung khawm a um.

en: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Cush.
hmr: Vadung pahnina hming chu Gihon a nih; chu chu Kus  ram po po luong huoltu chu a nih.

en: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth in front of Assyria. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
hmr: Vadung pathumna hming chu Hiddekel a nih; chu chu Assuria ram saktienga luong chu a nih. Vadung palina chu Euphrates a nih.

en: And Jehovah God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
hmr: LALPA Pathien chun mihriem chu a ṭhuoi a, Eden huona chun enkawltu le vêngtu dingin a sie tah a.

en: And Jehovah God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun mihriem kuomah, “Huona thing tinrêng rahai hi i nuom nuomin i fâk thei a,

en: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
hmr: a suol le a ṭha hrietna thing ra ruok hi chu i fâk ding a ni nawh; i fâk chun i fâk ni ngeiin i thi ngei ding a nih,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: And Jehovah God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a help meet for him.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun, “Mihriem ama khât baka a um hi a ṭha nawh ie; ama ṭhangpuitu ding, ân kawppui ding âwm mî siempêk ka tih ie,” a ta.

en: And out of the ground Jehovah God formed every beast of the field, and every bird of the heavens; and brought them unto the man to see what he would call them: and whatsoever the man called every living creature, that was the name thereof.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun pilin ramsa tinrêng le chunglêng vate tinrêng chu a siem a; an hmingah ieng ieng am ân bûk ding ti hrietna dingin mihriem kuoma chun a ṭhuoi tâwl a; chun, thilhring tinrênghai chu mihriem chun an hming a lo inbûk po chu an hming a ni sawng tah a.

en: And the man gave names to all cattle, and to the birds of the heavens, and to every beast of the field; but for man there was not found a help meet for him.
hmr: Chuongchun, mihriem chun ran po po dâm, chunglêng vate dâm, ramsa tinrêng dâm hming chu a sak seng a; nisienlakhawm, mihriem ta ding chun a ṭhangpuitu ding a kawppui âwm mi a um nawh a.

en: And Jehovah God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and he slept; and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof:
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA Pathien chun mihriem chu inhniktakin ân intir a; chuongchun, a in tah a; chun, a nâkru pakhat a lâk a, chu ai chu tisain ân hluosiptir a;

en: and the rib, which Jehovah God had taken from the man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.
hmr: chun, LALPA Pathien chun mihriema inthawka a lâk nâkru chu nuhmeiah a siem a, mihriem kuoma chun a ṭhuoi a.

en: And the man said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.
hmr: Chun, mihriem chun, “Hi zet hi chu ka ru ang ru neia, ka tisa ang tisa nei ngei chu a nih; Pasala inthawka lâk suok a ni leiin, ‘Nuhmei’ ti ding nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
hmr: Chuleiin, pasalin a nu le pa mâksan a ta, a nuhmei chel a tih, chuongchun, tisa pumkhat hung ni tâng an tih.

en: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
hmr: Chun, pasal le a nuhmei chu an pahni chun saruokin an um a, an inzak chuong nawh a.

en: And Abraham journeyed from thence toward the land of the South, and dwelt between Kadesh and Shur; and he sojourned in Gerar.
hmr: Abraham chu Mamrea in- thawk chun Sim ram tieng panin ân tâwl a; Kades le Sur inkârah umhmun a khuor a; Gerarah a um hri tah a.

en: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She is my sister: and Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.
hmr: Chun, Abrahamin a nuhmei Sara chu, “Ka farnu a nih,” a tih a: chuongchun, Gerar lal Abimelek chun mi a tir a, Sara chu a vân ṭhuoitir tah a.

en: But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to him, Behold, thou art but a dead man, because of the woman whom thou hast taken; for she is a man’s wife.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien chu Abimelek kuomah zânah a mangah a hung a, a kuomah, “Ngai ta, i nuhmei ṭhuoi lei hin mi thi el i ni tah; mi nuhmei a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: Now Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, Lord, wilt thou slay even a righteous nation?
hmr: Abimelek ruok chun a la pâwl hri nawh a; chuongchun, “Lalpa, pawi tâwklo mi khawm i sukhlum ding am a nih?

en: Said he not himself unto me, She is my sister? and she, even she herself said, He is my brother: in the integrity of my heart and the innocency of my hands have I done this.
hmr: Ama ngei khawmin ka kuomah, ‘Ka farnu a nih’ a ti ni lo am a nih? Chun amanu (Sara) ngei khawmin, ‘Ka ṭapa a nih,’ a ti bawk sih a: lungril ṭhatak le kut inthiengtak nei pumin hi hi ka thaw a nih,” a tih a.

en: And God said unto him in the dream, Yea, I know that in the integrity of thy heart thou hast done this, and I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a manga chun, “Anih, hi hi lungril ṭhatak putin i thaw a nih ti ka hriet a; chuongchun, kei khawmin ka chunga i thil thaw suol ding chu ka khap che a nih; chuleiin a nih ama i them ka phal naw chu.

en: Now therefore restore the man’s wife; for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.
hmr: Chuongchun, tuhin mi nuhmei kha pe kîr nâwk rawh; ama chu zâwl- nei a ni sih a, ṭawngṭaipêk a ti cheh a; chun, dam el i tih: i pêk kîr nâwk naw chun i thi ngei ding a nih ti hre rawh, nang le i nei po pohai leh,” a tih a.

en: And Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abimelek chu zîng- kâr inhmatakin a tho a, a siehlawhai po po a ko a, an na hrietah chuong thu po po chu a hril a: anni chun an ṭi ta êm êm a.

en: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us? and wherein have I sinned against thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abimelek chun Abraham a ko a, a kuomah, “Kan chunga i thil thaw hi iengtizie am a nih a? Ieng kawng âm i chungah thil kan suksuola kei le ka khuoletui- hai chunga hin thil suol nasatak i hung intlungtir hi? Thil thaw âwm naw tak ka chungah i thaw ta hi,” a tih a.

en: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?
hmr: Abimelek bawk chun Abraham kuomah, “Iengam i ngaituoha hieng ang thil hi thaw i nih a?” a ti nâwk a.

en: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife’s sake.
hmr: Abraham chun, “Hi khuoa hin Pathien ṭina a um dêr naw a ni ka ring a, ka nuhmei lei hin mi sukhlum el in tih ti ka ring lei a nih.

en: And moreover she is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife:
hmr: Chu nâksapah ka farnu a ni hrim bawk a, ka pa naunu a nih a, ka nu naunu ruok chu a ni nawh; chun, ka nuhmei a hung ni tah a nih.

en: and it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father’s house, that I said unto her, This is thy kindness which thou shalt show unto me: at every place whither we shall come, say of me, He is my brother.
hmr: Pathienin ka pa ina inthawka a mîn vaitir lai khan a kuomah, ‘Hi hi i lunginsietna ka chunga înlangtir ding chu a nih: ei tlungna hmun taphawtah, ‘Ka ṭapa a nih,’ mi ti pei rawh ka ti hrim a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and men-servants and women-servants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.
hmr: Chun, Abimelek chun berâm- hai, bâwngchalhai le, suokpahai le suoknuhai a ṭhuoi a, Abraham kuoma chun a pêk a, a nuhmei Sara khawm chu a pêk kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.
hmr: Chun, Abimelek chun, “En ta, ka ram a um duoi annâwm, i nuomna taphawta hin um rawh,” a ta.

en: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, it is for thee a covering of the eyes to all that are with thee; and in respect of all thou art righted.
hmr: Chun, Sara kuoma chun, “En ta, i ṭapa kuoma hin tangka sâng khat ka pêk tah a, ngai ta, i kuoma um po pohaia inthawka mit inkhumna ding a ni hi: i chungthu hrim hrima hin i fel nâwk vawng tah a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham prayed unto God: and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maid-servants; and they bare children.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu Pathien kuomah a ṭawngṭai a; chun Pathienin Abimelek le a nuhmei le a suoknuhai chu a sukdam nâwk a; chuongchun, nauhai an hung nei nâwk tah a.

en: For Jehovah had fast closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham’s wife.
hmr: Abraham nuhmei Sara lei chun LALPA chun Abimelek sûnghai po po chu a lo sukching tâwl ta sih a.

en: And Jehovah visited Sarah as he had said, and Jehovah did unto Sarah as he had spoken.
hmr: LALPA chun a hril ta angin Sara chu a zu kan a, LALPA chun a tiem ta angin Sara chungah a thawpêk bawk a.

en: And Sarah conceived, and bare Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sara chu ân rai a, Pathienin a kuoma a hril hun ruot taka chun Abraham chu a tar hnungin naupasal a neipêk tah a.

en: And Abraham called the name of his son that was born unto him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.
hmr: Abraham chun a naupasal nei, Sarain a neipêk chu a hmingah Isak a sak a.

en: And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
hmr: Chun, Abrahamin Pathienin a kuoma thu a pêk ang khan, a naupa Isak chu ni riet a tlingin a ser a tanpêk a.

en: And Abraham was a hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him.
hmr: Abraham chu a naupa Isak a nei lai chun kum za mi a nih.

en: And Sarah said, God hath made me to laugh; every one that heareth will laugh with me.
hmr: Chun, Sara chun, “Pathienin a mi suknui tah; mi tin a hre taphawt chun mîn nuipui an tih,” a tih a.

en: And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should give children suck? for I have borne him a son in his old age.
hmr: Ama bawk chun, “Sara hin nautehai a la pawm ding a nih ti tuin am Abraham kuomah hril ngaina hrieng an ta? a tar hnung hin naupasal ka neipêk ta hi,” a tih a.

en: And the child grew, and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
hmr: Chun, naute chu a hung inṭhang a, nene nêk an inbântir tah a, Isak chu nene nêk an inbântir ni chun Abrahamin ruoi ropuitak a ṭheh a.

en: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne unto Abraham, mocking.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mi, Hagar naupa, Abraham ta dinga a neipêk chun a nuisan lai Sara chun a hmuh a.

en: Wherefore she said unto Abraham, Cast out this handmaid and her son: for the son of this handmaid shall not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.
hmr: Chuleichun, Abraham kuoma chun, “Hi suoknu le a naupa hi hnawt suok rawh; hi suoknu naupa hi ka naupa Isak ro hluopuitu ding ni thei naw nih,” a tih a.

en: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham’s sight on account of his son.
hmr: Chu thu chu a naupa Ismael lei chun Abraham ta ding chun lung- ngaithlâk tak a nih.

en: And God said unto Abraham, Let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy handmaid; in all that Sarah saith unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathienin Abraham kuoma chun, “Naupang le i suoknu chungchâng thu lei hin beidawng naw rawh: Sarain i kuoma thu a hril po po chu zâwm rawh, Isaka hin i thlahai an la ti ding a ni sih a.

en: And also of the son of the handmaid will I make a nation, because he is thy seed.
hmr: Chun, suoknu naupaa khawm hin i thla a ni leiin chi ti khawp zet la siem ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it unto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and gave her the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu zîngkâr inhmatakin a tho a, bei le tuiûm a lâk a, Hagar kuomah a pêk a, a liengkoah ân chuonpêk a, naupang le chun ân fetir tah a; chuongchun, a feh a, Beer-seba thlalêra chun ân vâk ân vâk tah a.

en: And the water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.
hmr: Chun, tuiûma tui chu a hung bo tah a, chuongchun, naupang chu chîmbuk pakhat hnuoiah a sie el tah a.

en: And she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bowshot: for she said, Let me not look upon the death of the child. And she sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept.
hmr: Chun, “Naupang thi ding chu ka en ngam nawh,” a ti leiin a feh a, hla fe thal kâp phâk ding chena hin, a hma zâwna chun a va ṭhung ta chawt a. Chuonga a hma zâwna a ṭhung lai chun inringtakin a ṭap tah a.

en: And God heard the voice of the lad; and the angel of God called to Hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? fear not; for God hath heard the voice of the lad where he is.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin naupang râwl chu a hriet a, chun Pathien vântir- koin vâna inthawkin Hagar chu a zuk ko a, a kuomah, “Hagar, iengin am a sukbuoi che leh? ṭi naw; a umnaa naupang râwl kha Pathienin a hriet a nih.

en: Arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thy hand; for I will make him a great nation.
hmr: Tho la, naupang kha keitho la, i kutin chel rawh, ama chu chi ropuitakah ka siem ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a mit a sukvarpêk a, tuisunsuo a hmu tah a: chuongchun, a va feh a, tuiûma chun tui chu a thun sip a, naupang chu ân dâwntir tah a.

en: And God was with the lad, and he grew; and he dwelt in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer.
hmr: Chun, Pathien chu naupang kuoma chun a um hlak a, a hung inṭhang lien pei a; thlalêrah a um hlak a, thal kâp thiem mi a hung ni tah a.

en: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took him a wife out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Paran thlalêra chun a um a; chun, a nuin Aigupta rama inthawk nuhmei a neipêk tah a.

en: And it came to pass at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his host spake unto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest:
hmr: Chuong lai chun Abimelek le a sipai pâwl hotu Phikol chun Abraham kuomah, “I thilthaw taphawtah Pathien i kuomah a um pei hlak a:

en: now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son: but according to the kindness that I have done unto thee, thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.
hmr: chuleiin, ka lo lunginsiet ta che ang khan kei le hi i khuolchâmna ram hi lunginsiet ve thunga, kei le ka nau- pa le ka naupa naupa khawm hlêm lo dingin Pathien hming sâlin tuhin ka kuomah inkhâm rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham said, I will swear.
hmr: Abraham chun, “Inkhâm ta naw ning am,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of the well of water, which Abimelech’s servants had violently taken away.
hmr: Chun, Abimelek siehlawhaiin tuisunsuo an lâkpêk lei chun Abimelek chu Abraham chun a lo kâwk a.

en: And Abimelech said, I know not who hath done this thing: neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to-day.
hmr: Abimelek chun, “Chu thil thawtu chu tu am a nih ka hriet dêr nawh a; nang hlakin i mi hril si nawh a, vawisûn chau naw chu ka la hriet dêr nawh,” a ta.

en: And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and they two made a covenant.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chun berâmhai le bâwngchalhai a ṭhuoi a, Abimelek kuomah a pêk a: chun, an pahni chun thu an thlung tah a.

en: And Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.
hmr: Abraham chun a berâm ruol laia mi berâmte a la pasari a sie tum a.

en: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves?
hmr: Abimelek chun Abraham kuomah, “Berâmte a la pasari a tuma i sie hi ieng tina am a na?” a ta.

en: And he said, These seven ewe lambs shalt thou take of my hand, that it may be a witness unto me, that I have digged this well.
hmr: Ama chun, “Hi tuisunsuo hi keiin ka icho a nih ti i mi hrietpuina dingin hi berâmte a la pasari hi ka kuta inthawkin i lâk ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: Wherefore he called that place Beer-sheba; because there they sware both of them.
hmr: Chuleichun, chu hmun chu Beer-seba ân bûk a: chutaka chun an pahniha ṭawng an inkhâm rêl leiin.

en: So they made a covenant at Beer-sheba: and Abimelech rose up, and Phicol the captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
hmr: Chuongchun, Beer-sebaa chun thu an thlung tah a: chun, Abimelek chu a tho a, a sipai pâwl hotu Phikol leh Philistinhai rama chun an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beer-sheba, and called there on the name of Jehovah, the Everlasting God.
hmr: Abraham chun Beer-sebaa chun tamarisk thing a phun a, chutaka chun LALPA Chatuon Pathien hming chu a lam a.

en: And Abraham sojourned in the land of the Philistines many days.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu Philistin mihai rama chun sâwttak a um a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that God did prove Abraham, and said unto him, Abraham; and he said, Here am I.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun Pathienin Abraham chu a fieh a, a kuomah, “Abraham” a ta. Ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um” a ta.

en: And he said, Take now thy son, thine only son, whom thou lovest, even Isaac, and get thee into the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt-offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of.
hmr: Chun, Pathien chun, “I naupa, i naupasal nei sun, i lunginsiettak, Isak ngei kha ṭhuoi la, Moria rama chun fe la, chutaka chun tlâng pakhat hril ka ti cheh a, pumrawhmang inhlânah inhlân rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son; and he clave the wood for the burnt-offering, and rose up, and went unto the place of which God had told him.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chu zîngkâr inhmatakin a tho a, a sabengtung a siem a, a kuomah a siehlaw tlangvâl pahni a ṭhuoi a, a naupa Isak le chun; chun, pumrawhmanga inthawina ding chun thing a chêk a, a tho a, Pathienin a hrilna hmun tieng chun a fe tah a.

en: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.
hmr: A ni thum nia chun Abraham chun a hang en a, a hmun chu hlatakah a hang hmuh a.

en: And Abraham said unto his young men, Abide ye here with the ass, and I and the lad will go yonder; and we will worship, and come again to you.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chun a siehlaw tlangvâlhai kuoma chun, “Hitaka hin sabengtung le hin lo um ro, kei le naupang hi sawtaka sawn fêng kan ta; chun Pathien va bieng kan ta, in kuomah hung kîr nâwk kan tih,” a ta.

en: And Abraham took the wood of the burnt-offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took in his hand the fire and the knife; and they went both of them together.
hmr: Abraham chun pumrawhmang inhlânna thing chu a lâk a, a naupa Isak chu ân puttir a: ama chun mei le chemte a chawi a, chuongchun, an pahni chun an fe tah a.

en: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold, the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt-offering?
hmr: Chun, Isakin a pa Abraham chu a biek a, “Pa,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um, ka naupa,” a tih a. Chun, ama chun, “En ta, mei le thing chu a um a; anleh pumrawhmanga inhlân ding berâmte chu khawlai am a um a?” a tih a.

en: And Abraham said, God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt-offering, my son: so they went both of them together.
hmr: Abraham chun, “Ka naupa, Pathienin ama ta dinga pumraw- hmang inthawina ding berâmte chu ngaituo fâwm el a tih,” a tih a: chuong- chun, an pahni chun an fe pei tah a.

en: And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, upon the wood.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a hril hmun chu an va tlung a; Abraham chun chutaka chun mâichâm a siem a, thing chu a sep khâwm a, a naupa Isak chu a khuop a, mâichâma thing chunga chun ân zâltir a.

en: And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.
hmr: Chun, Abrahamin a kutin a ban a, a naupa sukhlumna dingin chemte chu a lâk a.

en: And the angel of Jehovah called unto him out of heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA vântir- koin vâna inthawkin ama chu a zuk ko a, “Abraham, Abraham,” a zuk tih a; ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um,” a ta.

en: And he said, Lay not thy hand upon the lad, neither do thou anything unto him; for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son, from me.
hmr: Ama chun, “Naupang chunga khan i kut thlâk naw la, ama kha iengkhawm law naw rawh; i naupasal nei sun khawm mi pêk în ro naw leiin Pathien i ṭi ti tuhin ka hriet tah,” a ta.

en: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, behind him a ram caught in the thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt-offering in the stead of his son.
hmr: Chun,Abraham chu a hang nghah a, a en a; a hnungtieng chun berâmchal a ki thinghnawka lo intâng tlat hi a hmuh a: chuongchun, Abraham chun berâmchal chu a va man a, chu chu a naupa aiah pumrawhmang inhlânna ding chun a hmang tah a.

en: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovah-jireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of Jehovah it shall be provided.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abrahamin chu hmun hminga chun “Lalpain ngai- tuong a tih”  ti ân bûk a; vawisûn chena “LALPA tlânga chun ngaituo nîng a tih,” an ti hlak ang hin.

en: And the angel of Jehovah called unto Abraham a second time out of heaven,
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko chun a ṭum hninaah vâna inthawkin Abraham chu a zuk ko a,

en: and said, By myself have I sworn, saith Jehovah, because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son,
hmr: “LALPA chun, ‘Mâni le mâni insâlin kân khâm a nih: Hi thil hi i thaw ta lei le, i naupa, i nei sun khawm chu în ro naw leiin

en: that in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heavens, and as the sand which is upon the sea-shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
hmr: mal sâwm ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, vâna arasi zât le tuisuoriet panga phaiphin zâtin i thlahai chu la sukpung ngei ngei ka ta, i thlahai chun an dohai kul kawtkhâr chu neipêk an ta, ka thu i âwi ta leiin,

en: and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
hmr: i thlahaia chun khawvêla chi tin la thawveng an tih’ a tih,” tiin.

en: So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beer-sheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beer-sheba.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu a siehlaw tlangvâlhai kuoma chun, a kîr nâwk tah a, chun, an tho a, Beer-sebaa chun, an fe tâwl tah a: chun Abraham chu Beer-sebaah a um ta zing a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she also hath borne children unto thy brother Nahor:
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun miin Abraham kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, Milka khawm khan i sang Nahor chu nauhai a neipêk tah,” an tih a, an hril a.

en: Uz his first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
hmr: An nau lutîr chu Uz, a sang chu Buz a nih, Aram pa Kemuel leh;

en: and Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.
hmr: Chesed, Hazo, Pildas, Jidlaph le Bethuel an nih.

en: And Bethuel begat Rebekah: these eight did Milcah bear to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
hmr: Bethuel chun naunuhmei Rebeka a nei a; chuonghai pariet chu Milka chun Abraham sangpa Nahor chu a neipêk a.

en: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she also bare Tebah, and Gaham, and Tahash, and Maacah.
hmr: A hmei, a hming Reuma khawmin Teba, Gaham, Tahas le Maaka a nei bawk a.

en: And the life of Sarah was a hundred and seven and twenty years: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
hmr: Sara dam sûng chu kum za le sâwmhni le pasari a nih: chu chu Sara dam sûng kum chu a nih.

en: And Sarah died in Kiriath-arba (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.
hmr: Sara chu Kanaan rama Kiriath-arbaa chun a thih a (chu chu Hebron khuo a nih): chun Abraham chu Sara chunga ṭap ding le sûn dingin a hung a.

en: And Abraham rose up from before his dead, and spake unto the children of Heth, saying,
hmr: Chun, a mithi ruong hmaa chu a tho a, Heth thlahai kuoma chun,

en: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
hmr: “Nangni lai mikhuol le inpêm el ka nih a; ka mithi ruong hi ka phûm hmang theina dingin nangni lai hin inphûmna hmun ding ram mi pe ro,” a tih a.

en: And the children of Heth answered Abraham, saying unto him,
hmr: Heth thlahai chun Abraham chu an dawn a, a kuomah,

en: Hear us, my lord; thou art a prince of God among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.
hmr: “Pu, lo ngai ta, nang chu keini lai hin lal ropuitak i nih a, kan thlânhaia hin i nuomna takah i mithi chu phûm el rawh, i mithi i phûmna dingin keini lai tukhawmin kan thlânhai pêk che inro naw ning ungah,” an tih a.

en: And Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abraham chu a tho a, chu rama mi, Heth thlahai chu chibai a bûk a.

en: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,
hmr: Chun, “Ka mithi chu ka phûm hmang in remti chun, mi lo ngai unla, Zohar naupa Ephron kuomah mi hnipêk unla,

en: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for the full price let him give it to me in the midst of you for a possession of a burying-place.
hmr: a lo mawnga um amân a inei, Makpelaa pûk kha mi pe dingin. Inphûmna hmuna nei sawng dingin a man âwm tâwk intêlin nangni hrietah mi pe raw se,” a tih a.

en: Now Ephron was sitting in the midst of the children of Heth: and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of the children of Heth, even of all that went in at the gate of his city, saying,
hmr: Ephron chu Heth thlahai lai chun a ṭhung ve zing a: chuongchun, Hit mi Ephron chun Heth thlahai hrietah, a khaw kul kawtkhâra lût taphawt hriet ngeia chun Abraham chu a dawn a,

en: Nay, my lord, hear me: the field give I thee, and the cave that is therein, I give it thee; in the presence of the children of my people give I it thee: bury thy dead.
hmr: “Ni lo e, pu, mi lo ngai ta, lo chu ka pêk cheh a, a sûnga pûk um khawm chu ka pêk bawk che; ka chipuihai nauhai mithmua hin ka pêk che a nih, i mithi chu phûm el rawh,” tiin.

en: And Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chu chu rama mihai hmaa chun a kûn a, chibai a bûk a.

en: And he spake unto Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, But if thou wilt, I pray thee, hear me: I will give the price of the field; take it of me, and I will bury my dead there.
hmr: Chun, chu rama mihai hrieta chun Ephron kuomah, “Rem i ti chun, lunginsiettakin mi lo ngai la, lo man chu pe el lem ka ti che: ka kuoma inthawkin la la, chuongchun, ka mithi chu phûm ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Ephron answered Abraham, saying unto him,
hmr: Ephron chun Abraham chu a dawn a, a kuomah,

en: My lord, hearken unto me: a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
hmr: “Pu, mi lo ngai ta, hnuoi tangka sekel za li man dâm chu nang le keia ta dingin hril khawp am nîng a ti? I mithi chu phûm el rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
hmr: Abraham chun Ephron thu chu a zâwm tah a; Heth thlahai hrietah, tangka a ihril zât, chu hun laia sumdâwnghaiin an ibûk hlak anga, tangka sekel za li, Ephron ta dingin a bûk tah a.

en: So the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the border thereof round about, were made sure
hmr: Chuongchun, Mamre zâwna Makpelaa Ephron lo chu, a lo, a sûnga pûk um, loa thing um po po le a lo ri vêla thing um po po le chun,

en: unto Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all that went in at the gate of his city.
hmr: Heth thlahai mithmua le a khaw kul kawtkhâra lût taphawt- hai mithmua chun nei sawng ding- in Abraham kuomah pêkin a um tah a.

en: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Abraham chun a nuhmei Sara chu Kanaan rama Mamre (chu chu, Hebron) zâwna Makpelaa loa pûka chun a phûm tah a.

en: And the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a burying-place by the children of Heth.
hmr: Chuongchun, lo le a sûnga um pûk chu inphûmna hmuna nei sawng dingin Abraham kuomah Heth thlahai chun an pêk suok tah a.

en: And Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and Jehovah had blessed Abraham in all things.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chu a hung upa a, a hung tar ta hleh a; chun, LALPAIN Abraham chu thil iengkimah mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And Abraham said unto his servant, the elder of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
hmr: Chun, Abraham chun a siehlaw, a in sûnga upa tak, a nei po po chunga thuneitu kuoma chun, “Lunginsiettakin i kut kha ka elpui hnuoiah rawl rawh;

en: and I will make thee swear by Jehovah, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that thou wilt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:
hmr: chuongchun, LALPA, vân Pathien le hnuoi Pathien chu sâlin, ka umna Kanaan mihai nunghâk laia mi hi ka naupa nuhmeia neipêk lo dingin, ṭawng kân khâmtir ding che a nih;

en: but thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son Isaac.
hmr: ka ram tieng, ka laibunghai laia fein, ka naupa Isak hi nuhmei i neipêk lem ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
hmr: Siehlaw chun a kuomah, “Nuhmei chun hi ram tieng hin a mi zui nuom kher da el rawi mawh, i naupa hi i hung suokna ram tieng chun ka ṭhuoi kîr ding am nîng a ti?” a ta.

en: And Abraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again.
hmr: Abraham chun a kuomah, “Ka naupa hi chutaka chun ṭhuoi kîr nâwk naw dingin fimkhur rawh.

en: Jehovah, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house, and from the land of my nativity, and who spake unto me, and who sware unto me, saying, Unto thy seed will I give this land; he will send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife for my son from thence.
hmr: LALPA vân Pathien, ka pa ina inthawk le ka piengna rama in- thawka mi ṭhuoi suoktu le, a mi betu, ‘Hi ram hi i thlahai kuomah la pêng ka tih,’ tiha ka kuoma inkhâma hriltu chun, ama ngeiin vântirko chu i hmaah infetir a ta, chutaka inthawk chun ka naupa hi nuhmei i hung neipêk ding a nih.

en: And if the woman be not willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath; only thou shalt not bring my son thither again.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a zui nuom naw che chun, ka kuoma i înkhâmna kawnga hin inthieng el i tih; ieng- khawm ni sien ka naupa hi chutaka chun i ṭhuoi kîr nâwk ding a ni nawh,” a tih a.

en: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him concerning this matter.
hmr: Chuongchun, siehlaw chun a kut chu a pu Abraham êlpui hnuoia chun a rawl a, chu thua chun a kuoma chun ân khâm tah a.

en: And the servant took ten camels, of the camels of his master, and departed, having all goodly things of his master’s in his hand: and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.
hmr: Chun, siehlaw chun a pu sanghâwngsei laia mi sanghâwngsei sâwm a ṭhuoi a, a pu thil ṭha tinrêng chawiin a suok tah a: chuongchun, a tho a, Mesopotamia rama Nahor-hai khuoa chun a fe tah a.

en: And he made the camels to kneel down without the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that women go out to draw water.
hmr: Chun, zântienga nuhmei ruol tui chawi dinga an suok hun lai tak chun, khawhnâwmah tuisunsuo kâwla chun a sanghâwngseihai chu ân dingṭhaṭhuontir a.

en: And he said, O Jehovah, the God of my master Abraham, send me, I pray thee, good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master Abraham.
hmr: Chun, “Aw LALPA, ka pu Abraham Pathien, lunginsiettakin vawisûn hin mîn hlawtlingtir la, ka pu Abraham chunga chun lungin- sietna inlangtir rawh.

en: Behold, I am standing by the fountain of water; and the daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water:
hmr: En ta, tuikhur kâwlah ka ngîr a, khuoa mihai naunuhmei ruol khawm tui chawi dingin an hung hi:

en: and let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that thou hast showed kindness unto my master.
hmr: chuongchun, hieng ang hin ni raw se, nunghâk tu kuoma khawm, ‘Lunginsiettakin ka dâwn dingin i tuibêl kha sukhnuoi raw khai,’ ka tih a; ‘Dâwn rawh, i sanghâwngseihai khawm dâwn ding pêng ka tih,’ titu taphawt chu, chu ngei chu i siehlaw Isak ta dinga i ruot chu ni raw se; chutaka chun ka pu chungah lunginsietna în entir ti hrieng ka tih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham’s brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
hmr: Chun, a hril zo hmain, ngai ta, Abraham sangpa Nahor nuhmei Milka naupa Bethuel naunu Rebeka chu a liengkoa tuibêl putin a hung suok a.

en: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the fountain, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
hmr: Chu nunghâk chu a hmêl a ṭha hleh a, nunghâk inthieng a nih a, pasal hrim hrimin an la pâwl ngai dêr nawh. Tuikhura chun a zu feh a, a tuibêl a thâl sip a, a hung tung tah a.

en: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Give me to drink, I pray thee, a little water from thy pitcher.
hmr: Chun, siehlaw chu ân tuokpui dingin a tlân a, “Lunginsiettakin i tuibêla tui kha tlâwmte mîn dâwntir raw khai,” a tih a.

en: And she said, Drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
hmr: Ama chun, “Dâwn ta la, pu,” a ta; inhmâwtakin a tuibêl chu a kutah a dawm thlâk a, ân dâwntir tah a.

en: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
hmr: Ama ân dâwntir zo chun, “I sanghâwngseihai khawm an dâwn khawp hmakhat chun chawi pei ka tih,” a ta.

en: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.
hmr: Chun, inhmâwtakin a tuibêl chu ran thlênga chun ân ruok a, tui chawi dingin tuisunsuo tieng chun a tlân nâwk a, a sanghâwngseihai po po ta ding chun a chawi ta pei a.

en: And the man looked stedfastly on her, holding his peace, to know whether Jehovah had made his journey prosperous or not.
hmr: A vân zinnaa chun LALPAIN ân hlâwtlingtir le tir naw hrietna dingin siehlaw chun amanu chu to ṭawkin a en zing a,

en: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold,
hmr: sanghâwngseihai chun an dâwn khawp phingleh, siehlaw chun rângkachak hnâra inbûk duli bûk le, a kuta dingin bânbun pahni rângkachak tangka sâwm bûk a phawr a;

en: and said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee. Is there room in thy father’s house for us to lodge in?
hmr: a kuomah, “Tu naunu am i nih a, lunginsiettakin mi hril ta. I pa inah kan riekna ding hmun um a ti?” a tih a.

en: And she said unto him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bare unto Nahor.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Nahor ta dinga nei Milka naupa Bethuel naunu ka nih,” a ta.

en: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
hmr: Ama bawkin a kuomah “Bupâwl le ran bu kan hau ve veh a, riekna hmun khawm kan nei,” a ti nâwk a.

en: And the man bowed his head, and worshipped Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, siehlaw chun a lu a kûn a, LALPA chu chibai a bûk a.

en: And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of my master Abraham, who hath not forsaken his lovingkindness and his truth toward my master: as for me, Jehovah hath led me in the way to the house of my master’s brethren.
hmr: Chun, “Ka pu chunga a lunginsietna le a takna bo ngailo LALPA, ka pu Abraham Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se; kei khawm hi Lalpa chun ka pu unauhai in tieng a mi ṭhuoi a lo ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And the damsel ran, and told her mother’s house according to these words.
hmr: Chun, nunghâk chu a tlân a, chuong thu chu a nu sûnghai a va hril a.

en: And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the fountain.
hmr: Rebeka chun ṭapa a nei a, a hming chu Laban a nih: chuongchun, Laban chu a suok a, tuikhur tieng mi kuoma chun a va tlân a.

en: And it came to pass, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets upon his sister’s hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he was standing by the camels at the fountain.
hmr: Hnâra inbûk le a farnu kuta bânbunhai chu a hmuh a, “Mi chun chuong ang khâng ang chun a mi tih,” tiha a farnu Rebeka thu hril chu a hriet phingleh, mi kuoma chun a va feh a; chun, ngai ta, ama chu tuikhura sanghâwngseihai lai chun a lo ngîr zing a.

en: And he said, Come in, thou blessed of Jehovah; wherefore standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
hmr: Chun, Laban chun, “Nang LALPA malsâwmna dawngtu, hung lût rawh, iengdinga tuola i ngîr zing am? In le sanghâwngseihai ta ding hmun ka siemrêl tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And the man came into the house, and he ungirded the camels; and he gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men that were with him.
hmr: Chun, chu mipa chu ina chun a lût a, chun Laban chun sa- nghâwngseihai thuomhnaw chu a sût a; sanghâwngseihai ta ding chun bupâwl le ran bu a pêk a, a ke le a ruolhai ke sâwpna dingin tui a pêk bawk a.

en: And there was set food before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.
hmr: Chun, Abraham siehlaw hmaa chun fâk ding an hung pêk bawk a; nisienlakhawm, ama chun, “Ka hungna san thu ka hril hmakhat chun fa naw ning,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Hril ta la,” a tih a.

en: And he said, I am Abraham’s servant.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Abraham siehlaw ka nih.

en: And Jehovah hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks and herds, and silver and gold, and men-servants and maid-servants, and camels and asses.
hmr: LALPA chun ka pu chu nasatakin mal a sâwm a, mi lientak a hung nih a. LALPA chun ama chu berâm ruol dâm, bâwng ruol dâm, tangka dâm, rângkachak dâm, suok- pa dâm, suoknu dâm, sanghâwng- seihai dâm, sabengtung dâm, a pêk bawk a.

en: And Sarah my master’s wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
hmr: Ka pu nuhmei Sara chun a tar hnungin ka pu ta dingin naupasal a nei a; ama kuoma chun a nei po po a pêk vawng a.

en: And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
hmr: Ka pu chun, ‘Ka umna rama Kanaan mihai nunghâk laia mi hi ka naupa nuhmeiah i neipêk ding a ni nawh:

en: but thou shalt go unto my father’s house, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son.
hmr: ka pa in tieng, ka laibunghai laia fein, ka naupa ta dingin nuhmei i neipêk lem ding a nih,’ tiin ṭawng a mîn khâmtir a.

en: And I said unto my master, Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
hmr: Keiin ka pu kuoma chun, ‘Nuhmei chun a mi zui nuom da el rawi mawh,’ ka tih a.

en: And he said unto me, Jehovah, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father’s house:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun ka kuomah, ‘LALPA a hmaa ka um hlakna chun a vântirko chu i kuomah tir a ta, i fena dinga chun inhlâw- tlingtir a ti che; chuongchun, ka naupa ta dingin ka laibunghai le ka pa sûnghai laia mi nuhmeiah i neipêk ding a nih;

en: then shalt thou be clear from my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give her not to thee, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
hmr: ka laibunghai kuom ngei i tlung pha chun în khâmnaa inthawk hin inthieng i tih, nunghâk chu an pêk naw che chun, ka kuoma în khâmnaa inthawk hin inthieng i tih,’ a tih a.

en: And I came this day unto the fountain, and said, O Jehovah, the God of my master Abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go:
hmr: Chuongchun, vawisûn hin tui- khur chu ka hung tlung a, ‘Aw LALPA, ka pu Abraham Pathien, ka fenaa hin i mîn hlâwtlingtir ding chun,

en: behold, I am standing by the fountain of water; and let it come to pass, that the maiden that cometh forth to draw, to whom I shall say, Give me, I pray thee, a little water from thy pitcher to drink;
hmr: en ta, tuikhur kâwlah ka ngîr hi: chun, hieng ang hin ni raw se, nunghâk tui chawi dinga hung suok tu kuoma khawm, “Lunginsiettakin dâwn dingin i tuibêla tui kha tlâwmte mi pe ta,” ka tih a:

en: and she shall say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom Jehovah hath appointed for my master’s son.
hmr: Chun, amân, “Dâwn rawh, i sanghâwngseihai ta ding khawm hin chawi ka tih,” titu taphawt chu, chu ngei chu ka pu naupa ta dinga LALPA nuhmei ruot chu ni raw se,’ ka tih a.

en: And before I had done speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the fountain, and drew: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
hmr: Chun, ka lungrila ka hril zo hma chun, ngai ta, Rebeka hi a tuibêl putin a hung suok a; chun, tuikhura chun a zu feh a, tui a zu chawi a; chun, a kuomah, ‘Lungin- siettakin tui mîn dâwntir ta khai,’ ka tih a.

en: And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
hmr: Ama hin inhmawtakin a lieng- koa inthawk chun a tuibêl chu a dawm thlâk a, ‘Dâwn rawh, i sanghâwngseihai khawm hi dâwn ding pêng ka tih,’ a ta: chuongchun, ka dâwn a, sanghâwngseihai khawm ân dâwntir bawk a.

en: And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor’s son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the ring upon her nose, and the bracelets upon her hands.
hmr: Chun, keiin, ‘Tu naunu am i nih a?’ tiin kân dawn a. Ama chun, ‘Milka ineipêk Nahor naupa Bethuel naunu ka nih,’ a tih a; chun, hnâra inbûk chu a hnârah kân bûk a, bânbunhai chu a kutah kân buntir bawk a.

en: And I bowed my head, and worshipped Jehovah, and blessed Jehovah, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master’s brother’s daughter for his son.
hmr: Chun, ka lu ka kûn a, LALPA chu chibai ka bûk a, LALPA, ka pu Abraham Pathien, ka pu laibungpa naunu hi a naupa ta dinga nuhmeia neipêk dinga lampui indiktaka mi ṭhuoitu chu kân pâk bawk a.

en: And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
hmr: Chuongchun, tuhin, ka pu in lunginsiet a, a chungah thaw tak taka in thaw ding chun mi hril ro; in thaw naw ding khawmin mi hril bawk ro; chuongchun, ka thaw dân ding hre thei ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from Jehovah: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
hmr: Chun, Laban le Bethuel chun an dawn a, “Hi thil hi LALPAA inthawka suok a ni hi, a sie a ṭha khawm i kuomah kan hril thei nawh.

en: Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master’s son’s wife, as Jehovah hath spoken.
hmr: En ta, Rebeka chu i hmaa hi a um annâwm, ṭhuoi la fe el rawh, LALPAIN a hril angin i pu naupa nuhmeiin um raw se,” an tih a.

en: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth unto Jehovah.
hmr: Abraham siehlaw chun an thu chu a hriet phingleh hnuoi sikin LALPA chibai a bûk tah a.

en: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
hmr: Chun, Abraham siehlaw chun tangkaruo incheinahai le, rângka- chak incheinahai le silfênhai a lâk suok a, Rebeka kuoma chun a pêk a; a ṭapa le a nu kuoma khawm chun thil hlutak takhai a pêk bawk a.

en: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.
hmr: Chun, ama le a ruolhai chun an fâkin an dâwn a, an riek tah a. Zîngkâra an tho chun, “Ka pu kuomah mîn fetir ta ro,” a tih a.

en: And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
hmr: A ṭapa le a nu chun, “Tawinu hi ni sâwt nawte, ni sâwm bêk kan kuomah um hri raw se; chu hnunga chun fe de nih,” an tih a.

en: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing Jehovah hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Mi sukhnu naw ro khai, LALPA chun ka fenaa hin a mîn hlâwtlingtir ta sih a: ka pu kuoma ka fe theina dingin mîn fetir el lem ro khai,” a ta.

en: And they said, We will call the damsel, and inquire at her mouth.
hmr: Anni chun, “Tawinu chu ko kan ta, ama bau ngeiah bieng kan tih,” an ta.

en: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
hmr: Chuongchun, Rebeka chu an ko a, a kuomah, “Hi mipa kuoma hin fe nuom i ti?” an tih a. Ama chun, “Nuom e,” a ta.

en: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham’s servant, and his men.
hmr: Chuongchun, an farnu Rebeka le, a dawntu le, Abraham siehlaw le a rawihai chu an infetir tah a.

en: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let thy seed possess the gate of those that hate them.
hmr: Chun, Rebeka chu mal an sâwm a, a kuomah, “Kan farnu, nang chu sîng ruoka sâng tamtak nu hung ni la, i thlahai chun anni theidatuhai kul kawtkhâr chu neipêk raw hai se,” an ta.

en: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
hmr: Chuongchun, Rebeka chu a tho a, a suoknuhai leh sanghâwngseihai chunga chun an chuong a, mi chu an zui tah a; chuongchun, siehlaw chun Rebeka chu a ṭhuoi a, a fe tah a.

en: And Isaac came from the way of Beer-lahai-roi; for he dwelt in the land of the South.
hmr: Chun, Isak chu Beer-lahai-roi tienga inthawk chun a hung a, Sim rama um a ni sih a.

en: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming.
hmr: Chun, Isak chu zântieng hin inngaituo dingin phûlah a va lêng suok a: chun, a hei nghah a, a en a; chun, ngai ta, sanghâwngseihai an hung a.

en: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she alighted from the camel.
hmr: Chun, Rebeka chu a hang nghah a, Isak chu a hmu phingleh sanghâwngsei chunga inthawk chun a ṭum tah a.

en: And she said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant said, It is my master: and she took her veil, and covered herself.
hmr: Abraham siehlaw kuoma chun, “Phûla a mi tuok dinga hung saw tu am a na?” a tih a. Siehlaw chun, “Ka pu a ni saw,” a ta: chuong- chun, ân khumna puon a lâk a, ân khum tah a.

en: And the servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
hmr: Chun, siehlaw chun a thilthaw po po chu Isak a hril a.

en: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her. And Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.
hmr: Isak chun Rebeka chu a nu Sara puon ina chun a ṭhuoi lût a; chun, Rebeka chu a nei a, a nuhmei a hung ni tah a; chun, ama chu a hmangai hleh a, chuongchun, Isak chu a nu thi thua khawm chun a hung thlamuong thei tah a.

en: And Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah.
hmr: Abraham chun nuhmei dang a nei a, a hming chu Ketura a nih.

en: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
hmr: Ama chun Zimran, Joksan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak le Suah a neipêk a.

en: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
hmr: Joksan chun naupasal Sheba le Dedan a nei a. Dedan naupasalhai chu Assurim, Letusim le Leummim an nih.

en: And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
hmr: Midian naupasalhai chu Epha, Epher, Hanok, Abida le Eldaa an nih. Chuong po po chu Ketura nauhai an nih.

en: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
hmr: Abraham chun a nei po po Isak kuomah a pêk a.

en: But unto the sons of the concubines, that Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts; and he sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
hmr: A thaikêm naupasalhai kuoma ruok chun lâwmmanhai a pêk a; chun, ama la dam lai ngei chun a naupa Isak kuoma inthawk chun, saktieng, khawsak ramah, ân fe hmangtir tâwl tah a.

en: And these are the days of the years of Abraham’s life which he lived, a hundred threescore and fifteen years.
hmr: Abraham dam sûng chu kum za khat le sâwmsari le panga a nih.

en: And Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years, and was gathered to his people.
hmr: Abraham chun a thlarau ân thla tah a, a lua kêlsam ṭo hiela tartakin, tarkûna damin a thi tah a, a chipuihai kuoma ṭhuoiin a um ve tah a.

en: And Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;
hmr: A naupasalhai Isak le Ismael chun Hit mi Zohar naupa Ephron loa, Mamre zâwna Makpelaa pûka chun an vui tah a;

en: the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
hmr: chu lo chu Abrahamin Heth thlahaia inthawka ân châwk kha a nih. Chutaka chun Abraham chu an phûm a, a nuhmei Sara le khan.

en: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac his son: and Isaac dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.
hmr: Abraham thi hnung chun Pathienin a naupa Isak chu mal a sâwm a; chu Isak chu Beer-lahai-roi kâwla chun a um a.

en: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s handmaid, bare unto Abraham:
hmr: Hieng hi Abraham naupa Ismael, Sara suoknu Aigupta mi Hagarin Abraham a neipêk thlahai chu an nih.

en: and these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
hmr: Hieng hi an pieng dân indawt ang peia Ismael naupasalhai hming chu a nih: Ismael nau lutîr chu Nebaioth a nih, chu dawta chun Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

en: and Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
hmr: Misma, Duma, Massa,

en: Hadad, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
hmr: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphis le Kedema an nih.

en: these are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments; twelve princes according to their nations.
hmr: Chuong chu Ismael naupasal- hai an nih, an khuo ang pei le an riebûk ang peia an hming ziek a nih: an chi ang pei chun lal sâwm le pahni an nih.

en: And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died, and was gathered unto his people.
hmr: Chun, Ismael dam sûng kum chu hi hi a nih, kum za le sâwmthum pasari hi: chun, a thlarau ân thlah a, a thi tah a, a chipuihai kuoma ṭhuoiin a um ve tah a.

en: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Assyria: he abode over against all his brethren.
hmr: Chun, a thlahai chu Havilaa inthawkin Assuria pan zâwngin Aigupta zâwn Sur chenin an um a, a unau po po epa chun a um a.

en: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham’s son: Abraham begat Isaac:
hmr: Chun, hieng hi Abraham naupa Isak thlahai chu an nih:

en: and Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Paddan-aram, the sister of Laban the Syrian, to be his wife.
hmr: Abraham chun naupasal Isak a nei a, Isak chu Paddan-aram rama Suria mi Bethuel naunu, Suria mi Laban farnu Rebeka chu nuhmeia a nei lai chun kum sâwmli mi a nih a.

en: And Isaac entreated Jehovah for his wife, because she was barren: and Jehovah was entreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
hmr: Chun, a nuhmei chu a ching leiin, Isak chun LALPA kuomah a ngênpêk a, LALPAIN a hnina chu a lo ngaipêk a; chuongchun, a nuhmei Rebeka chu ân rai tah a.

en: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, wherefore do I live? And she went to inquire of Jehovah.
hmr: A nau vawnhai chu phîng sûnga chun an insuol a; ama chun, “Hieng ang hi a ni si chun iengdinga ka dam zing am a na?” tiin LALPA indawn dingin a fe tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, And two peoples shall be separated from thy bowels: And the one people shall be stronger than the other people; And the elder shall serve the younger.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a kuomah, “I sula chun chi hni an um a, I phîng sûnga inthawk ngei chun hnam hni inṭhêng an ta, Hnam pakhat chu hnam pakhat nêk chun hrât lem a ta; A upa lemin a naupang lem rawng chu bâwl a tih,” a tih a.

en: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
hmr: Chun, a nau nei a hun chun, ngai ta, a sula chun inphîr an lo um a,

en: And the first came forth red, all over like a hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
hmr: a hmasa lem chu sentakin, puon inhmul anga inhmul thuopin a hung suok a; chuongchun, a hmingah Esau an sak tah a.

en: And after that came forth his brother, and his hand had hold on Esau’s heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
hmr: Chu zoa chun a unaupa chu a hung suok a, a kutin Esau kekhawng chu a chel zing a; chuongchun, a hmingah Jakob  an sak a: Rebekain anni a nei lai chun Isak chu kum sâwmruk mi a nih.

en: And the boys grew: and Esau was a skilful hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a quiet man, dwelling in tents.
hmr: Chun, naupanghai chu an hung inṭhang lien a, Esau chu sapêl thiemtak, ramsuok mi tak a nih; Jakob ruok chu mi totak, puon in dâma um mi a nih.

en: Now Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: and Rebekah loved Jacob.
hmr: Isak chun a sakhi sa a fâk hlak leiin Esau chu a ngaina hle a; Rebeka ruok chun Jakob chu a ngaina lem a.

en: And Jacob boiled pottage: and Esau came in from the field, and he was faint:
hmr: Vawikhat chu Jakob chun ieng- khat a lo suonghruoi a, Esau chu rama inthawkin a hung a, a châu hleh a.

en: and Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
hmr: Esau chun Jakob kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin i iengkhat sen suong hruoi kha, kha ngei kha mîn fâktir raw khai, ka ṭâm êm el,” a ta (chuleiin, a hming chu Edom an ti a nih).

en: And Jacob said, Sell me first thy birthright.
hmr: Jakob chun, “I nau lutîr nina mîn châwktir zet la tie,” a ta.

en: And Esau said, Behold, I am about to die: and what profit shall the birthright do to me?
hmr: Chun, Esau chun, “Nih e, ka thi vâng vâng a ni sih a, nau lutir nina el hi ka ta dingin ieng am ṭhahnem chuong a ta?” a ta.

en: And Jacob said, Swear to me first; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
hmr: Jakob chun, “Ka kuomah inkhâm zet raw le,” a tih a: chun, a kuoma chun ân khâm tah a, a nau lutîr nina chu Jakob kuoma chun a zawr tah a.

en: And Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentils; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: so Esau despised his birthright.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun Esau chu bei le havai suong hruoi chu a pêk a; chuongchun, a fâkin a dâwn a, a tho a, a fe tah a. Chuong ang chun Esau chun a nau lutîr nina chu a ngainêp a nih.

en: And there was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines, unto Gerar.
hmr: Chun, chu rama chun Abraham dam laia ṭâm tla hmasa lem ti lo khawm kha, ṭâm a hung tla nâwk a. Chuongchun, Isak chu Philistin mihai lai Abimelek kuomah, Gerarah a zu feh a.

en: And Jehovah appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu a kuomah a hung inlâr a, “Aigupta rama chun zu fe naw rawh; ram ka hril ding chea chun um rawh.

en: sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;
hmr: Hi rama hin um hri phawt la, chuongchun, i kuomah um ka ta, mal ka sâwm ding che a nih: hieng ram po po hi i kuoma le i thlahai kuomah pein i pa Abraham kuoma kân khâmna kha ka sukdet ding a nih.

en: and I will multiply thy seed as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these lands; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
hmr: Vâna arasi zâtin i thlahai chu la sukpung ka ta, hieng ram po po hi i thlahai kuomah la pe bawk ka tih; chun, i thlaa chun khawvêla chi tin la thawveng an tih:

en: because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
hmr: Abraham chun ka thu a awi a, ka hrilhai, ka thupêkhai, ka thuruothai, ka dânhai khawm a zâwm lei khan,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
hmr: Chuongchun, Isak chun Gerara chun umhmun a khuor tah a.

en: and the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, My wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
hmr: Chu khuoa mihai chun a nuhmei chanchin an indawn a; ama chun, “Ka farnu a nih,” a ta: a hmêl a ṭhat leiin, “Hi khuoa mihai hin Rebeka lei hin mi that rawi an tih,” tiin, “Ka nuhmei a nih,” a ti ngam naw a nih.

en: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
hmr: Chutaka chun sâwttak a um hnungin, Philistin mihai lal Abimelek chun tukvera inthawkin a hei thlîr a; chun, ngai ta, Isak chun a nuhmei Rebeka chu ân saipui lai a hei hmuh a.

en: And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die because of her.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abimelekin Isak chu a ko a, “Ngai ta, i nuhmei a ni ngei hi, iengdinga ‘Ka farnu a nih,’ i ti am a na?” a tih a. Isak chun a kuomah, “Ama leiin thi rawi ka tih ka ti lei a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might easily have lain with thy wife, and thou wouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.
hmr: Abimelek chun, “Kan chunga i thilthaw hi iengtizie am a na? Mihai laia mi tukhawmin i nuhmei hi an lo zâlpui el thei i sawnnaw; chuong- chun, kan chunga hin thiemnawna i hung intlungtir a ni ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And Abimelech charged all the people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
hmr: Abimelek bawk chun, “Tu- khawm ama hi amanih, a nuhmei hi amanih tâwk tâwk chu sukhlum ngei ding a nih,” tiin, mi po po chu thu a pêk a.

en: And Isaac sowed in that land, and found in the same year a hundredfold: and Jehovah blessed him.
hmr: Chun, Isak chun chu rama chun bu a chîng a, chu kum chun a let za a hmuh a. LALPAIN ama chu mal a sâwm a,

en: And the man waxed great, and grew more and more until he became very great:
hmr: chuongchun, mi chu a hung hausa ta hleh a, nasataka mi neinung hung ni rau khawpin a hung lien ta duok duok a.

en: and he had possessions of flocks, and possessions of herds, and a great household: and the Philistines envied him.
hmr: Berâm ruolhai, ran ruolhai a nei a, sûnghai tamtak a nei bawk a; chuongchun, Philistin mihai chun an thîk tah a.

en: Now all the wells which his father’s servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped, and filled with earth.
hmr: A pa Abraham dam laia a siehlawhaiin tuisunsuo an cho po po khawm chu Philistin mihai chun an nel a, pilin an vur bit ta vawng el a.

en: And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
hmr: Chun, Abimelekin Isak kuom- ah, “Keini nêkin i hrât lem sih a, kan kuoma inthawk hin fe hmang dai rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac departed thence, and encamped in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isak chu chutaka inthawk chun a suok a, Gerar ruomah a puon in a zar a, chutaka chun umhmun a khuor a.

en: And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
hmr: Chun, Isak chun a pa Abraham dam laia an tuisunsuo chohai chu a cho nâwk a; Abraham thi hnung khan Philistin mihai chun an lo nel tâwl ta sih a; chun, a pain a lo inbûk ta ang pei khan an hming chu ân bûk a.

en: And Isaac’s servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
hmr: Isak siehlawhai chun ruomah an cho a, chutaka chun tuisunsuo hnâr nei an hmu ta hlau a.

en: And the herdsmen of Gerar strove with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him.
hmr: Gerar ranpuhai chun, “Tui hi kan ta a nih,” tiin Isak ranpuhai chu an insêlpui a: chuonga ama leh an insêl leiin tuisunsuo hminga chun Esek ân bûk tah a.

en: And they digged another well, and they strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
hmr: Tuisunsuo dang an cho nâwk a, chu khawm chu lâkpêk tumin an insêlpui nâwk a; chuongchun, a hmingah Sitna ân bûk a.

en: And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now Jehovah hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chu ân tâwl a, tuisunsuo dang a cho nâwk a: chu ruok chu chu lâkpêk tumin an insêlpui ta nawh a: chuongchun, “Tuhin chu LALPAIN hmun lientak a mi siempêk tah a, hi rama hin chi tamtak thla tâng ei tih,” tiin, a hmingah Rehoboth ân bûk a.

en: And he went up from thence to Beer-sheba.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chun Beer- sebaah a hang feh a.

en: And Jehovah appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham’s sake.
hmr: Chu zân ngei chun LALPA chu a kuomah a hung inlâr a, “Kei hi i pa Abraham Pathien chu ka nih, ṭi naw rawh, i kuomah ka um annâwm, mal sâwm ka ti cheh a, ka siehlaw Abraham leiin i thlahai chu ka la sukpung ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of Jehovah, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaac’s servants digged a well.
hmr: Chuongchun, chutaka chun mâichâm a siem a, LALPA hming a lam a, chutaka chun a puon in a zar bawk a. Chun, Isak siehlawhai chun chutaka chun tuisunsuo an cho nâwk a.

en: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his host.
hmr: Chun, Gerara inthawkin Abimelek chu ama thurâwntu Ahuzzath le a sipai hotu Phikol leh a kuomah an feh a.

en: And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore are ye come unto me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
hmr: Isak chun an kuomah, “In mi theida a in kuoma inthawkin in mîn fe hmangtir sih a, iengdinga ka kuoma hung am in nih a?” a tih a.

en: And they said, We saw plainly that Jehovah was with thee: and we said, Let there now be an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee,
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “LALPA chu i kuomah a um ti chiengtakin kan hriet a: chuongchun, ei kârah, keini le nangma kâr ngeia hin inkhâmna um sienla, i kuomah thu mîn thlungtir la kan ti a nih:

en: that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of Jehovah.
hmr: i pawi iengkhawm kan tâwk nawh a, thil ṭha bak naw chu i chunga hrim iengkhawm kan thaw nawh a, tlangtaka kan infetir el che ang khan, nang khawma kan sietna ding hrim i thaw nawna dingin: tuhin nang chu LALPA malsâwmna dawngtu i ni ta hi,” an tih a.

en: And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
hmr: Chuongchun, an ta dingin ruoi an ṭheh a, an fâkin an dâwn tah a.

en: And they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
hmr: Zîngtieng chun inhmatakin an tho a, ṭawng an inkhâm tuoh a. Chun, Isakin anni chu ân fetir tah a, a kuoma inthawk chu lungmuongtakin an suok tah a.

en: And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac’s servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, We have found water.
hmr: Chu ni le le chun Isak sie- hlawhai chu an hung a, an tuisunsuo cho chanchin an hung hril a, a kuomah, “Tui kan hmu tah,” an tih a.

en: And he called it Shibah: therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba unto this day.
hmr: Chu tuisunsuo chu Shiba ân bûk a: chuleiin, chu khaw hming chu tu chen hin Beer-seba a ni zing.

en: And when Esau was forty years old he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:
hmr: Chun, Esau chu kum sâwmli mi a niin Hit mi Beeri naunu Judith le Hit mi Elon naunu Basemath nuhmeiah a nei a;

en: and they were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
hmr: chuonghai chu Isak le Rebeka lungril sukrimsitu an nih.

en: And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Here am I.
hmr: Isak chu a hung tar a, khaw hmu thei lo khawpa a mit a hung inthim chun, a naupa upa lem Esau chu a ko a, a kuomah, “Ka naupa,” a tih a: ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death.
hmr: Chun, amân a kuomah, “Ngai ta, ka tar ta bêk a, ka thi ni ding ka hriet si nawh a.

en: Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison;
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, lunginsiettakin, i hriemhrei thal bâwm le i thal ngul kha chawi la, phûlah va suok la, sakhi mi va kâppêk rawh.

en: and make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
hmr: Chun, ka thi hmaa mal ka sâwm theina ding chein, ka du zâwng takin hme inhniktakah mi siempêk la, ka fâk dingin ka kuomah hung la rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
hmr: Chun, Isakin a naupa Esau a biek lai chu Rebekain a lo hriet a. Chuonga Esau chu sakhi kâpa hung hâwn dinga phûla a fe laiin,

en: And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,
hmr: Rebeka chun a naupa Jakob kuomah, “Ngai ta,i pa chun i u Esau kuomah hieng hin a ti ka hriet a,

en: Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless thee before Jehovah before my death.
hmr: ‘Sakhi mi hung kâppêk la, ka fâk a ka thi hmaa LALPA hmaa mal ka sâwmna ding chein, hme inhniktakin mi hung siempêk rawh,’ tiin.

en: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, ka naupa, thu ka pêk ang pei che chu zâwm rawh.

en: Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savory food for thy father, such as he loveth:
hmr: Ran ruol lai va fe la, chutaka inthawk chu kêlte ṭha deu deu pahni mi va lapêk rawh: chu chu a duzâwng takin i pa ta dingin hme inhniktakah lo siem ka tih;

en: and thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, so that he may bless thee before his death.
hmr: chun, a thi hmaa mal a sâwm theina ding chein a fâk dingin i pa kuomah i va fepui ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.
hmr: Jakob chun a nu Rebeka kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, ka u Esau chu mi inhmultak a nih a, kei ruok chu mi innâmtak ka ni sih a.

en: My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
hmr: Ka pa chun a mi lo them vêl el khawm a ni thei a, ama ngaiin hlêmtu ang hung ni ding ka nih a, malsâwm nêk hmanin ṭawngsie inphur ni lem el ka tih a,” a tih a.

en: And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son; only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
hmr: A nu chun a kuomah, “Ka naupa, i ṭawngse phur ding chu keia chungah um raw se: ka thu zâwm la mi va lapêk el rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savory food, such as his father loved.
hmr: Chuongchun, a va feh a, a va lâk a, a nu kuomah a hungpui a; chun, a nu chun a pa du zâwngin hme inhniktakin a lo siem tah a.

en: And Rebekah took the goodly garments of Esau her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son;
hmr: Chun, Rebeka chun a naupa upa lem, Esau silfên ṭhatak, ina a kuoma um chu a lâk a, a naupa naupang lem Jakob chu ân hâktir a;

en: and she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
hmr: kêlte vun chun a kut nâmna lai le a rîng nâmna lai chu a tuom a:

en: and she gave the savory food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
hmr: chun, hme inhniktak le bei a siemhai chu a naupa Jakob kutah a pêk bawk a.

en: And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
hmr: Chun, ama chu a pa kuomah a feh a, “Pa,” a tih a; ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um, ka naupa a tu lem am i nih a?” a tih a.

en: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy first-born; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
hmr: Jakob chun a pa kuomah, “I naupa upa lem Esau ka nih, i mi tir ang khan ka thaw zo tah, lunginsiettakin tho la, mal mi sâwm dingin ṭhung la, ka sakhi sa hi fa raw le,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because Jehovah thy God sent me good speed.
hmr: Isak chun a naupa kuomah, “Ka naupa, iengtizie am a na i hung inhma ngei de?” a tih a. Ama chun, “LALPA i Pathienin a mîn hlâw- tlingtir lei a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.
hmr: Chun, Isak chun Jakob kuomah, “Ka naupa, lunginsiettakin hung hnai raw khai, lo them vêl ka ti che, ka naupa Esau i ni takzet am,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun a pa Isak chu a va hnai a; ama chun a lo them vêl a, “A rawl chu Jakob rawl a ni sih a, a kuthai chu Esau kut a ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau’s hands: so he blessed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, a kut chu Esau kut anga ân hmul leiin ama chu a hriet nawh a; mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
hmr: “Ka naupa Esau ngei i ni de maw?” a tih a. Ama chun, “Nih e,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son’s venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Mi hung chawi hnai pêk rawh, chuongchun, mal ka sâwm theina ding chein ka naupa sakhi sa chu lo fâng ka tih,” a tih a. Chuongchun, a hung chawi hnai pêk a, a fâk tah a; uoin khawm a lâkpêk a, a dâwn bawk a.

en: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
hmr: Chun, a pa Isak chun a kuomah, “Ka naupa, hung hnai la mi fâwp rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son Is as the smell of a field which Jehovah hath blessed:
hmr: Chuongchun, a va hnai a, a fâwp a: ama chun a silfên rim chu a hriet a, mal a sâwm tah a, “En ta, ka naupa rim hi LALPA malsâwm ram rim ang a nih

en: And God give thee of the dew of heaven, And of the fatness of the earth, And plenty of grain and new wine:
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin vân daidaw, Le hnuoi ṭhatna hmun, Le bu le uoin tamtak pe raw se che.

en: Let peoples serve thee, And nations bow down to thee: Be lord over thy brethren, And let thy mother’s sons bow down to thee: Cursed be every one that curseth thee, And blessed be every one that blesseth thee.
hmr: Mi chi tum tumin i rawng bâwl hai sienla, Hnam tum tumin chibai bûk raw hai se che. I unauhai lai lalah um la, I nu nauhaiin chibai bûk raw hai se che. Ṭawngsie inphurtu che taphawt chu ṭawngsephurin um sienla, Malsâwmtu che chu malsâwmin um raw se,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
hmr: Chun, Isakin Jakob mal a sâwm zo a Jakob chu a pa kuoma inthawka a suok hman chauin, a u Esau chu a ramsuok a hung a.

en: And he also made savory food, and brought it unto his father; and he said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son’s venison, that thy soul may bless me.
hmr: Ama khawm chun hme in- hniktakin a siem a, a pa kuoma chun a hung chawi veh a, a pa kuoma chun, “Pa, tho la, mal i mi sâwmna dingin i naupa sakhi sa hi fa raw le,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy first-born, Esau.
hmr: A pa Isak chun a kuomah, “Tu am i nih a?” a tih a. Ama chun, “I naupa, i naupa upa lem Esau ka nih,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who then is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isak chu nasatak- in ân thin a, “Sakhi kâp a, ka kuoma a sa hung la a, i hung tlung hmaa ka ifâk zo ta a, mal ka isâwm ta kha tu am a nih a? Anih, ama chu malsâwmin um tho tho tâng a tih,” a tih a.

en: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.
hmr: Esau chun a pa thu hril a hrietin, nasatak le thlasetakin a ṭap tah a, a pa kuoma chun, “Aw pa, kei hi, kei khawm hi mal mi sâwm ve lul raw a tih a.

en: And he said, Thy brother came with guile, and hath taken away thy blessing.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘I sangin a mi hung hlêm a, i malsâwmna chu a lâkpêk ta che a nih,’ a tih a.

en: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
hmr: Esau chun a hminga Jakob an ti hi an ti dik hle ni lo am a nih? hi vawi hni a mi lân tah a nih a: ka nau lutir nina a mi lâkpêk a; chun, ngai ta, tuhin ka malsâwmna chu a mi lâkpêk nâwk ta hi,” a tih a. Chun, ama bawkin, “Malsâwmna i mi la hlapêk naw am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with grain and new wine have I sustained him: and what then shall I do for thee, my son?
hmr: Isak chun a dawn a, Esau kuomah, “Ngai ta, ama chu i lalah ka siem a, a unauhai po po khawm a siehlaw dingin ka pêk vawng a; bu le uoinin ka châwm ta bawk a; ka naupa, nanga ta dingin iengam thawpêk ka ti cheh a?” a tih a.

en: And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
hmr: Esau chun a pa kuomah, “Pa, malsâwmna pakhat bak amani i nei? Aw pa, kei hi, kei khawm hi mal mi sâwm ve lul rawh,” a tih a.
