en: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, of the fatness of the earth shall be thy dwelling, And of the dew of heaven from above;
hmr: Chun, Esau chu inringtakin a ṭap tah a. Chun, a pa Isak chun a dawn a, a kuomah, “Ngai ta, i umna hmun ding chu hnuoi ṭhatna hlata le, Chungtienga inthawka vân daidaw hlatah a nih a um ding chu.

en: And by thy sword shalt thou live, and thou shalt serve thy brother; And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt break loose, That thou shalt shake his yoke from off thy neck.
hmr: I kâwlhnâmin a nih i hring ding chu, i sang rawng khawm i bâwl ding a nih; În tleng suok pha ruok chun, A rîngkawl chu i rînga inthawk thinthla tâng i tih,” a tih a.

en: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
hmr: Chun, a pain mal a sâwmna lei chun Esau chun Jakob chu a theida tah a. Esau chun a lungrilin, “Ka pa sûn ni ding chu a hnai tah a, chu pha chun ka sang Jakob chu that el ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And the words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah; and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
hmr: A naupa upa lem Esau thu hril chu Rebeka an hril a; chuongchun, mi a tir a, a naupa naupang lem Jakob chu a ko a, a kuomah, “Ngai ta, i u Esau chun i chungthuah nang sukhlum tum chein ân hnêm a nih.

en: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
hmr: Chuleichun, ka naupa, tuhin ka thu hi awi rawh: tho la, Harana ka ṭapa Laban inah tlânhmang rawh.

en: and tarry with him a few days, until thy brother’s fury turn away;
hmr: I u lungsen hi a bo hmakhat chu ni iengzât lai amanih a kuomah va um phawt rawh,

en: until thy brother’s anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?
hmr: i u lungsenna hi a bo a, a chunga i thilthaw hi a theinghil pha chun mi tir ka ta, chutaka inthawk chu hung inṭhuoitir ka ti che, iengdingin am ni khatah in pahni hni chun chân el ka ti cheu a?” a tih a.

en: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
hmr: Chun, Rebeka chun Isak kuomah, “Heth naunuhai lei hin nun hi ka nghawk a nih. Jakob hin hi ram nunghâk, hieng Heth naunuhai laia mi hi nuhmeiin a nei ve nâwk lem chun, ka ta dingin hring hi ieng am ṭhahnem a ta?” a tih a.

en: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isak chun Jakob chu a ko a, mal a sâwm a, thu a pêk bawk a, a kuomah, “Kanaan ram nunghâkhai laia mi hi nuhmeiin i nei ding a ni nawh.

en: Arise, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.
hmr: Tho la, Paddan-aram rama i nu pa, Bethuel inah fe la, chutaka mi i nu ṭapa Laban naunuhmeihai laia mi chu nuhmeiin va nei rawh.

en: And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a company of peoples;
hmr: Pathien Iengkimthawthei chun mal sâwm chein, hnam tamtak um khâwm hung ni dingin chi tamtak inthlatir chein, sukpung raw se che.

en: and give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land of thy sojournings, which God gave unto Abraham.
hmr: Mikhuol i nina ram, Pathienin Abraham kuoma a pêk hi i hluo theina dingin Abraham malsâwmna chu indawngtir bawk raw se che, nang le i thlahai khawm,” a tih a.

en: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Paddan-aram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isakin Jakob chu ân fe hmangtir a: chun, Paddan-aram rama Jakob le Esau nu Rebeka ṭapa Aram mi Bethuel naupa Laban kuoma chun a fe tah a.

en: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan-aram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
hmr: Chun, Esau chun Isakin Jakob mal a sâwm a, nuhmei nei dingin Paddan-aram ramah ân fe hmangtir ti le, mal a sâwm laiin, “Kanaan nunghâkhai laia mi hi nuhmeiah i nei ding a ni nawh,” tiin thu a pêk ti,

en: and that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Paddan-aram:
hmr: le Jakobin a nu le pa thu awiin Paddan-aram ramah a fe tah ti a hriet a.

en: and Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
hmr: Chuonga Esauin Kanaan nu- nghâkhai chun a pa Isak lung chu an buo naw hle ti a hriet chun,

en: and Esau went unto Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.
hmr: Esau chu Ismael kuomah a va feh a, Abraham naupa Ismael naunu Mahalath, Nebaioth farnu chu, nuhmei dingin a nuhmei nei sahai bâka chun a va nei sa tah a.

en: And Jacob went out from Beer-sheba, and went toward Haran.
hmr: Jakob chu Beer-sebaa inthawk- in a suok a, Haran tieng a pan tah a.

en: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took one of the stones of the place, and put it under his head, and lay down in that place to sleep.
hmr: Chun, hmun ieng amanih a hang tlung a, nisa a tla ta leiin chutaka chun a riek tah a. Chu hmuna lung pakhat chu a lâk a, lukhamah a hmang a, chu hmuna chun in dingin a zâl tah a.

en: And he dreamed; and behold, a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven; and behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
hmr: Chun, mang a nei a, hnuoi chunga hin leilâk a lo indawh a, a tâwp chun vân a sun a; a chunga chun Pathien vântirkohai ṭum le kaiin a hmuh a.

en: And, behold, Jehovah stood above it, and said, I am Jehovah, the God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
hmr: A tâwpa chun LALPA a ngîr a, “Kei hi LALPA i pu Abraham Pathien le Isak Pathien chu ka nih, i zâlna hnuoi kha i kuoma le i thlahai kuomah la pêng ka ti cheu;

en: and thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
hmr: i thlahai chu hnuoia pilvut zâtin la um an ta, thlangtieng dâm, sak- tieng dâm, hmârtieng dâm, simtieng dâm indar lien i ta, nangma le i thlahaia chun khawvêla hnam tin la thawveng an tih.

en: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee whithersoever thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
hmr: Ngai ta, i kuomah ka um a, i fena taphawtah vêng pei ka ti cheh a, hi rama hin ṭhuoi kîr nâwk ka ti che: i kuoma ka hril hi ka thaw hmakhat chun thlathlam naw ning che,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely Jehovah is in this place; and I knew it not.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu a in a hung har a, “Hi hmuna hin LALPA chu a um ngei el, ka lo hriet si nawh,” a tih a.

en: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
hmr: Chun, a ṭih a, “Hi hmun hi ṭi a va um ngei de! Hi hi hmun dang a ni nawh a, Pathien in a lo ni hi tie, hi hi vân kawtkhâr a lo ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu zîngtieng inhmatakin a tho a, lung a ilukham chu a lâk a, lungphun dingin a phun a, a sîpa chun sahriek a buok a.

en: And he called the name of that place Beth-el: but the name of the city was Luz at the first.
hmr: Chu hmun hminga chun Bethel ân bûk a, a khaw hming hmasa chu Luz a nih.

en: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun thu a tiem tah a, “Pathien ka kuomah a um a, hi ka fena lampuia hin mi vêng a, fâk ding bei le sil ding silfên a mi pêk a,

en: so that I come again to my father’s house in peace, and Jehovah will be my God,
hmr: chuonga ka pa in tienga thlamuongtaka ka hung kîr nâwk phawt chun, LALPA chu ka Pathien nîng a ta,

en: then this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, shall be God’s house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
hmr: hi lungphun ka phun khawm hi Pathien in nîng a tih: chun, ka kuoma i mi pêk ding po poa chun sâwma pakhat chu pe ngei ngei ka ti che,” tiin.

en: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Jakob chu a fe pei a, khawsak nauhai ram chu a hung tlung tah a.

en: And he looked, and, behold, a well in the field, and, lo, three flocks of sheep lying there by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and the stone upon the well’s mouth was great.
hmr: A hang en chun phûla tuisunsuo um hi a hmuh a, a kâwla chun berâm ruol thum hi an um zing a; chu tuisunsuoa inthawk chun berâm ruolhai chu tui an indâwntir hlak a nih: tuisunsuo kawta lung um chu a lien hle el a.

en: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well’s mouth in its place.
hmr: Chutaka chun berâm ruol po po chu an fe khâwm hlak a, tuisunsuo kawta lung chu an inhlum hmang a, berâmhai chu tui an indâwntir a, lung chu tuisunsuo kawta a umna pângngaia chun an sie nâwk hlak a.

en: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence are ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.
hmr: Jakob chun an kuomah, “Ka unauhai, khawtienga mi am in nih a?” a tih a. Anni chun, “Harana mi kan nih,” an tih a.

en: And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Nahor naupa Laban in hriet am?” a tih a. Anni chun, “Hre e,” an tih a.

en: And he said unto them, Is it well with him? And they said, It is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “A dam lai a ni?” a tih a. Anni chun, “A dam lai a nih ie, en ta, a naunu Rakil khawm berâm ṭhuoiin a hung saw,” an tih a.

en: And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ngai ta u, nisa khawm a lân sâng hleh a, ran ṭhuoi khâwm khawm a la hun nawh a: berâmhai hi tui indâwntir unla vân thla ro khai,” a tih a.

en: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well’s mouth; then we water the sheep.
hmr: Anni chun, “Thei naw ning ungah, berâm ruol po po an fe khâwm a, tuisunsuo kawta lung hi an inhlum sawn hmakhat chu; chu hnunga chun berâmhai chu tui kan indâwn tir hlak a nih,” an tih a.

en: While he was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep; for she kept them.
hmr: Anni a la biek lai chun Rakil chu a pa berâmhai ṭhuoiin a hung tlung a; ama chun a vêng hlak a nih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun a nu ṭapa Laban naunu Rakil le, a nu ṭapa Laban berâm ruol chu a hmu chun a va hnai a, tuisunsuo kawta lung chu ân hlum hmang a, a nu ṭapa beramhai chu tui ân dâwntir tah a.

en: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin Rakil chu a fâwp a, inringtakin a ṭap tah a.

en: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s brother, and that he was Rebekah’s son: and she ran and told her father.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin ama chu chu minu pa tupa a nizie le Rebeka naupa a nizie Rakil chu a hril a; chuong- chun, Rakil chu a tlân a, a pa a va hril tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
hmr: Laban chu a farnu naupa Jakob chanchin a hriet chun, a tuok dingin a tlân a, a kuo a, a fâwp a, ama chu a inah a ṭhuoi tah a. Chun, Jakobin chuong thu po po chu Laban a hril tah a.

en: And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
hmr: Laban chun a kuomah, “Ka tisa le ka ru ngei i ni chu tie,” a tih a. Chun, thla khat a kuomah a um tah a.

en: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
hmr: Chun, Labanin Jakob kuomah, “Ka tupa i ni leiin a thlâwnin ka rawng i bâwl ding am a nih? Iengam hlâwng i ta? mi hril raw khai,” a tih a.

en: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
hmr: Laban chun naunuhmei pahni a nei a,a upa lem hming chu Leah a nih a, a naupang lem hming chu Rakil a nih.

en: And Leah’s eyes were tender; but Rachel was beautiful and well favored.
hmr: Leah chu mitmeng inkhup deutak a nih a, Rakil ruok chu pieng ṭhatak, hmêl ṭhatak a nih.

en: And Jacob loved Rachel; and he said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
hmr: Jakob chun Rakil chu a hmangai a; chuongchun, “I naunu- hmei naupang lem Rakil hi nei dingin kum sari i rawng bâwlpêk ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
hmr: Laban chun, “Ama chu mi dang kuoma ka pêk nêk chun i kuoma ka pêk chu ṭha lem a tih, ka kuomah um zing el rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
hmr: Jakob chun Rakil nei ding chun kum sari chu rawng a bâwl tah a, nisienlakhawm, Rakil chu a hmangai êm leiin ni sâwt nawte ang chauin a hriet a.

en: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin Laban kuomah, “Ka pâwl theina dingin ka nuhmei chu mi pe raw le, ka hun a kim ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
hmr: Chuongchun, Laban chun chu khuoa mi po po chu a khâwm vawng a, ruoi a ṭheh a.

en: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
hmr: Chun, thimbut hin a naunu Leah chu a ṭhuoi a, Jakob kuomah a ṭhuoi lût a; ama chun a lo pâwl a.

en: And Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid unto his daughter Leah for a handmaid.
hmr: (Laban chun a suoknu Zilpah chu a naunu Leah kuoma chun a suoknu dingin a pêk a).

en: And it came to pass in the morning that, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
hmr: Chun, zîngtieng a hung ni chun Leah a lo ni zing el a; chuongchun, Jakobin Laban kuomah, “Ka chunga i thilthaw hi iengtizie am a nih a? Rakil nei dingin i rawng ka bâwl ni lo am a nih? Iengdinga i mi hlêm am?” a tih a.

en: And Laban said, It is not so done in our place, to give the younger before the first-born.
hmr: Laban chun, “Kan rama hin chuong anga nau a u hmaa a naupang lem infetir chu dân a ni nawh ie.

en: Fulfil the week of this one, and we will give thee the other also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
hmr: A pakhata inneina chawlkâr chen chu tlingtla phawt la, chun, kum sari dang ka rawng i bâwl nâwk ding chun a dang khawm chu pêng kan ti che,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife.
hmr: Jakob chun chuong ang chun a thawh a, chu nu chawlkâr chu a tling- tlah a, chuongchun, a naunu Rakil chu a nuhmei dingin a pêk tah a.

en: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her handmaid.
hmr: (Laban chun a suoknu Bilha chu a naunu Rakil suoknu dingin a pêk a).

en: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
hmr: Jakob chun Rakil khawm chu a pâwl a, Leah nêk chun Rakil chu a hmangai lem bawk a, Laban rawng chu kum sari dang a bâwl nâwk tah a.

en: And Jehovah saw that Leah was hated, and he opened her womb: but Rachel was barren.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Leah chu theidain a um ti a hriet a, chuong- chun, a sul a hawngpêk a. Rakil ruok chu a ching a.

en: And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Because Jehovah hath looked upon my affliction; for now my husband will love me.
hmr: Chun, Leah chu ân rai a, naupasal a nei a, a hmingah Reuben a sak a: “LALPA chun ka rinumzie a hmu leiin a ni hi; tuhin chu ka pasalin mi hmangai tâng a tih,” a tih a.

en: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and said, Because Jehovah hath heard that I am hated, he hath therefore given me this son also: and she called his name Simeon.
hmr: Chun, ân rai nâwk a, naupasal a nei nâwk a, “LALPA chun theidain ka um ti a hriet leiin hi khawm hi a mi pêk a ni hi,” a tih a; chuongchun, a hmingah Simeon a sak a.

en: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have borne him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
hmr: Chun, ân rai nâwk a, naupasal a nei nâwk a, “Tu zêt hin chu naupasal pathum ka neipêk tah a, ka pasalin mi zâwm tâng a tih,” a tih a: chuleiin, a hmingah Levi sak a nih a.

en: And she conceived again, and bare a son: and she said, This time will I praise Jehovah: therefore she called his name Judah; and she left off bearing.
hmr: Chun, ân rai nâwk a, naupasal a nei nâwk a, “Tuta ṭum hin chu LALPA chu inpâk ka tih,” a tih a; chuleiin, a hmingah Juda a sak a, chu hnung chun nau a nei nâwk ta nawh.

en: Now the serpent was more subtle than any beast of the field which Jehovah God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of any tree of the garden?
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathienin ramsa a siem po poa chun rûl a var vervêk tak a. Ama chun nuhmei kuoma chun, “Pathienin ‘Huona thei ra hrim hrim hi in fâk ding a ni nawh,’ a ti am a nih?” a ta.

en: And the woman said unto the serpent, Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat:
hmr: Nuhmei chun rûl kuoma chun, “Ti lo e, huona thing rahai hi kan fâk thei a;

en: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
hmr: huon lailung lai taka thing um, chu ra ruok chu Pathienin, ‘in fâk ding a ni nawh a, tâwk khawm in tâwk ding a ni nawh, chuong naw chun thîng in tih,’ a ti a nih,” a ta.

en: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
hmr: Rûl chun nuhmei kuoma chun, “Thi naw tawp in tih;

en: for God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as God, knowing good and evil.
hmr: in fâk nia inthawk chun in mit hung var a ta, a suol le a ṭha hrein Pathien ang in hung ni ding a nih ti Pathienin a hriet zing a ni chu,” a ta.

en: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat; and she gave also unto her husband with her, and he did eat.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei chun thing ra chu fâk mi a nih ti le, mitlatak a nih ti le, mi sukvar dingin thing ra inhnarumtak a nih ti a hriet chun a ra ṭhenkhat chu a lo a, a fâk tah a; chun a pasal kuoma chun a pêk a, ama khawm chun a fâk tah a.

en: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig-leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
hmr: Chuongchun, an pahni chun an mit a hung var a, saruok an nih ti an hung inhriet tah a; theichang hna an ṭhui mat a, puonbil an insiem fâwm tah a.

en: And they heard the voice of Jehovah God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Jehovah God amongst the trees of the garden.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chu zântieng nisa deia huona a hung lêng chu an hriet a: chuongchun, Mihriem le a nuhmei chun huona thing lai chun LALPA Pathien chu an lo inbîksan tah a.

en: And Jehovah God called unto the man, and said unto him, Where art thou?
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun mihriem chu a ko a, a kuomah, “Khâwlai am i um a?” a ta.

en: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.
hmr: Ama chun, “Huonah i ri ka hriet a, saruok ka ni leiin ka ṭi tah a, chuongchun, kân bihmang a nih,” a ta.

en: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?
hmr: Ama chun “Saruok i nih ti tuin am a hril cheh a? Thing ra fâk lo ding ka ti tlat che kha i fâk a ni maw?” a tih a.

en: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.
hmr: Mihriem chun, “A mi umpui dinga nuhmei i mi pêk ngei khan thing ra chu a mi pêk a, ka fâk tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah God said unto the woman, What is this thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun nuhmei kuoma chun, “I thilthaw hi iengtizie am a na?” a ta. Nuhmei chun, “Rûlin a mi hlêm a ka fâk tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, cursed art thou above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
hmr: Lalpa Pathien chun rûl kuoma chun, “Hieng ang hi i thaw leiin ran po po le ramsa tinrêng laia chun ṭawngsephurin um bîk i ta, bawk- khupin lâwn tâng i ta, i dam sûngin pilvut fa bawk i tih;

en: and I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed: he shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
hmr: nang le nuhmei hi indotir ka ti cheu a, i thlahai le a thlahai khawm lân dotir bawk ka tih; ama chun i lu la sukthitling a ta, nangin a kekhawng la sukthitling i tih,” a ta.

en: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy pain and thy conception; in pain thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
hmr: Nuhmei kuoma chun, “Nau vawnna le nau neinaa i rinumna chu nasatakin sukpung ka ta, natak tuorin nau nei hlak i ta; nisien- lakhawm, i nuom zâwng chu i pasal tieng nîng a ta, ama chun i chungah thu nei a tih,” a ta.

en: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in toil shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
hmr: Chun, Adam kuoma chun, “I nuhmei thu i zâwm a, thing pakhat, ‘A ra i fâk ding a ni nawh,’ tiha thu ka pêk che kha a ra i fâk leiin hnuoi hi nanga leiin ṭawngsephurin a um tah a nih; i dam sûngin inrimtaka sinthawin a ra chu fa tâng i tih;

en: thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
hmr: hling le buorhai khawm insuo- pêk a ti che; chun, hnuoia thlai chu fa tâng i ta;

en: in the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.
hmr: hnuoia i kîr nâwk hmakhat chu, i hmaiah thlan luong rak khawpin bu fa tâng i tih; hnuoia inthawka lâk suok i ni sih a, pilvut i nih a, pil- vutah i kîr nâwk ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And the man called his wife’s name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.
hmr: Chun, mihriem chun a nuhmei chu mi hring po po nu a ni leiin a hmingah Evi ân bûk a.

en: And Jehovah God made for Adam and for his wife coats of skins, and clothed them.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun, Adam ta ding le a nuhmei ta ding chun savun zakawfuolhai a siempêk a, ân hâktir tah a.

en: And Jehovah God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil; and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever—
hmr: Chun, LALPA Pathien chun, “Ngai ta u, mihriem chu a suol le a ṭha hrein eini laia pakhat ang a hung ni tah a; tuhin chu a kuta banin, hringna thing ra chu loa fain, kumkhuoin hring rawi a tih,” a ta,

en: therefore Jehovah God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
hmr: chuleiin, LALPA Pathienin ama a lâksuokna hnuoi chu inlet dingin Eden huona inthawk chun a tir suok tah a.

en: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden the Cherubim, and the flame of a sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
hmr: Chuongchun, mihriem chu a hnawt dawk tah a; chun, hringna thing lampui chu vêng dingin Eden huon saktieng panga chun Cherubhai le mei kâwlhnâm inlet tuo zawk zawk chu a sie ta bawk a.

en: And when Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister; and she said unto Jacob, Give me children, or else I die.
hmr: Rakil chun Jakob chu nau hrim a neipêk nawh ti ân hriet chun, a unu chu a îtthîk tah a, Jakob kuoma chun, “Nauhai mi pe rawh, chuong naw chun ka thi el ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God’s stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
hmr: Rakil chunga chun Jakob chu a lunginsen thut el a; chuongchun, “I rîla ra phalnawtu Pathien aiawtu bêk am ka nih?” a tih a.

en: And she said, Behold, my maid Bilhah, go in unto her; that she may bear upon my knees, and I also may obtain children by her.
hmr: Amanu chun, “En ta, ka suoknu Bilha hi, ama hi pâwl rawh; chuong- chun, kei khâwmin amaah nauhai ka nei ve theina dingin, ka khûp chunga hin nau a nei ding annâwm,” a tih a.

en: And she gave him Bilhah her handmaid to wife: and Jacob went in unto her.
hmr: Chuongchun, a suoknu Bilha chu a nuhmei dingin a pêk a, Jakob chun ama chu a lo pâwl a.

en: And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.
hmr: Bilha chu ân rai a, Jakob chu naupasal a neipêk tah a.

en: And Rachel said, God hath judged me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a son: therefore called she his name Dan.
hmr: Rakil chun, “Pathienin a mi ngaituoh a, ka rawl a hriet bawk a, naupasal a mi pêk a ni hi,” a tih a. Chuleiin, a hmingah Dan a sak a.

en: And Bilhah Rachel’s handmaid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.
hmr: Chun, Rakil suoknu Bilha chu ân rai nâwk a, Jakob chu naupasal dang a neipêk nâwk a.

en: And Rachel said, With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed: and she called his name Naphtali.
hmr: Chun, Rakil chun, “Pathien in- buonin ka unaunu chu ka buon a, ka hne tah,” a tih a, chuongchun, a hmingah Naphtali a sak a.

en: When Leah saw that she had left off bearing, she took Zilpah her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob to wife.
hmr: Leah chun nau dang a nei nâwk ta nawh ti ân hrietin a suoknu Zilpah chu a ṭhuoi a, a nuhmei dingin Jakob kuomah a pêk a.

en: And Zilpah Leah’s handmaid bare Jacob a son.
hmr: Chuongchun, Leah suoknu Zil- pah chun Jakob chu naupasal a neipêk a.

en: And Leah said, Fortunate! and she called his name Gad.
hmr: Chun, Leah chun, “A va ham- ṭhatthlâk ngei de,” a tih a; chuong- chun, a hmingah Gad a sak a.

en: And Zilpah Leah’s handmaid bare Jacob a second son.
hmr: Leah suoknu Zilpah chun Jakob chu naupasal dang a neipêk nâwk a.

en: And Leah said, Happy am I! for the daughters will call me happy: and she called his name Asher.
hmr: Leah chun, “Ka va hamṭha de! nuhmeihai chun hamṭha mi ti ngawt an tih,” a tih a; chuongchun, a hming- ah Aser a sak a.

en: And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray thee, of thy son’s mandrakes.
hmr: Chun, bu lâk lai hin Reuben chun phûlah Zâwldiai a va hmuh a, a nu Leah kuomah a hung chawi a. Chun, Rakil chun Leah kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin i naupa zâwldiai a ṭhen mi pe ta?” a tih a.

en: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken away my husband? and wouldest thou take away my son’s mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee to-night for thy son’s mandrakes.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “Ka pasal i mi lâkpêk hi thil duoi am a nih? Ka naupa zawldiai khawm i mi lâkpêk nâwk pei ding maw?” a tih a. Rakil chun, “Annawleh, i naupa zâwldiai aiah vawizân zâlpui a ti che,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in unto me; for I have surely hired thee with my son’s mandrakes. And he lay with her that night.
hmr: Chun, zântieng chun Jakob chu phûla inthawk chun a hung a, Leah chu a tuok dingin a va suok a, “I mi pâwl ding a nih, ka naupa zawldiaiin ka haw tlat ta che a nih,” a tih a. Chuongchun, chu zân chun a zâlpui tah a.

en: And God hearkened unto Leah, and she conceived, and bare Jacob a fifth son.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Leah ṭawng- ṭaina a ngai a; chuongchun, ân rai a, Jakob chu naupasal pangana a neipêk a.

en: And Leah said, God hath given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband: and she called his name Issachar.
hmr: Leah chun, “Ka suoknu chu ka pasal kuoma ka pêk leiin Pathienin ka hlaw a mi pêk tah a ni hi,” a tih a: chuongchun, a hmingah Issakar a sak a.

en: And Leah conceived again, and bare a sixth son to Jacob.
hmr: Chun, Leah chu ân rai nâwk a, Jakob chu naupasal parukna a neipêk a.

en: And Leah said, God hath endowed me with a good dowry; now will my husband dwell with me, because I have borne him six sons: and she called his name Zebulun.
hmr: Chun, Leah chun, “Pathienin thuom ṭhatak a mîn neitir a; tuhin chu ka pasal chu naupasal paruk ka neipêk ta leiin ka kuomah um tâng a tih,” a tih a; chuongchun, a hmingah Zebulun a sak a.

en: And afterwards she bare a daughter, and called her name Dinah.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun naunuhmei a nei a, a hmingah Dina a sak a.

en: And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to her, and opened her womb.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Rakil chu a hriet zing a, Pathien chun a ṭawng- ṭaina a ngai a, a sul a hawngpêk tah a.

en: And she conceived, and bare a son: and said, God hath taken away my reproach:
hmr: Chuongchun, ân rai a, naupasal a nei a: chun, “Pathienin ka hming sie ân khum tah,” a tih a:

en: and she called his name Joseph, saying, Jehovah add to me another son.
hmr: chun, “Lalpa chun naupasal dang mi pe sa raw se,” tiin, a hmingah Josef a sak a.

en: And it came to pass, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said unto Laban, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country.
hmr: Rakilin Josef a hung nei chun, Jakobin Laban kuomah, “Ka umna pângngai, ka ram tienga ka fe theina dingin mîn fetir ta raw khai, i rawng ka bâwl san ka nuhmeihai le ka nauhai hi mi pe la, mîn fetir rawh.

en: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my service wherewith I have served thee.
hmr: I rawng ka bâwlpêk zie che hlak chu i hriet sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Laban said unto him, If now I have found favor in thine eyes, tarry: for I have divined that Jehovah hath blessed me for thy sake.
hmr: Laban chun a kuomah, “I mi lunginsiet thei chun la um phawt ta la, LALPA chun nanga zârah mal a mi sâwm ti aisânin ka hriet i sawnnaw,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin, “I hlaw ding chu mi hril la, chuongchun, pêng ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy cattle have fared with me.
hmr: Ama chun, “Iengtin am i rawng ka bâwl a, ka enkawlna hnuoiah i ran chu iengtin am an um ti i hriet annâwm.

en: For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it hath increased unto a multitude; and Jehovah hath blessed thee whithersoever I turned: and now when shall I provide for mine own house also?
hmr: Ka hung hma chun tlâwmte bak i nei a, tuhin chu tamtak an hung ni ta hi; ka nghatna tieng tieng LALPA chun mal a sâwmpêk pei che a nih: amiruokchu, iengtik am keia sûngkaw ta dingin suksuok vêng ka tih a?” a tih a.

en: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Jacob said, Thou shalt not give me aught: if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed thy flock and keep it.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ieng am pêng ka ti cheh a” a tih a. Jakob chun, “Iengkhawm i mi pêk ding a ni nawh; hi thil hi i mi thawpêk chun i ran ruol chu inthlain vêngpêk nâwk ka ti che.

en: I will pass through all thy flock to-day, removing from thence every speckled and spotted one, and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats: and of such shall be my hire.
hmr: Vawisûn hin i ran ruol chu va en suok vawng ka ta, berâm laia a dumin a rawl le, a dum pheu pheu le, a dum taphawt le, kêl laia a vârin a rawl le, a vârin a rawl pheu pheu chu, chutaka inthawkin ṭhuoi tum ka ta; chun, tuta hnung chu chuong anga um chu ka hlaw ni sienla.

en: So shall my righteousness answer for me hereafter, when thou shalt come concerning my hire that is before thee: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and black among the sheep, that, if found with me, shall be counted stolen.
hmr: Chuongchun, nakie ka hlaw dinghai en dinga i hung pha chun ka felna hin mi dawnpêk el a tih: kêl lai chun a vârin a rawl naw le, a vârin a rawl pheu pheu naw le, berâm laia a dum naw ka kuoma um i hmu taphawt chu ka inrûkah ruot el i tih,” a tih a.

en: And Laban said, Behold, I would it might be according to thy word.
hmr: Laban chun, “A ṭha ie! i hril ang tak chun ni raw se,” a tih a.

en: And he removed that day the he-goats that were ringstreaked and spotted, and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons;
hmr: Chuongchun, chu ni tak chun kêlchal a vâra inzetan le, a vâra rawl pheu pheu po po le, kêlpui a vârin a rawl le, a vârin a rawl pheu pheu po po, a vâr ṭhang taphawt chu be- râm laia a dum po po le chun a ṭhuoi tum a, a naupasalhai kutah a pêk a.

en: and he set three days’ journey betwixt himself and Jacob: and Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flocks.
hmr: Chun, ama le Jakob inkâra ni thum lama chun ân umtir a; chun, Jakob chun Laban ran ruol dang po po chu ân thla nâwk tah a.

en: And Jacob took him rods of fresh poplar, and of the almond and of the plane-tree; and peeled white streaks in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin hriengzau le almond thing le insething hmawl hring a lâk a, a hâwng a khawk vâr a, hmawlhaia chun a vâr chu a suklang a.

en: And he set the rods which he had peeled over against the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink; and they conceived when they came to drink.
hmr: A hmawl khawkna hâwnghai chu ran idâwn hlakna tui dâwnna thlênga dâm le, tui luongnaahai chun ran ruol hma peia chun a sieh a: chun, tui dâwn dinga an hung chun an hung inrai phut a.

en: And the flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks brought forth ringstreaked, speckled, and spotted.
hmr: Ran ruolhai chu hmawlhai zâwna chun an inrai phut a, a ze intan dâm, a ze chip nuk dâm, ân ze pheu pheu dâmin te an hung nei hlak a.

en: And Jacob separated the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the ringstreaked and all the black in the flock of Laban: and he put his own droves apart, and put them not unto Laban’s flock.
hmr: Jakob chun berâmtehai chu a sie tum a; ran ruolhai chu Laban ran ruolhai lai a ze intan le a dum po po tieng chu ân nghattir a; ama ran ruolhai chu a sie tum hlak a, Laban ran ruol lai chu a sie nawh a.

en: And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger of the flock did conceive, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods;
hmr: Ran hrât deuhai chu an hung inrai hlima, hmawl lai chun an inrai theina dingin, Jakob chun tui luongnaah, ran ruol mithmua chun hmawlhai chu a sie hlak a.

en: but when the flock were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were Laban’s, and the stronger Jacob’s.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ran chu an ṭan a ṭha naw chun a sie ngai nawh: chuongchun, a te ṭanṭha naw deu- hai chu Laban ta a hung ni pei a, a hrât deuhai chu Jakob ta a hung ni pei a.

en: And the man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, and maid-servants and men-servants, and camels and asses.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu nasa- takin a hung pung a, ran ruol, ruol lientak dâm, suoknu le suokpa dâm, sanghâwngsei dâm, sabengtung dâm a hung nei tah a.

en: And he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father’s; and of that which was our father’s hath he gotten all this glory.
hmr: Jakob chun Laban naupa- haiin, “Jakobin ei pa ta po po a lâkpêk vawng a, ei pa taa mi a nih hieng hausakna a nei po po hi,” an ti thuhai a lo hriet a.

en: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as beforetime.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chun Laban hmêl chu a en a, hi hma ang khan a chungah a ṭha ta nawh ti a hmuh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Jakob kuomah, “I thlatuhai le i laibunghai ramah fe nâwk ta rawh, i kuomah um pei ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chun mi a tir a, phûla a ran ruol umnaa chun Rakil le Leah chu ân kotir a;

en: and said unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as beforetime; but the God of my father hath been with me.
hmr: an kuomah, “In pa hmêl ka enin hi hma ang khan ka chungah a ṭha ta nawh ti ka hmuh a; nisienlakhawm, ka pa Pathien chu ka kuomah a um zing a nih.

en: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
hmr: Nangni khawmin in pa rawng hi ka theitâwpin ka bâwl ti in hriet a.

en: And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, in pa chun a mi hlêm a, ka hlaw hi vawi sâwm lai a mi sukdanglampêk tah a; nisienla- khawm, Pathienin ka pawi a tawk a phal naw a nih.

en: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the flock bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstreaked shall be thy wages; then bare all the flock ringstreaked.
hmr: A ze irawl nukhai chu i hlaw nîng a tih, a ti leh ran po po chun te, a ze irawl nukhai an nei hlak a; chun ‘A ze itanhai i hlaw nîng a tih,’ a ti leh ran po po chun te a ze itan ruok an nei hlak a.

en: Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Pathienin in pa ranhai chu a lâkpêk a, kei a mi pêk tah a ni hi.

en: And it came to pass at the time that the flock conceive, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the he-goats which leaped upon the flock were ringstreaked, speckled, and grizzled.
hmr: Ranhai an inzâwl hun lai chun ka mangin ka hang dâk a, ran zâwltu a chalhai chu a ze intan dâm, a ze irawl dâm, a ze ṭielṭak dâm, an nih ti ka hmuh a.

en: And the angel of God said unto me in the dream, Jacob: and I said, Here am I.
hmr: Chun, ka manga chun Pathien vântirkoin, ‘Jakob,’ a mi hung tih a. Kei chun, ‘Hitaka hi ka um,’ ka tih a.

en: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see: all the he-goats which leap upon the flock are ringstreaked, speckled, and grizzled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘Hung dâk la en rawh, ran zâwltu a chalhai po po saw, a ze intan dâm, a ze irawl dâm, a ze ṭielṭak dâm an ni saw: I chunga Laban thilthaw po po hi ka hmu a nih.

en: I am the God of Beth-el, where thou anointedst a pillar, where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy nativity.
hmr: Kei hi lungphuna sahriek i nâlna, a kuoma thu i tiemna, kha Bethel Pathien kha ka nih; tuhin tho la, hi rama inthawk hin suok la, i piengna rama chun fe nâwk ta rawh,’ a tih a,” a ta.

en: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?
hmr: Rakil le Leah chun an dawn a, a kuomah, “Kan pa ina chun kan ta dingin chanvo le ro inkhâwm ding hrim a la um ta rawp am a nih?

en: Are we not accounted by him as foreigners? for he hath sold us, and hath also quite devoured our money.
hmr: Ama chun ram dang mi ang chauah a mi ngai tah ni lo am a nih? A mi zawr a, kan man khawm a fâk zo vawng ta sih a.

en: For all the riches which God hath taken away from our father, that is ours and our children’s: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.
hmr: Pathienin kan pa kuoma in- thawka sum a lâkpêk po po chu keini le kan nauhai ta a ni hi; chuongchun, Pathienin i kuoma a hril taphawt chu thaw raw khai,” an tih a.

en: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon the camels;
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu a tho a, a naupasalhai le a nuhmeihai chu sanghâwngseihai chungah ân chuongtir a;

en: and he carried away all his cattle, and all his substance which he had gathered, the cattle of his getting, which he had gathered in Paddan-aram, to go to Isaac his father unto the land of Canaan.
hmr: chun, Kanaan rama a pa Isak kuoma fe dingin a ran po po le, a sum inkhâwl po po, a ran hmuhai, Paddan-aram rama ân khâwlhai chu a fepui ta vawng a.

en: Now Laban was gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father’s.
hmr: Laban chu a berâm hmul vaw dingin a fe dai a; chun, Rakil chun a pa milimhai chu ân rûkpêk a;

en: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.
hmr: chun, Jakob chu Aram mi Laban hriet naw kârin a fe hmang dai tah a, a tlân hmang ding chu a hril nawh a.

en: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the River, and set his face toward the mountain of Gilead.
hmr: Chuongchun, a nei po po le chun a tlân hmang tah a; chun, a tho a, Vadungpui chu a kân a, Gilead tlâng tieng chu panin a fe pei tah a.

en: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.
hmr: Jakob chu a tlân hmang ti, a ni thum niah, Laban an hril a.

en: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days’ journey; and he overtook him in the mountain of Gilead.
hmr: Chuongchun, a unauhai a ṭhuoi a, ni sari lam a hnawt a, Gilead tlânga chun a hnawt phâk tah a.

en: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream of the night, and said unto him, Take heed to thyself that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
hmr: Chun, Aram mi Laban kuoma chun zânah a mangah Pathien a hung a, a kuomah, “Jakob kuomah a sie a ṭha, a iengkhawm hril lo dingin fîmkhur rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Laban came up with Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain: and Laban with his brethren encamped in the mountain of Gilead.
hmr: Laban chun Jakob chu a hnawt phâk a.Jakob chun a puon in chu tlânga chun a lo zar tah a; chun, Laban khawm chun a unauhai leh Gilead tlânga chun an zar ve tah a.

en: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters as captives of the sword?
hmr: Chun, Laban chun Jakob kuomah, “I thilthaw hi iengtizie am a ni leh? ka hriet naw kâr i fe rûk dai a, kâwlhnâma salmanhai ang ela ka naunuhmeihai i ṭhuoi hmang hi?

en: Wherefore didst thou flee secretly, and steal away from me, and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth and with songs, with tabret and with harp;
hmr: Iengdinga inrûka i tlân hmang a, i mîn relrûk san a, hlimna le hla dâm, khuongte le ṭingṭang dâm le kan inthlana ding cheha i mi hril nawh a,

en: and didst not suffer me to kiss my sons and my daughters? now hast thou done foolishly.
hmr: ka naunuhmeihai le ka tuhai khawm ka fâwp i phal naw am an leh? Invêtthlâktakin a nih thil i thaw hi.

en: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take heed to thyself that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
hmr: Suksethei che ka nih i sawn- naw: nisienlakhawm, i pa Pathien chun zâni zân khan, ‘Jakob kuomah a sie a ṭha iengkhawm hril lo dingin fimkhur rawh,’ tiin a mi biek a nih.

en: And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father’s house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
hmr: Chun, i pa in ngai tain fe inhâwk êm êm la khawm, iengdinga ka pathienhai mîn rupêk am i nih a?” a tih a.

en: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Lest thou shouldest take thy daughters from me by force.
hmr: Jakob chun a dawn a, Laban kuomah, “Ka ṭi lei a nih, i nau- nuhmeihai hi mi lapêk rawi i tih, ti ka ṭiha a nih.

en: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, he shall not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
hmr: Tukhawm i pathienhai i hmûna chu dam naw ni hai; ei unauhai mithmua hin i ta kan kuoma um chu en chieng la, la ta la,” a tih a. Rakilin a lo inrûk ti Jakob chun a hriet si nawh a.

en: And Laban went into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the tent of the two maid-servants; but he found them not. And he went out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.
hmr: Chun, Laban chu Jakob puon ina dâm, Leah puon ina dâm, suoknuhai pahni puon ina dâm chun a lût pei a; nisienlakhawm, a hmu nawh a. Leah puon ina inthawk chu a suok a, Rakil puon ina chun a lût a.

en: Now Rachel had taken the teraphim, and put them in the camel’s saddle, and sat upon them. And Laban felt about all the tent, but found them not.
hmr: Rakil chun milim chu a lâk a, sanghâwngsei thuomhnaw lai chun a lo sieh a, a lo ṭhung deh a. Laban chun a puon in sûng po po chu a dap vêl vawng a, nisienkhawm, a hmu nawh a,

en: And she said to her father, Let not my lord be angry that I cannot rise up before thee; for the manner of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the teraphim.
hmr: chun ama chun a pa kuomah, “I hmah a ka tho pei naw leiin, ka lalpa, lunginsen naw rawh; nuhmei umdân pângngai chu ka chunga a um lai tak a ni sih a,” a tih a. Chuongchun, a zawng a zawng a, milimhai chu a hmu zo ta nawh a.

en: And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast hotly pursued after me?
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu a lunginsen tah a, Laban chu a hal a. Jakob chun Laban kuomah, “Iengam ka bawsiet a, iengam a na ka suolna i mi hung hnawt rak el a?

en: Whereas thou hast felt about all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? Set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us two.
hmr: Ka thuomhnaw po po i dap suok vawng khawmin, i insûng thuom- hnaw hrim iengam i hmu leh? Ka unauhai le i unauhai hmaa hin hung sie suok la, a tu lem am ei indik ngaituo raw hai se.

en: These twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she-goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flocks have I not eaten.
hmr: Tuhin kum sâwmhni zet i kuomah ka um tah a, i berâmpuihai le i kêlpuihai chun an têhai an nei suol hrim hrim ngai nawh a, i berâm ruol laia a chalhai khawm ka fâk ngai bawk nawh.

en: That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night.
hmr: Ramsa se khawm i kuoma hin ka la hung intlun ngai nawh a, keiin ân hmang ai chu ka tuor lem hlak a, sûna inrûk ni leh, zâna inrûk ni leh ka ithung i phût hlak a.

en: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep fled from mine eyes.
hmr: Vawi tamtak chu sûna nisa lum le zâna khawdeiin a mi sukrinum êm êm hlak a, îmu khawm ka hmu ngai nawh.

en: These twenty years have I been in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy flock: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
hmr: Chuong kum sâwmhni sûng po chu i kuomah ka um a, i naunu- hmeihai pahni hlaw dingin kum sâwmpali le, i ranhai hlaw dingin kum ruk i rawng ka bâwl a; ka hlaw hlak chu vawi sâwm lai i sukdanglam sih a.

en: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the Fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely now hadst thou sent me away empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
hmr: Ka pa Pathien, Abraham Pathien, Isak Iṭi chu ka kuomah um naw sienla lem chu, tu khawm hin ruok ngawta mîn fetir ngei ding i ni hi. Pathienin ka rinum tuor le ka rimsikzie chu a hmuh a, zâni zân chun a kâwk che a ni chu,” a tih a.

en: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, The daughters are my daughters, and the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children whom they have borne?
hmr: Chun, Laban chun a dawn a, a kuomah, “Naunuhmeihai hi keia nauhai an nih a, naupanghai hi keia naupanghai an nih a, ranhai hi keia ran an nih a, i hmu po po hi keia ta vawng an nih: vawisûn hin hieng ka naunuhmeihai chunga le an nauhai chunga hin iengam thaw thei ka ti leh?

en: And now come, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
hmr: Hung ta, kei le nang hin thu thlung ei tih, chu chu kei le nanga kâra hrietna ni raw se,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chun lung a lâk a, lungphun dingin a phun a.

en: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made a heap: and they did eat there by the heap.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin a unauhai kuom- ah, “Lung la khâwm ro,” a tih a; chun, lung an lâk a, an intieng khâwm a; chun, lung intieng khâwm kâwla chun bu an fâk a.

en: And Laban called it Jegar-saha-dutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.
hmr: Laban chun chu lung intieng khâwm chu Jegar-sahadutha ân bûk a; Jakob ruok chun Galeed ân bûk a.

en: And Laban said, This heap is witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed:
hmr: Laban chun, “Hi lung intieng khâwm hi vawisûn hin kei le nanga kâra hrietpuitu a ni hi,” a tih a. Chuleiin, a hminga chun Galeed inbûk a ni tah a.

en: and Mizpah, for he said, Jehovah watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
hmr: Mizpah inbûk a ni bawk a, “Inṭheha ei um hnungin LALPA chun mi vêng tuo raw se.

en: If thou shalt afflict my daughters, and if thou shalt take wives besides my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
hmr: Ka naunuhmeihai hi i sukrim- sih a, ka naunuhmeihai ni lo nuhmei dang i nei chun, tukhawm ei kuoma hin an um nawha chu, en ta, Pathien chu kei le nanga kâra hretu a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold the pillar, which I have set betwixt me and thee.
hmr: Laban bawk chun Jakob kuomah, “Hi lung intieng khâwm hi en la, kei le nanga kâra hi lung ka phun khawm hi en ta.

en: This heap be witness, and the pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.
hmr: Pawi intâwkpêk dingin, keiin hi lung intieng khâwm hi khêlin i kuom tieng hung naw ningah a, ti le, nang khawmin hi lung intieng khâwm le hi lungphun hi khêlin ka kuom tieng hung naw ti nih, ti hi lung intieng khâwm hi hrietna ni sienla, hi lungphun khawm hi hrietna ni bawk raw se.

en: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the Fear of his father Isaac.
hmr: Abraham Pathien, Nahor Pathien, an pa Pathien chun ei kâra thu ngaituo raw se,” a ti nâwk a. Chun Jakob chun a pa Isak Iṭi chu sâlin ṭawng ân khâm tah a:

en: And Jacob offered a sacrifice in the mountain, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mountain.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin tlânga chun inthawina ân hlân a, a unauhai chu bei fa dingin a ko a; chuongchun, bei an fâk a, tlânga chun an riek tah a.

en: And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
hmr: Chun, zingkâr Laban chu a tho a, a tuhai le a naunuhmeihai chu a fâwp a, mal a sâwm a; chun, Laban chu a feh a, ama umna tieng a kir nâwk tah a.

en: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
hmr: Jakob chu a fe ta pei a; chun, Pathien vântirkohaiin an lo intuokpui a.

en: And Jacob said when he saw them, This is God’s host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
hmr: Jakobin anni a hmu chun, “Hieng hi Pathien pâwlhai an nih,” a tih a; chuongchun, chu hmun hminga chun Mahanaim ân bûk a.

en: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the field of Edom.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun Seir rama Edom phûl tienga a u Esau kuoma chun a hmaah zuolkohai ân tlântir a.

en: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye say unto my lord Esau: Thus saith thy servant Jacob, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed until now:
hmr: “Ka lalpa Esau kuoma chun hieng ang hin in hril ding a nih, ‘I siehlaw Jakobin hieng ang hin a ti a nih: Laban kuoma chun mikhuol ka nih a, tu chen hin ka um ta zing a.

en: and I have oxen, and asses, and flocks, and men-servants, and maid-servants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find favor in thy sight.
hmr: Bâwngchal dâm, sabengtung le berâm dâm, suoknu le suokpa dâm ka nei bawk a, i lunginsietna ka hmu theina dingin, ka lalpa hril dingin mi ka hung tir a nih,’ a tih,” tiin, thu a pêk a.

en: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and moreover he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
hmr: Chun, zuolkohai chu Jakob kuomah an hung kîr nâwk a, “I u Esau kuom kan va tlung a, mi za li hung ṭhuoiin a tuok ding chein a hung nghe nghe annaw,” an tih a.

en: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and was distressed: and he divided the people that were with him, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two companies;
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu a ṭi êm êm a, a lunginzîng tah a; chun, a kuoma mi umhai dâm, berâm ruol le bâwng ruol dâm, sanghâwngseihai dâm chu pâwl hniin a siem a:

en: and he said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the company which is left shall escape.
hmr: Esau chu pâwl khatah a hunga a that khawmin pâwl khat la um chu tlân hmang thei an tih ti a ngaituoh a.

en: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, O Jehovah, who saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will do thee good:
hmr: Chun, Jakob bawk chun, “Aw ka pu Abraham Pathien, ka pa Isak Pathien, aw LALPA, ‘I ram tieng le i laibunghai lai fe nâwk ta rawh, chuongchun, siem ṭhâng ka ti che’ mi titu,

en: I am not worthy of the least of all the lovingkindnesses, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two companies.
hmr: i siehlaw chunga lunginsietna po po în langtir le thutak po po în langtir laia a chîntak khawm hi hmu tlâk ka ni nawh; hi Jordan hi ka hmawl le bak ka kân a; tuhin chu pâwl hni zet ka lo ni ta hi.

en: Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he come and smite me, the mother with the children.
hmr: Lunginsiettakin ka u kuta inthawk, Esau kuta inthawk ngei chu mi sanhim rawh, nunau puma a mi hung that ka ṭi sih a.

en: And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
hmr: Nangin, ‘Siem ṭha ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, i thlahai chu tuisuorieta phaiphin tiem sênglo khawp raua tam angin siem ka ti che,’ i ti sih a,” a tih a.

en: And he lodged there that night, and took of that which he had with him a present for Esau his brother:
hmr: Chun, chu zân chun chutaka chun a riek tah a; chun, a thil nei laia mi a u Esau ta dingin lâwmman dingin a sie tum a;

en: two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,
hmr: kêlpui za hni le kêlchal sâwm- hni, berâmpui za hni le berâmchal sâwmhni,

en: thirty milch camels and their colts, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty she-asses and ten foals.
hmr: sanghâwngsei sâwrlai sâwm- thum an tehai leh, bâwngpui sâwmli le bâwngchal sâwm, sabengtungpui sâwmhni le sabengtungchal sâwm leh.

en: And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by itself, and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chu pâwl tin a tum sengin a siehlawhai kutah ân kawltir a: chun, a siehlawhai kuoma chun, “Ka hmaah fe kai unla, pâwl tin hi kâr inneitir pei ro,” a tih a.

en: And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
hmr: A hmaṭhuoitu kuoma chun hieng hin thu a pêk a, “Ka u Esau chun ân tuokpui cheh a, ‘Tu mi am i nih a? Khâwlaia fe ding am? I hmaa umhai hi tu ta am?’ tiha ân dawn pha che chun,

en: then thou shalt say, They are thy servant Jacob’s; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, he also is behind us.
hmr: ‘I siehlaw Jakob ta an nih, pu Esau, i ta dingin lâwmmana ân phur che a ni hi: ama khawm kan hnungah a um’ ti rawh,” tiin.

en: And he commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him;
hmr: A dawttu le, a dawt nâwktu le ran ruol khaltuhai po po kuoma khawm, “Esau in hmu pha chun chuong ang tak chun in hril ding a nih.

en: and ye shall say, Moreover, behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept me.
hmr: ‘Chun, ngai ta, i siehlaw Jakob chu kan hnunga sawn a um,’ ti bawk unla,” tiin thu a pêk seng a. “Lâwmman ka hmaa fe hin a lung sukdam ka ta, chu hnunga chun a hmêl hmûng ka tih; chuongchun, mi lo lâwm el a tih,” a ti a nih.

en: So the present passed over before him: and he himself lodged that night in the company.
hmr: Chuongchun, lâwmman chu a hmaa chun a fe kai tah a, ama ruokchu chu zân chun a pâwl lai chun a riek tah a.

en: And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two handmaids, and his eleven children, and passed over the ford of the Jabbok.
hmr: Chu zân chun a tho a, a nuhmeihai pahni le, a suoknuhai pahni le, a nau sâwm le pakhathai chu a ṭhuoi a, Jabbok vadung kaia chun a kai tah a.

en: And he took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which he had.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu a ṭhuoi a, vadung chu ân kaitir a, a nei po po khawm ân kaitir bawk a.

en: And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu ama khât bakin a um tah a; chun, mi pakhatin ama chu khawfingchat chenin a buon a buon a.

en: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was strained, as he wrestled with him.
hmr: A hne nawh ti ân hrietin a êlpui ru suktuona lai hi a khîk pêk a; chuongchun, a buon lai chun Jakob êlpui ru insuktuokna chu a hung inpelsawl tah a.

en: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
hmr: Chun, mi chun, “Mîn thla rawh, khawfing khawm a chat ding a ni ta hi,” a tih a. Jakob chun, “Mal i mi sâwm naw chun inthla naw ning che,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
hmr: Chun, mi chun a kuomah, “I hming iem a na?” a tih a. Ama chun, “Jakob,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for thou hast striven with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
hmr: Chun, mi chun, “I hming chu Jakob ti ta naw ni hai a, Israel ti lem tâng an ti che; Pathien le mihriem i thawh a, i hne ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin ama chu ân dawn a, “Lunginsiettakin i hming mi hril rawh,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Iengleia ka hming indawn am i nih a?” a tih a. Chun, chutaka chun mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for, said he, I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin chu hmun hminga chun Peniel ân bûk tah a, “Pathien chu a hmaihma ngeiah ka hmuha chu ka hringna hi hla a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: And the sun rose upon him as he passed over Penuel, and he limped upon his thigh.
hmr: Chun, Peniel a suoksan lai tak chun nisa a hung suok a, ama chu a hung khawh a, a êlpui lei chun ân bâi tah a.

en: Therefore the children of Israel eat not the sinew of the hip which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew of the hip.
hmr: Chuleiin, tu chen hin Israel thlahai chun êlpui ru suktuoha ke tha um hi an fâk ngai nawh: Jakob êlpui ru suktuo chu a ke tha laitaka a khîk leiin.

en: And Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu a hang dâk a, a thlîr a, Esau, a mi za lihai le hung chu a hmuh a. Chuongchun, a nauhai chu Leah kuoma dâm, Rakil kuoma dâm, suoknuhai pahni kuoma dâm a sem diet diet a.

en: And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
hmr: Suoknuhai le an nauhai chu a hmatâwng takah, Leah le a nauhai chu a dawtah, Rakil le Josef chu a nuhnung takah a sieh a.

en: And he himself passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
hmr: Ama chu an hmaa chun a feh a, a unaupa kuom tieng pana a fe chun a kuom a tlung hmain, vawisari hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk hman a.

en: And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept.
hmr: Chun, Esau chu ama lâwm dingin a tlân a, a kuoh a, a ir a suktuoh a, a fâwp a; chun, an ṭap ve ve tah a.

en: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are these with thee? And he said, The children whom God hath graciously given thy servant.
hmr: Esau chu a hang dâk a, nuhmeihai le naupanghai chu a hmuh a, “I ṭhuoihai hi tuhai am an nih a?” a tih a. Ama chun, “Pathienin lunginsiettaka i siehlaw kuoma a pêk naupanghai an ni hi,” a tih a.

en: Then the handmaids came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
hmr: Chuongchun, suoknuhai chu an nauhai le chun an hung hnai a, an kûn a,

en: And Leah also and her children came near, and bowed themselves: and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
hmr: Leah khawm a nauhai le chun an hung hnai a, an kûn a; chu hnunga chun Rakil le Josef chu an hung hnai a, an kûn veh a.

en: And he said, What meanest thou by all this company which I met? And he said, To find favor in the sight of my lord.
hmr: Esau chun, “Ran ruol ka întuokpui zozaihai kha ieng i tina am a nih a?” a tih a. Jakob chun, “Ka lalpa, i lunginsietna ka hmu theina dingin ka ti a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Esau said, I have enough, my brother; let that which thou hast be thine.
hmr: Chun, Esau chun, “Kei khawmin ka hau ie, ka sangpa, i nei po po chu i ta ni raw se,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob said, Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found favor in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand; forasmuch as I have seen thy face, as one seeth the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
hmr: Jakob chun, “Ni lo e, i mi lunginsiet thei chun lunginsiettakin ka lâwmman hi mi pawmpêk rawh: Pathien hmêl hmu angin i hmêl ka hmuh a, ka chungah i lâwm sih a.

en: Take, I pray thee, my gift that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took it.
hmr: Pathienin a mi lunginsiet a, ka nei ṭeu leiin lunginsiettakin ka thil hung pêk che hi chu pawm rawh,” a tih a. Chuong ang chun a thlêm a, ama chun a pawm tah a.

en: And he said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.
hmr: Chun, Esau chun, “Hung rawh fêng ei tih, hma ṭhuoi pêk ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds with me have their young: and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die.
hmr: Jakob chun a kuomah, “Nau- panghai hi an la chîn a, berâm ruol le ran ruol ka kuoma umhai khawm hi te ṭhuoi an nih ti ka lalpain i hriet a; ni khat chau khawm khal hrât taluo inla, ran ruol po po hi thi vawng el an tih.

en: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on gently, according to the pace of the cattle that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.
hmr: Ka lalpa, lunginsiettakin i siehlaw hmaa hin fe la, kei chu Seir tlângah ka lalpa kuom ka tlung hmakhat chu, ka hmaa ran fe hi an fe thei tâwk ang peiin le, naupanghai fe thei tâwk ang peiin, damtein hung sawm lem ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Esau said, Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? let me find favor in the sight of my lord.
hmr: Chun, Esau chun, “Ka kuoma um mi ṭhenkhathai bêk hi mâksan- pêk ka ti che aw,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Iengding kherin am ie? ka lalpa, i lunginsietna mîn hmutir el rawh,” a tih a.

en: So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
hmr: Chuongchun, Esau chu chu ni ma chun Seir tlâng tieng panin a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him a house, and made booths for his cattle: therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu Sukkoth-ah a feh a, ama ta dingin in a bâwl a, a ranhai ta dingin bûk a bâwl bawk a; chuleiin, chu hmun hming chu Sukkoth an ti tah a.

en: And Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan-aram; and encamped before the city.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu Paddan-aram rama inthawka hungin, Kanaan rama um Sekem khuo chu himtakin a tlung a, khawhnâwma chun a puon in a zar tah a.

en: And he bought the parcel of ground, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred pieces of money.
hmr: A puon in zarna hmun chu Sekem pa Hamor nauhaia inthawkin tangka zain ân châwk a.

en: And he erected there an altar, and called it El-Elohe-Israel.
hmr: Chutaka chun mâichâm a siem a, a hmingah El-elohe-Israel ân bûk a.

en: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
hmr: Chun, Leah naunu Dina, Jakob a neipêk chu, chu ram nunghâkhai hmu dingin a va lêng suok a.

en: And Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her; and he took her, and lay with her, and humbled her.
hmr: Chun, Hiv mi Hamor, chu ram lal naupa Sekem chun ama chu a lo hmuh a; a man a, a zâlpui a, ân tlâwm tah a.

en: And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel.
hmr: Chun, a lungril chu Jakob naunu Dina chunga chun a um tlat a, chu nunghâk chu a hmangai a, bau ṭhatakin a biek a.

en: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
hmr: Sekem chun a pa Hamor chu a biek a, “Chu nunghâk chu nuhmeiin mi neipêk rawh,” a tih a.

en: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter; and his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they came.
hmr: Jakob chun a naunu Dina chu Sekem chun a sukkhawhlo ti a lo hriet a, nisienlakhawm, a naupa- salhai chu phûlah ran lai an um leiin an hung hmakhat chu a to zing a.

en: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
hmr: Sekem pa Hamor chu Jakob be dingin a kuomah a feh a.

en: And the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob’s daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
hmr: Jakob naupasalhai chun an hriet phingleh phûla inthawk chun an hung a; chun, Jakob naunu zâlpuiin Israelhai laiah thil suol invêtthlâk- tak, thil thaw dêr lo ding chu a thaw ta leiin an lungngai a, an lunginsen ta êm êm a.

en: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you, give her unto him to wife.
hmr: Hamor ruok chun anni a biek a, “Ka naupa Sekem lungril chu in naunu chungah a um tlat a: lungin- siettakin nuhmeiin inneitir ta unla.

en: And make ye marriages with us; give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
hmr: Innei pawl ei tiu, in naunuhmei hai mîn neitir unla, kan nau- nuhmeihai khawm nei bawk ro.

en: And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
hmr: Kan ramah keini lai um in ta, in nuomna hmun hmunah um bawk unla, hienglai hin um unla, sum- dâwng unla, insukmuk ro,” a tih a.

en: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find favor in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
hmr: Sekem khawm chun a nunghâk pa le ṭahai kuomah, “Mi lunginsiet ro, ka kuoma in hril taphawt pêng ka ti cheu.

en: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.
hmr: Man le thilpêk chu iengzat khawm ngên unla, in ti ang peiin pêng ka ti cheu: iengkhawm ni sienla, nunghâk chu nuhmeiin mîn neitir phawt el ro,” a tih a.

en: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with guile, and spake, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,
hmr: Jakob nauhai chun an farnu Dina a sukkhawhlopêk lei chun Sekem le a pa Hamor chu zaihlêmin an dawn a,

en: and said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us.
hmr: an kuomah, “Hi thil, sertanlo mi kuoma kan farnu pêk hi thaw thei naw ning ungah; chu chu kan ta dingin hmingsietna ding a ni sih a:

en: Only on this condition will we consent unto you: if ye will be as we are, that every male of you be circumcised;
hmr: hieng anga in tiem ruok chun in thu ang chu remti thei kan tih: nangni laia pasal taphawt chu keini angin sertanin um unla.

en: then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
hmr: Chuongchun, kan naunuhmei- hai inneitir kan ti cheu a, keini khawma in naunuhmeihai nei bawk kan ta; chun, in kuomah um kan ta, chi khat ei hung ni ding annâwm.

en: But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sertan kawnga kan thu in zâwm naw ding chun, kan naunu chu ṭhuoi kan ta, fe el kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor’s son.
hmr: An thu chun Hamor le Hamor naupa Sekem chu an suklâwm tah a.

en: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter: and he was honored above all the house of his father.
hmr: Chuongchun, tlangvâl chun Jakob naunu chu a dit hle sih a, chu thil chu sâwt nghâk loin a thaw nghâl tah a; ama chu a pa sûnghai laia inzâkai tak a nih.

en: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
hmr: Chun, Hamor le a naupa Sekem chun an khaw kul kawtkhâr chu an tlung a, an khuohai chu an biek a,

en: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for, behold, the land is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
hmr: Sawtaka mihai saw mi rem- takin an um a, chuleiin, hi rama hin umin, hieng lai hin sumdâwng raw hai se, ngai ta u, an ta dingin ram khawm hi a lien huntâwk bawk a; an naunuhmeihai saw nuhmeiahai nei inla, ei naunuhmeihai khawm anni inneitir bawk ei tiu.

en: Only on this condition will the men consent unto us to dwell with us, to become one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chi khat ei hung nina dinga ei kuoma um chu hieng anga ei tiem chau hin sawhai sawn an mi remtipui ding a nih a, sertan an ni angin eini laia pasal taphawt chu sertan hung ni ve inla.

en: Shall not their cattle and their substance and all their beasts be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
hmr: An ran dâm, an sum dâm, an sa po po dâm eini ta a ni vawng naw ding am a nih? An thu hi remtipui el ei tiu, chuongchun, ei kuomah an um el ding a nih.” an tih a.

en: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
hmr: Chun, Hamor le a naupa Sekem thu chu a khaw kul kawtkhâra suok taphawt chun an zâwm a, a khaw kul kawtkhâra suok po po, pasal taphawt chun ser an intantir ta vawng a.

en: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city unawares, and slew all the males.
hmr: Chun, ni thum niha an nat laitak chun, Jakob naupasalhai laia mi pahni, Dina ṭahai Simon le Levi chun an kâwlhnâm chawi ve vein inrûkin khuo chu an thawh a, pasal po po chu an that zo vawng el tah a.

en: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went forth.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hamor le a naupa Sekem chu kâwlhnâm ngeiin an that a, Sekem ina inthawkin Dina chu an ṭhuoi a, an suok tah a.

en: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.
hmr: Jakob naupasalhai chun an mi thathai chu an va nangchîng a, an farnu an sukkhawhlo pêk leiin khuo chu an rawk tah a.

en: They took their flocks and their herds and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field;
hmr: An berâm ruolhai, an bâwng- ruolhai, an sabengtunghai, khuoa thil umhai le loa thil umhai an lâk- pêk a;

en: and all their wealth, and all their little ones and their wives, took they captive and made a prey, even all that was in the house.
hmr: an sum po po an lâk a, an nauhai le an nuhmeihai po po an man a, in sûnga um taphawt chu an fe hmangpui tah a.

en: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me, to make me odious to the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and, I being few in number, they will gather themselves together against me and smite me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin Simeon le Levi kuoma chun, “Nangnîn hi rama um Kanaan mihai le Periz mihai laia hin, theida in mîn phurtirin in mi suklungzîng hle a nih; kei tlâwmte ka ni leiin mi thaw dingin hung inpun khâwm an ta, mi that el an tih; chuongchun, sukbohmangin um ka tih, kei le ka sûnghai le hin,” a tih a.

en: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with a harlot?
hmr: Anni ruok chun, “Kan farnu hi nawchizawr thawin a thaw el ding a ni?” an tih a.

en: And God said unto Jacob, Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there: and make there an altar unto God, who appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face of Esau thy brother.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Jakob kuoma chun, “Tho la, Bethelah hang fe la, chutaka chun um rawh: i u Esaua inthawka i tlân hmang laia i kuoma inlâr Pathien ta ding khan chutaka chun mâichâm siem rawh,” a tih a.

en: Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him, Put away the foreign gods that are among you, and purify yourselves, and change your garments:
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chun a sûnghai le a kuoma umhai po po kuoma chun, “Nangni laia mi dang pathien umhai chu sie hmang dai unla, insukthiengin in silfênhai inthleng ro:

en: and let us arise, and go up to Beth-el; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.
hmr: tho ei ta, Bethelah fêng ei tiu: chuongchun, ka lunginzîng laia mi dawna, ka fenaa ka kuoma um pei Pathien ta ding khan mâichâm siem ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And they gave unto Jacob all the foreign gods which were in their hand, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi dang pathien an kuta um po po le, an naa nabe an ibe po po chu Jakob an pêk a, chun Jakob chun Sekem khaw kâwla thingsaisuo hnuoia chun a thuphmang tah a.

en: And they journeyed: and a terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.
hmr: Chun, an feh a, an vêla khuohai chun an lo ṭi nasa hleh a, Jakob naupasalhai chu an hnawt ngam nawh a.

en: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan (the same is Beth-el), he and all the people that were with him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chun Kanaan rama Luz khuo (chu chu Bethel) chu a tlung a, ama le a kuoma umhai po po leh.

en: And he built there an altar, and called the place El-beth-el; because there God was revealed unto him, when he fled from the face of his brother.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun mâichâm a siem a, a u kuoma inthawka a tlân hmang lai khan chutaka chun Pathien a kuoma ân lâr leiin a hmun chu, “El-Bethel,” a ti tah a.

en: And Deborah Rebekah’s nurse died, and she was buried below Beth-el under the oak: and the name of it was called Allon-bacuth.
hmr: Chun, Rebeka dawntu Debora chu a thih a, Bethel thlanga thing- saisuo hnuoia chun an phûm a; thing- saisuo hminga chun “Ṭapna thing- saisuo” an ti tah a.

en: And God appeared unto Jacob again, when he came from Paddan-aram, and blessed him.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu Paddan-aram rama inthawka a hung nâwk chun Pathien a kuomah ân lâr nâwk a, mal a sâwm a,

en: And God said unto him, Thy name is Jacob: thy name shall not be called any more Jacob, but Israel shall be thy name: and he called his name Israel.
hmr: Pathien chun a kuomah, “I hming hi Jakob a nih a, i hming hi Jakob ti nâwk ta naw ni hai cheha, i hming chu Israel ni lem tâng a tih,” a tih a; chuongchun, a hminga chun Israel a ti tah a.

en: And God said unto him, I am God Almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall be of thee, and kings shall come out of thy loins;
hmr: Pathien bawk chun a kuomah, “Kei Pathien Iengkimthawthei ka nih: chi tamtak inthlain hung pung rawh. Chi ti khawp le chi tum tum um khâwm khawm nanga inthawkin la hung um an tih; i ṭhalbea inthawkin lalhai khawm la hung suok bawk an tih.

en: and the land which I gave unto Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.
hmr: Abraham le Isak kuoma ram ka pêkhai hi i kuomah pêng ka ti che, i um naw hnunga i thlahai kuoma khawm ram hi pe pei ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And God went up from him in the place where he spake with him.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin ama a biekna hmuna inthawk chun Jakob chu a fesan tah a.

en: And Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he spake with him, a pillar of stone: and he poured out a drink-offering thereon, and poured oil thereon.
