hmr: Chun, a biekna hmuna chun Jakobin ban (lung ban) a phun a, a chunga chun thilinhlân dâwn mi a buok a, a chungah sahriek a buok bawk a.

en: And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, Beth-el.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun Pathienin ama a biekna hmun hminga chun Bethel ân bûk a.

en: And they journeyed from Beth-el; and there was still some distance to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labor.
hmr: Chun, Bethela inthawk chun an feh a; Ephrath tlungna ding chu hla rei a la nih a, Rakil chun nauha ân vawi a, na deu el hin ân vawi tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said unto her, Fear not; for now thou shalt have another son.
hmr: Chun, nataka ân vawi lai chun nau dawm mi chun, “Ṭi naw rawh, naupasal dang i nei ding a ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, as her soul was departing (for she died), that she called his name Ben-oni: but his father called him Benjamin.
hmr: Chun, a thlarau a suok ding lai chun (a thi ta sih a) a hminga chun Ben-oni a sak a; a pa ruok chun Benjamin a sak a.

en: And Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath (the same is Beth-lehem).
hmr: Chuongchun, Rakil chu a thih a, Ephrath lampuia chun an phûm a (Ephrath chu Bethlehem a nih).

en: And Jacob set up a pillar upon her grave: the same is the Pillar of Rachel’s grave unto this day.
hmr: Chun, a thlân chunga chun Jakobin lung a phun a. Chu chu tu chen a Rakil thlân Lungphun la um chu a nih.

en: And Israel journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Eder.
hmr: Chun, Israel chu a fe pei a Eder. Insâng khêla chun puon in a zar tah a.

en: And it came to pass, while Israel dwelt in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father’s concubine: and Israel heard of it. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve:
hmr: Israel chu chu rama a um lai chun, Reubenin a pa thaikêm Bilha chu a va zâlpui a; chun, Israel chun chu chu a hriet a. Tuhin Jakob naupasalhai chu sâwmpahni an ni tah.

en: the sons of Leah: Reuben, Jacob’s first-born, and Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Zebulun;
hmr: Leah naupasalhai chu Reuben (Jakob nau lutîr), Simeon, Levi, Juda, Issakar le Jebulun an nih.

en: the sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin;
hmr: Rakil naupasalhai chu Josef le Benjamin an nih.

en: and the sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s handmaid: Dan and Naphtali;
hmr: Rakil suoknu Bilha naupasal- hai chu Dan le Naphtali an nih.

en: and the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid: Gad and Asher: these are the sons of Jacob, that were born to him in Paddan-aram.
hmr: Leah suoknu Zilpah naupa- salhai chu Gad le Aser an nih. Chuong chu Jakob naupasal, Paddan-aram rama pienghai chu an nih.

en: And Jacob came unto Isaac his father to Mamre, to Kiriath-arba (the same is Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac sojourned.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu Abraham le Isak khuolchâmna hmun Kiriath- arba (Hebron an ti bawk) Mamrea a pa Isak kuom chu a tlung tah a.

en: And the days of Isaac were a hundred and fourscore years.
hmr: Chun, Isak dam sûng chu kum za le sâwmriet a nih.

en: And Isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and was gathered unto his people, old and full of days: and Esau and Jacob his sons buried him.
hmr: Chun, Isak chun a thlarau ân thlah a, upatak, tarkûna damin a thih a, a chipuihai kuoma ṭhuoiin a um tah a: chun, a naupasalhai Esau le Jakob chun an phûm tah a.

en: Now these are the generations of Esau (the same is Edom).
hmr: Chun, hieng hi Esau thlahai chu an nih (Esau chu Edom a nih).

en: Esau took his wives of the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite,
hmr: Esau chun a nuhmeihai chu Kanaan nunghâk laia mi a nih a nei chu: Hit mi Elon naunu Ada le, Hiv mi Zibeon tunu Ana naunu Oholibama le,

en: and Basemath Ishmael’s daughter, sister of Nebaioth.
hmr: Ismael naunu, Nebaioth farnu Basemath an nih.

en: And Adah bare to Esau Eliphaz; and Basemath bare Reuel;
hmr: Ada chun Esau chu Eliphaz a neipêk a; Basemath chun Reuel a nei a,

en: and Oholibamah bare Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah: these are the sons of Esau, that were born unto him in the land of Canaan.
hmr: Oholibama chun Jeus, Jalam le Kora a nei a; chuong chu Esau naupasal Kanaan rama pienghai chu an nih.

en: And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the souls of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his possessions, which he had gathered in the land of Canaan; and went into a land away from his brother Jacob.
hmr: Chun, Esau chun a nuhmeihai, a naupasalhai, a naunuhmeihai le, a ina mi po po, a ranhai, a sa po po le, Kanaan rama a lam suok a thilnei po po chu a sawm a, a sang kuoma inthawk chu ram dangah a fe ta dai a.

en: For their substance was too great for them to dwell together; and the land of their sojournings could not bear them because of their cattle.
hmr: An thil neihai chu a nasa taluoh a, an um hmunkhat thei naw a nih; an ranhai leiin an khuolchâmna ram chun a dai ta si nawh a.

en: And Esau dwelt in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Esau chu Seir tlânga chun a um tah a; Esau chu Edom a nih.

en: And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:
hmr: Hieng hi Seir tlânga Edom mihai thlatu Esau thlahai chu an nih.

en: these are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Basemath the wife of Esau.
hmr: Hieng hi Esau naupasalhai hming chu an nih: Esau nuhmei Ada naupa Eliphaz, Esau nuhmei Basemath naupa Reuel.

en: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.
hmr: Eliphaz naupasalhai chu Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam le Kenaz an nih.

en: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esau’s son; and she bare to Eliphaz Amalek: these are the sons of Adah, Esau’s wife.
hmr: (Timna chu Esau naupa Eliphaz thaikêm a nih, ama chun Eliphaz chu Amalek a neipêk a). Hieng hi Esau nuhmei Ada naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And these are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Basemath, Esau’s wife.
hmr: Hieng hi Reuel naupasalhai chu an nih: Nahath, Zera, Samma le Mizza hi. Hieng hi Esau nuhmei Basemath naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And these were the sons of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, Esau’s wife: and she bare to Esau Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.
hmr: Hieng hi Zibeon tunu Ana naunu Oholibama, Esau nuhmei, naupasalhai an nih: ama chun Esau chu Jeus, Jalam le Kora a neipêk a.

en: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the first-born of Esau: chief Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz,
hmr: Hieng hi Esau naupasalhai laia hotuhai chu an nih: Esau nau lutîr Eliphaz naupasalhaia hotuhai: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,

en: chief Korah, chief Gatam, chief Amalek: these are the chiefs that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.
hmr: Kora, Gatam le Amalek hi: hieng hi Edom rama Eliphaz-a inthawka suok hotuhai chu an nih; chuong chu Ada naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And these are the sons of Reuel, Esau’s son: chief Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, chief Mizzah: these are the chiefs that came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Basemath, Esau’s wife.
hmr: Hieng hi Esau naupa Reuel naupasalhai chu an nih: hotu Nahath, Zera, Samma le Mizza hi: hieng hi Edom rama Reuela inthawka suok hotuhai chu an nih, hieng hi Esau nuhmei Basemath naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And these are the sons of Oholibamah, Esau’s wife: chief Jeush, chief Jalam, chief Korah: these are the chiefs that came of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau’s wife.
hmr: Hieng hi Esau nuhmei Oholi- bama naupasalhai chu an nih: hotu Jeus, Jalam le Kora hi; hieng hi Ana naunu, Esau nuhmei Oholibama naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: These are the sons of Esau, and these are their chiefs: the same is Edom.
hmr: Hieng hi Esau naupasalhai chu an nih; hieng hi anni laia hotuhai chu an nih: Esau chu Edom a nih.

en: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan and Shobal and Zibeon and Anah,
hmr: Hieng hi Hor mi, Seir nau- pasalhai chu rama umhai chu an nih: Lotan, Sobal, Zibeon, Ana,

en: and Dishon and Ezer and Dishan: these are the chiefs that came of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.
hmr: Dison, Ezer le Disan hi. Hieng hi Edom rama Seir naupasalhai, Hor mihaia inthawka suok hotuhai chu an nih.

en: And the children of Lotan were Hori and Heman; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
hmr: Lotan nauhai chu Hori le Hemam an nih, chun, Lotan farnu chu Timna a nih.

en: And these are the children of Shobal: Alvan and Manahath and Ebal, Shepho and Onam.
hmr: Hieng hi Sobal nauhai chu an nih: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Sepho le Onam hi.

en: And these are the children of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah; this is Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
hmr: Hieng hi Zibeon nauhai chu an nih: Aia le Ana hi. Hi Ana hi a nih a pa Zibeon sabengtung lien chihai an thla laia thlalêra tuilumkhurhai hmu suoktu kha.

en: And these are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah.
hmr: Hieng hi Ana nauhai chu an nih: Dison le Ana naunu Oholibama hi.

en: And these are the children of Dishon: Hemdan and Eshban and Ithran and Cheran.
hmr: Hieng hi Dison nauhai chu an nih: Hemdan, Esban, Ithran le Cheran hi.

en: These are the children of Ezer: Bilhan and Zaavan and Akan.
hmr: Hieng hi Ezer nauhai chu an nih: Bilhan, Zaavan le Akan hi.

en: These are the children of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
hmr: Hieng hi Disan nauhai chu an nih: Uz le Aran hi.

en: These are the chiefs that came of the Horites: chief Lotan, chief Shobal, chief Zibeon, chief Anah,
hmr: Hieng hi Hor mihaia inthawka suok hotuhai chu an nih: hotu Lotan, Sobal, Zibeon, Ana,

en: chief Dishon, chief Ezer, chief Dishan: these are the chiefs that came of the Horites, according to their chiefs in the land of Seir.
hmr: Dison, Ezer le Disan hi: hieng hi Seir rama an chihai ang peia Hor mihaia inthawka suok hotuhai chu an nih.

en: And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.
hmr: Hieng hi lal hrim hrimin Israel thlahai chunga ro an rêl hmaa Edom rama rorêltu lalhai chu an nih.

en: And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
hmr: Beor naupa Bela chun Edomah ro a rêl a; a khawpui hming chu Dinhaba a nih.

en: And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
hmr: Bela chu a thih a, Bozra mi Zera naupa Jobab chun a ai awin ro a rêl a.

en: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
hmr: Jobab chu a thih a, Teman mihai rama mi Husam chun a ai awin ro a rêl a.

en: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
hmr: Husam chu a thih a, Bedad naupa Hadad, Moab phûla Midian mihai thattu khan a ai awin ro a rêl a, a khawpui hming chu Avith a nih.

en: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
hmr: Hadad chu a thih a, Masreka mi Samla chun a ai awin ro a rêl a.

en: And Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his stead.
hmr: Samla chu a thih a, Vadungpui kama Rehoboth mi Saula chun a ai awin ro a rêl a.

en: And Shaul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
hmr: Saula chu a thih a, Akbor naupa Baal-hanan chun a ai awin ro a rêl a.

en: And Baal-hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.
hmr: Akbor naupa Baal-hanan chu a thih a, Hadar chun a ai awin ro a rêl a; a khawpui hming chu Pau a nih; a nuhmei hming chu Mezahab naunu Matred naunu Mehetabel a nih.

en: And these are the names of the chiefs that came of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names: chief Timna, chief Alvah, chief Jetheth,
hmr: Chun, hieng hi an sûngkuo ang pei, an hmun ang pei le an hming ang peia Esau thla hotuhai hming chu a nih: Hotuhai Timna, Alva, Jetheth,

en: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
hmr: Oholibama, Ela, Pinon,

en: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
hmr: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

en: chief Magdiel, chief Iram: these are the chiefs of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession. This is Esau, the father of the Edomites.
hmr: Magdiel le Iram hi: Hieng hi an ram neia an umna ang peia Edom (chu chu Edom mihai thlatu Esau) thla hotuhai chu an nih.

en: And Jacob dwelt in the land of his father’s sojournings, in the land of Canaan.
hmr: Jakob chu a pa khuolchâmna Kanaan rama chun a um tah a.

en: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and he was a lad with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father’s wives: and Joseph brought the evil report of them unto their father.
hmr: Hieng hi Jakob thlahai chu an nih: Josef chu kum sâwmpasari a niin a uhai, a pa nuhmeihai Bilha le Zilpah naupasalhai leh ran ruol an inthlah a. Josef chun an suol thukhawchâng chu a pa kuomah ân tlun a.

en: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colors.
hmr: Chun, Israel chun Josef chu a tar tieng nau a ni leiin a nauhai po po nêk chun a hmangai lem a; chuongchun, zakawfuol rawng tamtaka ṭiel a siempêk a.

en: And his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren; and they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
hmr: An pa chun ama chu a uhai po po nêkin a hmangai lem ti a unauhaiin an hriet chun ama chu an theida ta hleh a, ṭawngbau ṭha hrim a chungah an rawl thei ta nawh a.

en: And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun mang a nei a, a uhai kuoma a hril chun ama chu an theida zuol tah a.

en: And he said unto them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Lungin- siettakin ka mang thu hi lo ngai ro:

en: for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves came round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf.
hmr: ngai ta u, loa hin buphalhai ei lo intêl a, ngai ta u, ka buphal chu a hung tho a, a ngîr ta a; in buphalhai chun an hung inhuol a, ka buphal chu chibai an bûk tâwl a,” a tih a.

en: And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
hmr: A uhai chun a kuomah, “Nang tehin kan chungah ro i rêl vei ding maw? Nang tehin kan chungah thu i nei vei ding maw?” an tih a. Chuong- chun, a mang lei le a thuhril lei chun ama chu an theida nâwk zuol det a.

en: And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed yet a dream; and, behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars made obeisance to me.
hmr: Chun, mang dang a nei nâwk a, a uhai chu a hril nâwk a, “Ngai ta u, mang ka nei nâwk a, nisa, thla le arasi sâwmpakhat khin chibai an mi lo bûk chu tie,” a tih a.

en: And he told it to his father, and to his brethren; and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
hmr: Chun, a pa chu a hril a, a uhai khawm; chun, a pa chun a kâwk a, a kuomah, “Mang i nei hi ieng mang am a ni lie? Kei le i nu le i uhai hin hnuoi sikin chibai kan bûk hlak ding che am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And his brethren envied him; but his father kept the saying in mind.
hmr: Chun, a uhai chun ama chu an îtthîk a, a pa ruok chun a thuhril chu lungrilin a vawn zing a.

en: And his brethren went to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.
hmr: Chun, a uhai chu Sekema chun an pa ran ruol chu inthlain an feh a.

en: And Israel said unto Joseph, Are not thy brethren feeding the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Here am I.
hmr: Israel chun Josef kuomah, “I uhaiin Sekemah a ni maw ran ruol chu an inthla? hung ta, an kuomah tir ka ti che,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Mi tir ta la,” a tih a.

en: And he said to him, Go now, see whether it is well with thy brethren, and well with the flock; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
hmr: A pa chun a kuomah, “I uhai an dam am, ran ruol khawm an dam am va en la, an chanchin mi hung hril nâwk rawh aw,” a tih a. Chuongchun, Hebron ruoma inthawk chun a tir suok a; ama chun Sekem chu a va tlung tah a.

en: And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
hmr: Chun, mi tuin amanih phûla ân vâk ân vâk lai chun a hmuh a; chuongchun, mi chun, “Iengam i zawng leh?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And he said, I am seeking my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they are feeding the flock.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ka uhai ka zawng a nih: lunginsiettakin ran ruol an inthlâna chu mi hril ta khai,” a tih a.

en: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
hmr: Mi chun, “Hitaka inthawkin an suok kha tie, ‘Dothanah fêng ei tiu,’ an ti chu ka hriet,” a tih a. Chun, Josef chun a uhai chu a hnawt a, Dothana chun a va hmuh a.

en: And they saw him afar off, and before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
hmr: Anni chun hlataka inthawkin an lo hmuh a, an kâwl hnai a tlung hmain ama thatna ding thu an lo rawt tah a.

en: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
hmr: “En ta u, mang neipa a hung saw.

en: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say, An evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
hmr: Thaw ro, that ei ta, khur pakhatah thlâk ei tiu khai; chun, ‘Sain a se tah,’ ei ti el ding annâwm: chuongchun, a manghai chu ieng- tin am a um hre el ei tih,” an inti tâwl a.

en: And Reuben heard it, and delivered him out of their hand, and said, Let us not take his life.
hmr: Reuben ruok chun chu chu a lo hrietin an kuta inthawk chun a sansuok a, “A that êm chu that nâwng ei tiu,” a tih a.

en: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood; cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, but lay no hand upon him: that he might deliver him out of their hand, to restore him to his father.
hmr: Reuben bawk chun a pa kuoma ṭhuoi nâwkna dinga an kuta inthawk chu a sansuok theina dingin, an kuoma chun, “Thisen chu insuo naw ro, thlalêra khura hin thlâk unla, kut chu a chunga hin thlâk naw ro,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped Joseph of his coat, the coat of many colors that was on him;
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a uhai kuom a va tlung chun, ama chu a zakawfuol rawng tamtaka ṭiel a ihâk chu an lo hlîppêk a;

en: and they took him, and cast him into the pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
hmr: an ṭhuoi a, khurah an thlâk tah a: khur chu a ruok tui um nawna a nih.

en: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
hmr: Chun, bu fa dingin an hang ṭhung tâwl a; chun, an hang dâk a, Ismael inzinpâwl Gileada inthawk an sanghâwngseia riminhnik, thing hnai damdawi le murra phura Aiguptaa zu fe ding hunghai chu an hmuh a.

en: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother and conceal his blood?
hmr: Chun, Juda chun a unauhai kuomah, “Ei sang ei that a, a thisen suok ei ip chun iengam ṭhathnemna um a ta?

en: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother, our flesh. And his brethren hearkened unto him.
hmr: Thaw ro, a chungah kut thlâk loin Ismael mihai kuoma sawn zawr el lem ei tiu; ama hi ei sang, ei tisa ngei a ni sih a,” a tih a. A unauhai chun a thu chu an zâwm tah a.

en: And there passed by Midianites, merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. And they brought Joseph into Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Midian mihai sumdâwng an hung a; chuongchun, Josef chu khura inthawk chu an khai suok a, Ismael mihai kuoma chun Josef chu tangka sawmhniin an zawr tah a, anni chun Josef chu Aiguptaah an ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
hmr: Reuben chu khura chun a hung kîra Josef chu khurah a lo um ta nawh ti a hmu chun a silfênhai a keithlêr a,

en: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
hmr: chun, a sanghai kuom tieng a kîr nâwk a, “Bawipu kha a um ta nawh, kei hi khaw tieng am fe tâng ka ti leh aw?” a tih a.

en: And they took Joseph’s coat, and killed a he-goat, and dipped the coat in the blood;
hmr: Chun, Josef zakawfuol chu an lâk a, kêlchal an thata a thia chun zakawfuol chu an inchieh a.

en: and they sent the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father, and said, This have we found: know now whether it is thy son’s coat or not.
hmr: Chun, zakawfuol chu an inphur a, an pa kuoma chun an hung chawi a, a kuomah, “Hi hi kan hmu ringawt a, i naupa zakawfuol a ni am a ni naw en ta,” an tih a.

en: And he knew it, and said, It is my son’s coat: an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces.
hmr: Ama chun a lo hriet el a, “Ka naupa zakawfuol a ni hi, sahrângin a se tah a ni hi aw, Josef chu matheiloin keinawi nengin a um ni ngei a tih,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob rent his garments, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun a silfênhai a keithlêr a, saiip puon a dierkei a, ni sâwttak a naupa chu a sûn a.

en: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down to Sheol to my son mourning. And his father wept for him.
hmr: A naupasalhai po po le a nau- nuhmeihai po po chu ama thlamuon dingin an tho a; nisienlakhawm, ama chun thlamuon a nuom nawh a, “Ni lo, lusûn pumin thlânah ka naupa kuomah ka fe ding a nih,” a tih a. Chuongchun, a pa chu ama ngaiin a ṭap hlak a.

en: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s, the captain of the guard.
hmr: Chun, Midian mihai chun Josef chu Aiguptaah Pharao hnuoia hotu pakhat, vêngtu pâwl hotu Potiphar kuoma chun an zâwr a.

en: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
hmr: Chuong lai chun hieng hi a nih a, Juda chu a unauhai laia inthawk chu a fe thlah a, Adullam mi pakhat a hming Hira chu a zu bêl tah a.

en: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua; and he took her, and went in unto her.
hmr: Juda chun chutaka chun Kanaan mi pakhat a hming Sua naunu a hmuh a, ama chu a neia a pâwl tah a.

en: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
hmr: Chuongchun, ân rai a, naupasal a nei a; chun, Juda chun a hmingah Er a sak a.

en: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
hmr: Chun, ân rai nâwk a, naupasal a nei nâwk a; chun, a nuin a hmingah Onan a sak a.

en: And she yet again bare a son, and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
hmr: Chun, naupasal a nei nâwk a, a hmingah Selah a sak a: chu chu a nei lai chun Juda chu Chezib-ah a um a.

en: And Judah took a wife for Er his first-born, and her name was Tamar.
hmr: Juda chun a nau lutîr Er chu nuhmei a neipêk a, a hming chu Tamar a nih.

en: And Er, Judah’s first-born, was wicked in the sight of Jehovah; and Jehovah slew him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Juda nau lutîr Er chu LALPA mithmuah mi suol a nih a, LALPAIN ama chu a sukhlum tah a.

en: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife, and perform the duty of a husband’s brother unto her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
hmr: Chun, Juda chun Onan kuomah, “I u nuhmei chu pâwl la, pasalhai unau thaw ding chu thawpêk la, i u ta ding chun chi thlapêk rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Onan knew that the seed would not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother’s wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Onan chun chithla ding chu ama thla a ni naw ding a nih ti a hriet a; chuongchun, a u nuhmei a pâwl po leh a u ta dinga chi thlapêk lo dingin a chi chu hnuoiah a sukthlâk hlak a.

en: And the thing which he did was evil in the sight of Jehovah: and he slew him also.
hmr: A thilthaw chu LALPA mithmua chun suoltak a nih; chuleiin, ama khawm chu a sukhlum tah a.

en: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter-in-law, Remain a widow in thy father’s house, till Shelah my son be grown up; for he said, Lest he also die, like his brethren. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father’s house.
hmr: Juda chun a monu Tamar kuoma chun, “Ka naupa Selah hi a puitling hmakhat chu i pa in tieng pasal nei loin lo um phawt rawh,” a tih a. “Chuong naw chun ama khawm hi a uhai angin thi rawi a tih,” a ti a nih. Chuongchun, Tamar chu a pa in tieng chun a va um tah a.

en: And in process of time Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheep-shearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
hmr: Chun, a nakie chun Sua naunu, Juda nuhmei chu, a thih a; chun, a ngai a hung bo a, Timnaa berâm hmul vawtuhai kuom tieng chun ama le a ruolpa Adullam mi Hira chu an hang feh a.

en: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold, thy father-in-law goeth up to Timnah to shear his sheep.
hmr: Chun, Tamar chu, “I tarpupa chu a berâm hmul vaw dingin Timnaah a hang fe ding a nih,” ti hril a nih a.

en: And she put off from her the garments of her widowhood, and covered herself with her veil, and wrapped herself, and sat in the gate of Enaim, which is by the way to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, and she was not given unto him to wife.
hmr: Ama chun a pasal sûnna silfênhai chu a hlîp a, inkhumna puonin ân khum a, ân tuom tlat a, Timna lampuia Enaim kul kawt- khâra chun a lo ṭhung a: Selah chu a puitling ta sih a, a pa chun a nuhmei dingin ân neitir naw zo a ni tah ti a hriet sih a.

en: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a harlot; for she had covered her face.
hmr: Chun, Judain ama chu a hmuin nawchizawr amanih a sâwn a, a hmai chu ân khum tlat sih a.

en: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Come, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee: for he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
hmr: Chuongchun, lampui sîra nu- hmei tieng chu a va pan a, “Hung ta, lunginsiettakin zâl hmunkhat ei tih,” a tih a; a mo kha a nih ti a hriet si nawh a. Ama chun, “I mi zâlpui chun iengam mi pêng i ta?” a tih a.

en: And he said, I will send thee a kid of the goats from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
hmr: Ama chun, “Ran ruol laia kêlte inphur ka ti che,” a tih a. Chun, ama chun, “Chu chu i mi hung inphur hmaa lo hrên ding iemani bêk i mi pêk ding?” a tih a.

en: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet and thy cord, and thy staff that is in thy hand. And he gave them to her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
hmr: Ama chun, “Hrên ding ieng am pêng ka ti cheh a?” a tih a. Amanu chun, “I hming namna le i hrui, i hmawl chawi le khan,” a tih a. Chuongchun, a pêk a, a zâlpui tah a; chun, amaa inthawk chun nau a vawn tah a.

en: And she arose, and went away, and put off her veil from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
hmr: Chun, a tho a, a inkhumna puon chu a hlîp a, a hmeithaina silfênhai chu ân bel nâwk tah a.

en: And Judah sent the kid of the goats by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the woman’s hand: but he found her not.
hmr: Chun, Judain a thil hrên chu nuhmei kuta inthawk la dingin a ruolpa Adullam mi kutah kêlte chu ân phur a, nisienlakhawm, ama chun a va hmu zo nawh a.

en: Then he asked the men of her place, saying, Where is the prostitute, that was at Enaim by the wayside? And they said, There hath been no prostitute here.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei umna laia mihai kuoma chun, “Lampui sira Enaima nawchizawr um kha khaw lai am a um ta leh?” tiin ân dawn a. Anni chun, “Nawchizawr hrim hitaka hin an um nawh ie,” an tih a.

en: And he returned to Judah, and said, I have not found her; and also the men of the place said, There hath been no prostitute here.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juda kuoma chun a kîr nâwk a, “Ama chu ka hmu zo nawh, a hmuna mihai khawmin, ‘Nawchizawr hrim hitaka hin an um nawh,’ an lo ti bawk a,” a tih a.

en: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be put to shame: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
hmr: Juda chun, “Nei sawng el raw se, chuong naw chun muolpho rawi ei tih, en ta, hi kêlte hi kân phur a, ama i hmu zo si nawh a,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath played the harlot; and moreover, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
hmr: Thla thum vêl amani hnunga chun Juda chu, “I monu Tamar chun tlangvâl a dit a, chunawa khawm, ngai ta, sâwn a pai nghe nghe annaw,” tiha hril a nih a. Juda chun, “Ṭhuoi suok unla, raw hlumin um raw se,” a tih a.

en: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and the cords, and the staff.
hmr: Chun, an ṭhuoi suok chun Tamar chun, “Hi thil neitupaa inthawk hin a nih nau ka vawn chu,” tiin, a tarpupa kuoma chun mi a tir a; ama bawkin, “Lunginsiettakin hieng hming namna hai, hrui hai, hmawl hai hi tu ta am a nih en chieng ta khai,” a ti bawk a.

en: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She is more righteous than I, forasmuch as I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
hmr: Juda chun chuong thil chu ama ta a nih ti a hriet a, “Ama chu keia nêkin a fel lem a nih, ama chu ka naupa Selah chu kân neitir ta si nawh a,” a tih a. Chun, Juda chun ama chu a pâwl nâwk ta dêr nawh a.

en: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
hmr: Chun, nauhain a se laiin, ngai ta, a sula chun inphîr an lo um a.

en: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that one put out a hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
hmr: A nau pakhat chun a kut a hung pur dawk a; chuongchun, nau dawm mi chun, “Hi hi a suok hmasa lem a ni hi,” tiin a chel a, a kuta chun pat sen ân buntir a.

en: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, Wherefore hast thou made a breach for thyself? therefore his name was called Perez.
hmr: A kut chu a kei lût nâwk lai chun, ngai ta, a unau chu a hung suok tah a; chuongchun, nau dawmtu chun, “Iengdinga suokna ding insiem am i nih a?” a tih a, chuleiin, a hmingah Perez an sak a.

en: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zerah.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun a unau pat sen bun kha a hung suok ve a, a hmingah Zera an sak a.

en: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hand of the Ishmaelites, that had brought him down thither.
hmr: Josef chu Aiguptaah an ṭhuoi thlâk a; chun, Pharao hnuoia hotu pakhat, vêngtu pâwl hotu Aigupta mi Potiphar chun, chutaka hung ṭhuoi thlatu Ismael mihai kuta inthawk chun ân châwk a.

en: And Jehovah was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
hmr: LALPA chu Josef kuomah a um a; chuongchun, ama chu mi hlawtling- tak a hung ni tah a, a pu Aigupta mi ina chun a um a.

en: And his master saw that Jehovah was with him, and that Jehovah made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
hmr: A pu chun LALPA chu a kuom- ah a um a, a thilthaw taphawt LALPAIN a kutah ân hlawtlingtir ti a hmuh a.

en: And Joseph found favor in his sight, and he ministered unto him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chun a pu lunginsietna a hlawh a, ama rawng- bâwltuah a um a; chun, ama chu a sûnghai chunga hotuah a siem a, a nei po po a kutah a sie ta vawng a.

en: And it came to pass from the time that he made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that Jehovah blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of Jehovah was upon all that he had, in the house and in the field.
hmr: A ina hotua a siem a, a nei po po chunga hotua a siem chena inthawk chu Josef leiin LALPA chun Aigupta mi sûng khat chu mal a sâwm tah a; in tieng le ram tienga a nei po po chu LALPAIN mal a sâwm a.

en: And he left all that he had in Joseph’s hand; and he knew not aught that was with him, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was comely, and well-favored.
hmr: Chuongchun, a nei po po chu Josef kutah a sie tlat a, a kuoma thil um hrim hrim chu a hrietpui dêr nawh a, ama bufâk bak naw chu. Josef chu mi pien ṭhatak a nih a, a hmêl khawm a ṭha hleh a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
hmr: Chuong hnunga chun hieng hi a nih a, a pu nuhmei chun Josef chu dit enin a en a, “Mi zâlpui rawh,” a tih a.

en: But he refused, and said unto his master’s wife, Behold, my master knoweth not what is with me in the house, and he hath put all that he hath into my hand:
hmr: Ama ruok chu a nuom nawh a, a pu nuhmei kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, ka pu chun hi ina hin ka kuomah ieng ieng am a um a hriet si nawh a, a nei po po chu ka kutah a sie vawng a;

en: he is not greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back anything from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
hmr: hi ina hin keia nêka lien lem tukhawm an um nawh a: a nuhmei i ni leiin nang bak naw chu ka ta dingin iengkhawm inro a nei bawk nawh: chuleiin, iengtin am hi suol lientak hi thawin Pathien chungah thil suksuol thei ka ti leh?” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
hmr: Ni tinin Josef chu thlêm hlak sien khawm, ama zâlpui ding le ama kuoma um ding thu chu Josef chun a pawm nuom nawh a.

en: And it came to pass about this time, that he went into the house to do his work; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ni khat chu, a sin chu thaw dinga in sûnga a va lût lai, chu ina mi tukhawm hrim an um naw lai chun,

en: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
hmr: ama-nu chun, “Mi zâlpui rawh,” tiin a silfênah a lo man a; ama chun a silfên chu ama-nu kuta chun a tlânsan a, a suok ta dai a.

en: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
hmr: Chun, a silfên chu a kuta mâksanin a tlân suok tah ti a hriet phingleh,

en: that she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in a Hebrew unto us to mock us: he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
hmr: ama-nu chun a ina umhai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “En ta u, a mi sukmuolpho dingin Hebrai mi pakhat ei kuomah a ṭhuoi lût ta hi; mi zâlpui tumin ka kuomah a hung lût a, chuongchun, râwl inringtakin ka khêk a;

en: and it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and fled, and got him out.
hmr: chun, râwl insuoin inringtakin ka khêk ti a hriet phingleh, ka kâwlah a silfên hi a tlânsan a, a suok ta dai a ni kha,” a tih a.

en: And she laid up his garment by her, until his master came home.
hmr: Chun, Josef pu a hung hmakhat chu a silfên chu a kâwlah a lo sie zing a.

en: And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, whom thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
hmr: A kuomah chu thu bawk chu a lo hril a, “Hebrai siehlaw ei kuoma i hung ṭhuoi kha, mi sukmuolpho tumin ka kuomah a hung lût a:

en: and it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and fled out.
hmr: chun râwl insuoha ka khêk phingleh, ka kâwlah a silfên hi mâksanin a tlân suok tah a,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
hmr: Josef pu chun a nuhmeiin a kuoma, “I siehlaw hin hieng ang hin a mi thaw,” tiha a hril chu a hriet chun, a lunginsen ta thut a.

en: And Joseph’s master took him, and put him into the prison, the place where the king’s prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef pu chun ama chu a ṭhuoi a, intângna in, lal mi intâng khuopa an umnaa chun a khum tah a, chuongchun, chutaka intângna ina chun a um tah a.

en: But Jehovah was with Joseph, and showed kindness unto him, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chu Josef kuomah a um pei a, a chungah za a ngai a, intângna in vêngtu khawm ân lunginsiettir a.

en: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph’s hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
hmr: Chuongchun, intângna in vêng- tu chun intângna ina intânghai po po chu Josef kutah ân kawltir ta vawng a; chuongchun, chutaka an thaw taphawt chu Josef chu a thawtu a ni pei hlak a.

en: The keeper of the prison looked not to anything that was under his hand, because Jehovah was with him; and that which he did, Jehovah made it to prosper.
hmr: LALPA chu Josef kuomah a um a, a thilthaw taphawt LALPA chun ân hlawtlingtir hlak leiin intângna in vêngtu chun a kuta thil um hrim hrim chu ama ngaisak ṭûl a ti ta nawh a.

en: And the man knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man with the help of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Adam chun a nuhmei Evi chu a pâwl a; chuongchun, ân rai a, Kaina a hung nei a, “LALPA ṭhangpuinain pasal ka nei tah,” a ta.

en: And again she bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
hmr: Chun, a sang Abel a hung nei nâwk a. Abel chu berâm vêngtuah a um a, Kaina ruok chu hnuoi inlettuin.

en: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, a nakie chun hieng ang hi a na, Kaina chun LALPA kuoma inhlân dingin loa inthawkin a hung lâk a.

en: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And Jehovah had respect unto Abel and to his offering:
hmr: Abel khawm chun a berâm ruol laia a pieng hmasatakhai le a thau chu a hung lâk a. LALPA chun Abel le a thilinhlân chu a lâwm a;

en: but unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
hmr: Kaina le a thilinhlân ruok chu a lâwm ve nawh a. Chuongchun, Kaina chu a lunginsen êm êm a, a hmêl a hung inthim khup el tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
hmr: LALPA chun Kaina kuoma chun, “Iengdinga i lung a sen am? Ieng- dinga i hmêl a hung inthim am?

en: If thou doest well, shall it not be lifted up? and if thou doest not well, sin coucheth at the door; and unto thee shall be its desire; but do thou rule over it.
hmr: Thil thaw ṭha ni la chu pawm i ni naw ding am a nih? I thaw ṭha naw ruok chun suol chu kawtkhâr bulah a bawk zing a nih; a dit zâwng chu nangma thuhne che a nih a, nisienlakhawm, nangin i thuhne lem ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Cain told Abel his brother. And it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
hmr: Kaina chun a sang Abel kuomah, “Thaw ta, lo tieng va fêng ei tih,” a ta; loa an um lai chun Kaina chun a sang Abel chu a thawh a, a that ta el a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: am I my brother’s keeper?
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Kaina kuoma chun, “I sang Abel kha khâwlai am a um tah a?” a ta. Ama chun, “Ka hriet nawh, ka sang vêngtu am ka nih?” a tih a.

en: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me from the ground.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Iengam i thaw leh? I sang thisen râwl chun hnuoia inthawkin a mi ko a nih.

en: And now cursed art thou from the ground, which hath opened its mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand;
hmr: Hnuoi, i kuta inthawka i sang thisen dawng dinga a bâu lo katua inthawkin ṭawngsephur i ni tah,

en: when thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee its strength; a fugitive and a wanderer shalt thou be in the earth.
hmr: hnuoi în let pha khawm a ṭhatna chu pe phal ta naw ni che; hnuoia hin tlânhmang le invai hung ni tâng i tih,” a ta.

en: And Cain said unto Jehovah, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
hmr: Chun, Kaina chun LALPA kuomah, “I mi hremna hi a nasa bêk a, tuor zo naw ning.

en: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the ground; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth; and it will come to pass, that whosoever findeth me will slay me.
hmr: Ngai ta, nangin vawisûn hin hnuoi chunga inthawkin i mi hnawt- hmang ta sih a; i mithmua inthawk thuphmangin ka um ding a ni tah a; hnuoia hin tlânhmang le invai ka lo ni ta ding a ni sih a, chuleiin, a mi hmu taphawtin mi that el an tih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And Jehovah appointed a sign for Cain, lest any finding him should smite him.
hmr: LALPA chun a kuomah, “Chuong a ni chun tukhawm Kaina thattu chu a let sariin a chungah phuba lâk nîng a tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, mîn an hmu a, an that nawna dingin LALPAIN Kaina chu ân chik tah a.

en: And Cain went out from the presence of Jehovah, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
hmr: Chuongchun, Kaina chu LALPA kuoma inthawk chu a suok tah a. Eden sak tienga Nod ramah a um tah a.

en: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
hmr: Kaina chun a nuhmei a pâwl a, chuongchun, ân rai a, Enok a nei a; chun, khuo a siem a, a khaw hminga chun a naupa hming chawiin Enok a sak a.

en: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael; and Mehujael begat Methushael; and Methushael begat Lamech.
hmr: Enok chun Irad a nei a; Irad chun Mehujael a nei a; Mehujael chun Methusael a nei a; Methusael chun Lamek a nei a.

en: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
hmr: Lamek chun nuhmei pahni a nei a, pakhat hming chu Ada a nih a, pakhat hming chu Zila a nih.

en: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents and have cattle.
hmr: Ada chun Jabal a nei a, ama chu puon ina um ran vaituhai thlatu a nih.

en: And his brother’s name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and pipe.
hmr: A sang hming chu Jubal a na, ama chu ṭingṭang le theihle mûttuhai po po thlatu a nih.

en: And Zillah, she also bare Tubal-cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
hmr: Zila khawm chun Tubal-kaina, dâr le thîr hriemhrei tinrêng suttu, a nei a; chun Tubal-kaina farnu chu Naama a nih.

en: And Lamech said unto his wives: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; Ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: For I have slain a man for wounding me, And a young man for bruising me:
hmr: Lamek chun a nuhmeihai kuoma chun, “Ada le Zilla hai, ka rawl hre unla; Lamek nuhmeihai, ka thu hril hi ngai ro: Sukhliema ka um leiin mi ka that a, Vuok thitlinga ka um leiin tlangvâl ka that a nih:

en: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, Truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
hmr: Kaina phuba hman a let saria lâk a ni ding chun, Lamek phuba lem chu a let sâwmsari le pasariin lâk ni ngei a tih,” a ta.

en: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For, said she, God hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel; for Cain slew him.
hmr: Chun, Adam chun a nuhmei chu a pâwl nâwk a; chuongchun, ama chun naupasal a nei nâwk a, a hmingah Seth a sak a: “Pathienin Abel aiah chi thla dang a mi ruotpêk tah; Kaina chun ama a that ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enosh. Then began men to call upon the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ama, Seth ngei khawm chun naupasal a nei tah a; a hmingah Enos a sak a; chuong lai chun mihai chun LALPA hming chu an hung lam ṭan tah a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker offended their lord the king of Egypt.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun Aigupta lal uoin petu le a bei siemtu chun an pu Aigupta lal chu an suklungninawh a.

en: And Pharaoh was wroth against his two officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharao chu a siehlaw pahni, a uoin pe hotu tak le, a bei siem hotu tak chunga chun a lunginsen tah a.

en: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
hmr: Chuongchun vêngtu pâwl hotu inah, intângna in, Josef khuopa a umnaa chun, ân tângtir tah a.

en: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he ministered unto them: and they continued a season in ward.
hmr: Vêngtu pâwl hotu chun Josef chu anni ân enkawltir a: chuongchun, ama chun anni chu a nghâk a, an rawng a bâwl tah a: chun, ni iengzat lai amanih an intâng phawt a.

en: And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream, in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were bound in the prison.
hmr: Chun, intângna ina khuopa um, Aigupta lal uoin petu le bei siemtu chun, an pahniin zân khatah mang umze tum ve ve an nei a.

en: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and saw them, and, behold, they were sad.
hmr: A zînga zîngkâr chun Josef chu an kuomah a va lût a, anni chu lungngai hmêl deuin a va hmuh a.

en: And he asked Pharaoh’s officers that were with him in ward in his master’s house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sad to-day?
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Iem a tiha vawisûn chu lungngai hmêl in va put de?” tiin, Pharao siehlaw hotuhai, a pu ina ama kuoma intâng vehai chu ân dawn a.

en: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell it me, I pray you.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Mang kan nei a, a mi hrilfie thei tukhawm an um si nawha a nih,” an tih a. Josef chun an kuomah, “Mang hrilfienahai chu Pathien ta a ni naw am a nih? Lunginsiettakin mi hang hril ta u,” a tih a.

en: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
hmr: Chuongchun, uoin pe hotu tak chun a mang chu Josef a hril a, a kuomah, “Ka manga chun ka hmaa hin grêp hrui a lo um a,

en: and in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and its blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
hmr: grêp hruia chun a kau pathum a um bawk a; chun, inder suok angin a lo um a, pârhai a lo hung suok a: a pâr bâwrhai chun grêp hminhai a hung insuo tah a.

en: and Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
hmr: Chun, Pharao no chu ka kuta hin a lo um a; chuongchun, grêp rahai chu ka lo a, Pharao noa chun ka sâwr a, no chu Pharao kutah ka lo pêk a,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days;
hmr: Josef chun a kuomah, “Hi hi a hrilfiena a nih: a kau pathum chu ni thum a nih.

en: within yet three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head, and restore thee unto thine office: and thou shalt give Pharaoh’s cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
hmr: Tuta inthawk ni thuma chun Pharaoin i lu dawm kâng a ta, i sinthaw chu inthawtir nâwk a ti che: chuongchun, a uoin petu i ni laia i pêk dân pângngai ang khan Pharao no chu a kutah i pêk nâwk ding a ni chu.

en: But have me in thy remembrance when it shall be well with thee, and show kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
hmr: Amiruokchu, i chan ṭhat nâwk pha chun mi hung hre zing la, lungin- siettakin lunginsietna ka chungah hung inlangtir la, Pharao kuomah ka chanchin hung hril la, hi ina inthawk hin mi ṭhuoi suok rawh.

en: for indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
hmr: Hebrai mihai rama inthawka miin ân rûka an mîn rûk hmang ka nih a, hi rama khawm hin rip sûnga an mi khumna khawp iengkhawm ka suksuol nawh,” a tih a.

en: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, three baskets of white bread were on my head:
hmr: Bei siemtu chun hrilfiena chu a ṭha ti a hrietin Josef kuomah, “Kei khawm mang ka nei a, bei vâr leikhâwr pathumin ka lo sipsuon a;

en: and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of baked food for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
hmr: chun, leikhâwr chunghnung taka chun Pharao bu, beisiemtuin a siem, chi tinrêng hi a lo um a; chuong chu vatehaiin ka leikhawr sîpsuona inthawk chun an lo fâk mur mur a,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: the three baskets are three days;
hmr: Josef chun a dawn a, “Hi hi a hrilfiena a nih: leikhâwr pathum chu ni thum a nih;

en: within yet three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
hmr: tuta inthawka ni thuma chun Pharaoin i tisaa inthawkin i lu chu dawm kâng a ta, thing lêrah khai a ti che; chuongchun, vatehaiin i sa chu an fâk mur mur ding a ni chu,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and the head of the chief baker among his servants.
hmr: Chun, ni thum ni, Pharao pieng champhaphâk ni chun, Pharaoin ama siehlaw po pohai ta dingin ruoi a ṭheh a; chun, a siehlawhai laia mi uoin pe hotu tak le bei siem hotu tak lu chu a dawm kâng tah a.

en: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand:
hmr: Uoin pe hotu tak chu uoin pe hotuah ân ṭhangtir nâwk a; chuong- chun, no chu Pharao kuta chun a pêk tah a;

en: but he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
hmr: bei siem hotu tak ruok chu a khai tah a, Josefin an kuoma a hrilfie ang tak el khan.

en: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, uoin pe hotu tak chun Josef chu a hriet zing awzâwng ta nawh a, a theinghil tah a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
hmr: Chun, kum hni zet hnungah Pharao chun mang a nei a: Nile vadung panga hin a lo ngir a.

en: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, well-favored and fat-fleshed; and they fed in the reed-grass.
hmr: Bâwngpui pasari naltak tak, thâutak tak tuia inthawka hung suok a, phairuong laia tla hi a hmuh a.

en: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill-favored and lean-fleshed, and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
hmr: Chun, bâwngpui dang pasari ber- tak tak, chêrtak tak hi tuia inthawk bawka an hnunga hung suok ve chu a hmuh a, bâwngpui danghai kâwlah vadung panga chun an lo ngîr a.

en: And the ill-favored and lean-fleshed kine did eat up the seven well-favored and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
hmr: Chun, bâwngpui bertak tak, chêrtak tak chun bâwngpui naltak tak, thâutak tak chu an fâk zo el tah a. Chun, Pharao chu a ṭhang tah a.

en: And he slept and dreamed a second time: and, behold, seven ears of grain came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
hmr: Chun, a hang in nâwk a, mang a nei nâwk chun, bu kûng khata hin vui sari lientak tak, ṭhatak tak an hung suok a.

en: And, behold, seven ears, thin and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun vui sari chitê te khawsak thliin a mût ṭâwl bir berhai chu an hung suok nâwk a.

en: And the thin ears swallowed up the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
hmr: Chun, vui chitê têhai chun vui sari lientak tak, ṭhatak takhai chu an lem zo el tah a. Chun, Pharao chu a ṭhang a, a mang a lo ni zing el ti a hriet a.

en: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, zîngtieng chun a lungin- zîng ta hle el a; chuongchun, mi a tir a, Aigupta rama mitvaidawithiem po po le mivar po po chu a ko a; Pharao chun a mang chu a lo hril tâwl a: nisienlakhawm, Pharao hrilfie thei tukhawm an um nawh a.

en: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
hmr: Chun, uoin pe hotu tak chun Pharao kuomah, “Vawisûn hin ka suksuolzie ka hriet suok tah:

en: Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, me and the chief baker:
hmr: Pharao a siehlawhai chungah a lunginsen a, vêngtu pâwl hotu ina chun kei le bei siem hotu tak chu a mîn tângtir a;

en: and we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
hmr: Chun, kei le ama chun zân khatah mang kan nei a, mang umze tum ve ve a nih kan nei chu.

en: And there was with us there a young man, a Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
hmr: Chutaka chun kan kuoma vêngtu pâwl hotu siehlaw, Hebrai mi, tlangvâl pakhat a um a: ama chu kan hril a, ama chun kan manghai chu a mi hrilfie tah a, kan mang ang dungzui pei chun a mi hrilfiepêk ve veh a.

en: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
hmr: Chun, a mi hrilfie ang tak chun a hung um ta ngei a nih: kei chu ka sinthaw hi a mîn thawtir nâwk a, ama chu a khaihlum tah a,” a tih a.

en: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharao chun Josef chu ân kotir nghâl tah a, inhmawtakin ripa inthawk chun an ṭhuoi suok tah a; chun, ama chu ânvaw fai a, a silfên chu a thleng a, Pharao kuomah a hung lût a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that when thou hearest a dream thou canst interpret it.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun Josef kuomah, “Mang ka nei a, a hrilfie thei tukhawm an um nawh a, nangin mang hi a thu i hriet chun i hrilfie thei ti i chanchin mi hril ka lo hriet a,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
hmr: Josef chun Pharao chu a dawn a, “Chu chu keimaa um a ni nawh a, Pathienin Pharao chu thlamuong- thlâktakin dawn lem a tih,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the brink of the river:
hmr: Chun, Pharaoin Josef kuomah, “Ngai ta, ka manga chun Nile vapanga hin ka lo ngîr a,

en: and, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fat-fleshed and well-favored: and they fed in the reed-grass:
hmr: bâwngpui pasari naltak tak, thâutak tak hi tuia inthawk chun an hung suok a, phairuong lai hin an lo tlah a:

en: and, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill-favored and lean-fleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
hmr: chun, bâwngpui dang pasari bertak tak, chêrtak tak le inthirtak tak, chuong ang hrima sie Aigupta ram po poa khawm ka la hmu ngai naw hi, an hnungah an hung suok veh a;

en: and the lean and ill-favored kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
hmr: chun, bâwngpui bertak tak, chêrtak takhai chun bâwngpui pasari thâutak tak hung suok hmasahai chu an fâk zo el tah a.

en: and when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill-favored, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
hmr: Amiruokchu, an fâk zo hnung khawm chun tu khawma an fâk ti an hriet chuong nawh, a phuta ang bawk khan an la ber zing a. Chun, ka ṭhang tah a.

en: And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up upon one stalk, full and good:
hmr: Chun, ka manga chun bu kûng khata vui sari lientak tak, ṭhatak tak hung suok ka hmu bawk a;

en: and, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
hmr: chu hnunga chun vui sari vuoi sil sel, chite te, khawsak thli imût ṭâwl bir ber hi an hung suok nâwk a:

en: and the thin ears swallowed up the seven good ears: and I told it unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
hmr: chun, vui chite tehai chun vui sari ṭhatak takhai chu an lem zo el tah a. Chun, mitvaidawithiemhai chu ka hril a, nisienlakhawm, a mi hrilfie thei tukhawm an um si nawh a,” tiin a hril a.

en: And Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: what God is about to do he hath declared unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun Pharao kuom- ah, “Pharao mang hi thuhmun a nih: Pathienin a thilthaw ding Pharao ân hriettir a ni chu.

en: The seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
hmr: Bâwngpui pasari ṭhatak takhai chu kum sari an nih, bu vui sari ṭhatak takhai khawm chu kum sari an ni bawk a; mang chu thuhmun a nih.

en: And the seven lean and ill-favored kine that came up after them are seven years, and also the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind; they shall be seven years of famine.
hmr: An hnunga bâwngpui pasari bertak tak, chêrtak tak hung suokhai chu kum sari an nih; bu vui sari a si ruok khawsak thli imût ṭâwl bir berhai khawm chu: chuong chu ṭâm kum, kum sari ding a nih.

en: That is the thing which I spake unto Pharaoh: what God is about to do he hath showed unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chu chu a nih Pharao kuoma ka hril kha: Pathienin a thilthaw ding Pharao ân hriettir a ni hi.

en: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:
hmr: Aigupta ram sûng po poa hin hausakna nasatak kum sari a hung tlung ding a nih;

en: and there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
hmr: chu hnunga chun ṭâm kum, kum sari hung um nâwk a tih, chuongchun, hausakna po po kha Aigupta rama hin theinghil vawng ni tâng a tih; ṭâm chun ram hi fa se zo a tih:

en: and the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine which followeth; for it shall be very grievous.
hmr: hausakna kha a zuitu ṭâm lei chun hi rama hin hre ta naw ni hai, a nasa hle ding a ni sih a.

en: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh, it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
hmr: Chun, Pharao mang ân nei nawntirna che chu hi lei hi a nih, thil thaw ding chu Pathienin a sukdet a, Pathien bawkin ân tlungtir vak ding leiin.

en: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin Pharao chun mi pakhat vartak, bengvârtak zawng suok sienla, Aigupta ram chunga hin hotuah inumtir raw se.

en: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint overseers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
hmr: Pharaoin chu chu thaw sienla; chun, ram chunga hin hotuhai ruot sienla, hausak kum, kum sari sûng chun Aigupta ram bu hi hmun ngaa ṭheha hmun khat pei la khâwm raw hai se.

en: And let them gather all the food of these good years that come, and lay up grain under the hand of Pharaoh for food in the cities, and let them keep it.
hmr: Anni chun chuong kum ṭhat kum hung tlung dinga bu po po chu Pharao thuneinain la khâwmin, fâk dingin khuoahai sung khâwmin vawng ṭha raw hai se.

en: And the food shall be for a store to the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt; that the land perish not through the famine.
hmr: Chuongchun, ṭâm leia ram hi a bohmang nawna dingin, bu chu ṭâm kum, kum sari, Aigupta rama hung tlung ding sûnga ding chun, hi ram ta ding hin inringlâwkna ding nîng a tih,” a tih a.

en: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
hmr: Chu thu chu Pharao le a sie- hlawhai po po chun ṭha an ti zâwng tak a nih a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto his servants, Can we find such a one as this, a man in whom the spirit of God is?
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun a siehlaw- hai kuomah, “Hieng ang, Pathien thlarau umna mi hi, ei hmu zo ding am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath showed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou:
hmr: Pharao bawk chun Josef kuom- ah, “Pathienin chuong po po chu ân hriettir che leiin, nang anga bengvâr le var hrim hi an um nawh:

en: thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
hmr: nang hi ka sûnghai chunga hotuah um i ta, ka khuoletui po po i thu thuin um a tih: lalṭhungphaa ṭhung thua chau hin nanga nêkin inlal ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Pharao bawk chun Josef kuomah, “En ta, Aigupta ram sûng po poa hin hotuah ka siem che,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh took off his signet ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph’s hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
hmr: Chun, Pharaoin a kuta inthawkin a hming namna kutsebi chu a phawi a, Josef kutah ân buntir a, puon zai inhmia siem silfênhai ân hâktir bawk a, a rîngah rângkachak khaidiet ân hlîtir a;

en: and he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him, Bow the knee: and he set him over all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, a tawlailîr nei pahninaa chun ân chuongtir a, a hmaa chun, “Dingṭhaṭhuon ro,” tiin an khêk pei a; chuongchun, Aigupta ram po po chunga chun hotuah a siem tah a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Pharaoin Josef kuomah, “Kei Pharao ka nih, nanga thu naw chun Aigupta ram sûng po poa hin tukhawmin an kut amanih, an ke amanih inlet naw ni hai,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him to wife Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera priest of On. And Joseph went out over the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Pharaoin Josef hmingah Zaphenath-paneah ân bûk a: On khaw thiempu Potiphera naunu Asenath chu nuhmeiah ân neitir bawk a. Chun, Josef chu a suok a, Aigupta ram chu a fang tah a.

en: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Josef chu Aigupta lal Pharao hmaa a ngîr laiin kum sâwmthum mi a nih. Chun, Josef chu Pharao kuoma inthawk chu a suok a, Aigupta ram po po chu a fang suok tah a.

en: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
hmr: Chun, kum ṭhat kum, kum sari sûng chun hnuoi chun hlâwktakin bu an suo hlak a.

en: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, laid he up in the same.
hmr: Aigupta rama kum ṭhat kum, kum sari hung tlunga bu po po chu a lâk khâwm a, bu chu khuohaia chun a sung khâwm tah a; khaw tinah a vêl lova bu seng chu a sung khâwm pei a.

en: And Joseph laid up grain as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left off numbering; for it was without number.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chun bu chu tamtak, tuisuorieta phaiphin zâtin a sung khâwm rei rui el a, ân khi khawm chu a ma ta hiel a, inkhi sêng ruol a ni ta si nawh a.

en: And unto Joseph were born two sons before the year of famine came, whom Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera priest of On, bare unto him.
hmr: Ṭâm hung tlung hma chun Josef chun naupasal pahni a nei a, chuhai chu On khaw thiempu Potiphera naunu Asenath chun a neipêk a nih.

en: And Joseph called the name of the first-born Manasseh: For, said he, God hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father’s house.
hmr: Josef chun a nau lutîr hminga chun Manasse a sak a, “Pathienin kân rimna po po le ka pa sûnghai chu a mîn theinghiltir ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And the name of the second called he Ephraim: For God hath made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.
hmr: Chun, a nau pahnina hminga chun Ephraim a sak a, “Pathienin ka rinum tuorna rama hin chi a mîn thlatir ta sih a,” a tih a.

en: And the seven years of plenty, that was in the land of Egypt, came to an end.
hmr: Kum ṭhat kum, kum sari, Aigupta rama hung tlung chu a hung bo tah a.

en: And the seven years of famine began to come, according as Joseph had said: and there was famine in all lands; but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
hmr: Chun, ṭâm kum, kum sari chu Josef hril ang takin a hung tlung phut ve tah a: ram tinah ṭâm a hung tla tah a, Aigupta ram sûng poa ruok chun fâk ding a um a.

en: And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread: and Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go unto Joseph; what he saith to you, do.
hmr: Aigupta rama mi po po chu an ṭâm phingleh Pharao kuomah fâk ding hniin an khêk a. Pharao chun Aigupta mi po po kuoma chun, “Josef kuomah fe unla, a hril taphawt cheu chu thaw ro,” a tih a.

en: And the famine was over all the face of the earth: and Joseph opened all the store-houses, and sold unto the Egyptians; and the famine was sore in the land of Egypt.
hmr: Ṭâm chu ram po poa a hung tla phing chun Josef chun an sung khâwmna in po po chu a hawng a, Aigupta mihai kuoma chun a zawr a: Aigupta rama chun ṭâm chu a tla nasa hleh a.

en: And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph to buy grain, because the famine was sore in all the earth.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chung po poa ṭâm chu a tlâk nasat hle leiin ram tina mihai chu bu inchaw dingin Aiguptaa Josef kuoma chun an hung a.

en: Now Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt, and Jacob said unto his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
hmr: Jakobin Aigupta ramah bu a um ti a lo hriet a, a naupa- salhai kuomah, “Iengdinga in inen mei mei am a na?” a tih a.

en: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is grain in Egypt: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
hmr: Ama bawk chun, “Ngai ta u, Aigupta ramah bu a um ti ka lo hriet tah: thi loa ei hring suok theina dingin chutaka chun zu fe unla, chutaka inthawk chun zûn chaw ro khai,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph’s ten brethren went down to buy grain from Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef uhai sâwm chu Aiguptaah bu inchaw dingin an zu fe tah a.

en: But Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure harm befall him.
hmr: Josef sang Benjamin ruok chu a uhai lai Jakob chun ân fetir ve nawh a, “Tuok suol zu tuok hlau rawi a tih,” a ti a nih.

en: And the sons of Israel came to buy among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel naupasalhai chu mi fehai lai chun bu inchaw dingin an fe ve tah a, Kanaan rama khawm ṭâm a tla ve sih a.

en: And Joseph was the governor over the land; he it was that sold to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brethren came, and bowed down themselves to him with their faces to the earth.
hmr: Chun, Josef chu Aigupta ram chunga chun hotu a nih a, ama chu chu rama mi po po kuoma a zawrtu a nih: chuongchun, Josef unauhai chu an hung a, hnuoi sikin ama chibai an bûk tâwl a.

en: And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly with them; and he said unto them, Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
hmr: Josef chun a uhai chu a lo hmuh a, anni chu a lo hriet tâwl hleh a; nisienlakhawm, mi dang anga hriet naw tehlêm thawin inrawm- takin anni a biek a, “Khawlaia inthawka hung am in nih a?” a tih a. Anni chun, “Bu inchaw dinga Kanaan rama inthawka hung kan nih,” an tih a.

en: And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
hmr: Josef chun a uhai rawi chu a lo hriet a, anni ruok chun ama chu an hriet si nawh a.

en: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun anni chung- châng thu manga a hmuhai kha a hung hriet suok tah a, an kuomah, “Enthlatuhai in ni hi, ram ruokzie en dinga hung in ni hi tie,” a tih a.

en: And they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy servants come.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Ni lo e, Pu, i siehlawhai hi bu inchaw dinga hung kan nih.

en: We are all one man’s sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.
hmr: Mi pakhat nau vawng kan nih a, mi indiktak kan nih, i siehlawhai hi enthlatuhai kan ni naw tawp el,” an tih a.

en: And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Ka awi nawh, ram ruokzie en dinga hung in ni hi maw,” a tih a.

en: And they said, We thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
hmr: Anni chun, “Keini i siehlawhai hi unau sâwmpahni, Kanaan rama um, mi pakhat nau kan nih: chun, ngai ta, kan mi tlum tak tuhin kan pa kuomah a um a, pakhat ruok chu a um ta naw a nih,” an tih a.

en: And Joseph said unto them, That is it that I spake unto you, saying, Ye are spies:
hmr: Josef chun an kuomah, “ ‘Enthlatuhai in ni hi,’ ka ti kha in ni ngei hi.

en: hereby ye shall be proved: by the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.
hmr: Hieng ang hin infiein um in tih: in mi tlumtak chu hitaka hin a hung naw chun Pharao hringna sâlin hitaka inthawk hin suok naw ti niu ti ka hril cheu.

en: Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be bound, that your words may be proved, whether there be truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies.
hmr: Nangniah thutak a um le a um naw infiena dingin nangni laia mi pakhat tir unla, in sangpa chu hung ṭhuoi raw se; nangni ruok chu khuopin lo um phawt in tih: chuong naw chun Pharao hringna sâlin, ‘Enthlatuhai in nih,’ ka ti ngei ding cheu a nih,” a tih a.

en: And he put them all together into ward three days.
hmr: Chun, an rêng chun ni thum ân tângtir tâwl a.

en: And Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live; for I fear God:
hmr: A ni thum ni chun Josef chun an kuomah, “Hieng ang hin thaw unla hring in tih, Pathien ka ṭi sih a:

en: if ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in your prison-house; but go ye, carry grain for the famine of your houses:
hmr: mi indik in ni chun, in unau laia mi pakhat in intângna ina hin khuopin um sienla, a dang po chu fe unla, in sûnghai ṭâm ta ding chun bu phur ro:

en: and bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.
hmr: chun, in mi tlumtak chu ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi ro; chuongchun, in thu chu fieng a ta, in thi naw ding a nih,” a tih a. Chuongchun, chuong ang chun an thaw tah a.

en: And they said one to another, We are verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Ei sangpa chunga ei thilthaw kha ei thiemnaw tak tak a ni hi, lunginsiet dinga a mi ngên ṭâwk ṭâwk laia, a lungril lungin- zîngzie hre zing siha ei ngaipêk nuom naw kha: chuleiin, hi lunginzîngna hin a mi hung nel ve a ni ta hi,” an in tih a.

en: And Reuben answered them, saying, Spake I not unto you, saying, Do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore also, behold, his blood is required.
hmr: Chun, Reuben chun, “Naupang chungah thil suksuol naw ro ka ti naw cheu am a nih? in ngai nawh a, chuleiin, ngai ta u, a thisen phuba chu an lâk a ni hi,” tiin anni chu a dawn a.

en: And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for there was an interpreter between them.
hmr: An kâra ṭawng inlettu a um leiin Josef chun an thu hril chu a hriet ti an hriet nawh a.

en: And he turned himself about from them, and wept; and he returned to them, and spake to them, and took Simeon from among them, and bound him before their eyes.
hmr: Chun, ama chu ân her hmang a, a ṭap tah a: chun, an kuomah a kîr nâwk a, anni a biek a, anni laia Simeon chu a tumin a ṭhuoi a; an mithmua chun a khuop tah a.

en: Then Joseph commanded to fill their vessels with grain, and to restore every man’s money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus was it done unto them.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun an bâwmhai chu bua suksip ding le an tangkahai an ipa sie nâwk seng ding le, lampuia dinga fâk ding pe dingin thu a pêk a: chuong ang chun an thaw pêk tah a.

en: And they laded their asses with their grain, and departed thence.
hmr: Chun, an bu chu an sabeng- tunghai chu an inphurtir a, chutaka inthawk chu an suok tah a.

en: And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the lodging-place, he espied his money; and, behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.
hmr: Anni laia mi pakhatin riebûka chun a sabengtung bu pe dinga a ip a hang hawng chun, a tangka chu a hmu ta el a, a ip bau bula chun a lo um a.

en: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they turned trembling one to another, saying, What is this that God hath done unto us?
hmr: Chuongchun, a unauhai kuoma chun, “Ka tangka kha an lo sie nâwk a ni hi tie, en ta u, ka ipa hi a lo um zing el,” a tih a: chun an lung a kak rak a, “Pathienin hieng anga a mi thaw hi iengtizie am a ni aw?” tiin, inthin pumin an inen tâwl a.

en: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan, and told him all that had befallen them, saying,
hmr: Kanaan rama an pa kuom chu an hung tlung a, an chunga thil hung tlung po po chu an hril a.

en: The man, the lord of the land, spake roughly with us, and took us for spies of the country.
hmr: “Chu an ram hotu chun inrawm- takin a mi biek a, ram enthlatuah a mi ruot a.

en: And we said unto him, We are true men; we are no spies:
hmr: Chun, keini chun a kuomah, ‘Mi indiktak kan nih, enthlatuhai kan ni naw tawp el,

en: we are twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
hmr: unau sâwm le pahni kan nih; kan pa naupasalhai kan ni vawng a, pakhat chu a um ta nawh a, kan mi tlumtak chu tuhin Kanaan ramah kan pa kuomah a um a nih,’ kan tih a.

en: And the man, the lord of the land, said unto us, Hereby shall I know that ye are true men: leave one of your brethren with me, and take grain for the famine of your houses, and go your way;
hmr: Chun, ram hotu chun kan kuomah, ‘Hieng ang hin mi indiktak in nih ti hre thei ka tih, in unau pakhat ka kuomah mâksan unla, in sûnghai ṭâm ta ding chun bu phur unla, fe ta ro: chun in mi tlumtak chu ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi ro:

en: and bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: so will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffic in the land.
hmr: chuongchun, enthlatuhai in ni nawh a, mi indiktak in ni lem ti hrieng ka tih; chun, in unaupa hi pe nâwk ka ti cheu a, hi rama hin sumdâwng tâng in tih,’ a mi ti a nih,” an tih a.

en: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man’s bundle of money was in his sack: and when they and their father saw their bundles of money, they were afraid.
hmr: Chun, an iphai chu an bun ruok chun, ngai ta, an tangka fûn seng chu an ip senga chun a lo um a; chun, anni le an pa chun an tangka fûn chu an hmu chun an ṭi hleh a.

en: And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away: all these things are against me.
hmr: Chun, an pa Jakob chun an kuomah, “Nangni hin ka nauhai in mîn sûntir a ni hi: Josef a um ta nawh a, Simeon a um ta nawh a, Benjamin chen khawm ṭhuoi hmang in tum nâwk pei a: chuong thil po po chun a mi baw buoi a ni ta hi,” a tih a.

en: And Reuben spake unto his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
hmr: Chun, Reuben chun a pa kuomah, “I kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi nâwk naw leh ka naupasalhai hi that el de ti ni: ama chu ka kutah mîn kawltir la, i kuomah hung ṭhuoi nâwk el ka tih,” tiin a hril a.

en: And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he only is left: if harm befall him by the way in which ye go, then will ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ka naupa hi nangni leh fe thla ve naw tawp a tih, a u a thi tah a, ama bak hi a ni ta sih a: in fena lampuia dâm tuoksuol zu tuok sien- la, ka lu inṭuok hi lungngaitakin thlânah in inliemtir ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And the famine was sore in the land.
hmr: Chun, chu rama chun ṭâm chu a tla nasa hleh a.

en: And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the grain which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
hmr: Aiguptaah bu an phur kha an fâk zo chun, an pa chun an kuomah, “Fe nâwk unla, bu tlâwmte bêk ei ta dingin zûn chaw nâwk ro khai,” a tih a.

en: And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Juda chun a kuomah, “Ama chun, ‘In sangpa in kuoma a hung ṭhang ve naw chun, ka hmêl hmu naw ti niu,’ tiin a mi tiem tlat a nih.

en: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
hmr: Kan sangpa hi keini leh i tir chun bu chu inchaw pêk kan ti che:

en: but if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down; for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
hmr: i tir naw ruok chun zu fe naw ning ungah; ama chun kan kuomah, ‘In sangpa in kuoma a hung ṭhang ve naw chun ka hmêl hmu naw ti niu,’ a ti tlat sih a,” tiin a hril a.

en: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
hmr: Israel chun, “Iengdinga sang dang in la nei thu dâm hril khera ka ta dinga thil ṭha nawtak thaw am in ni leh?” a tih a.
