en: And they said, The man asked straitly concerning ourselves, and concerning our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we in any wise know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
hmr: Anni chun “In pa chu a la dam am? unau dang in la nei am?” tiin kan chanchin le ei laibunghai chanchin a mîn dawn tlat sih a; chuong a thu mîn dawn ang pei chun kan hril a nih: “In sangpa chu hung ṭhuoi thla ro, tîng a tih ti tuin am hre kher kher a ti leh?” an tih a.

en: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
hmr: Juda chun a pa Israel kuomah, “Bawipu chu ka kuomah infetir rawh, chuongchun, tho kan ta, fe el kan tih, keini le nangni le ei nau le tehai hi thi loa ei um theina dingin.

en: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
hmr: A chungthua hin keiin a bul tum pei ka tih: keia inthawk ngeiin ama chu phût rawh. I kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi nâwk a, i hmaa hin kân ngîrtir nâwk naw chun, a maw chu kum- khuoin phur de ningah;

en: for except we had lingered, surely we had now returned a second time.
hmr: muong naw inla chu tuhin a vawihnina khawm kan hung tlung nâwk ta ding bah,” a tih a.

en: And their father Israel said unto them, If it be so now, do this: take of the choice fruits of the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spicery and myrrh, nuts, and almonds;
hmr: Chun, an pa Israel chun an kuomah, “Chuong ang a ni si chun hieng ang hin thaw ro, in bâwmhaia khan hi rama thil ṭha ṭhenkhat thinghnai damdawi, khuoizu, rimin- hnik, murra, theihâwngngar le almond thei dâm tlâwmte sengin ama ta ding chun lâwmman dingin chawi thla ro.

en: and take double money in your hand; and the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks carry again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight:
hmr: Tangka khawm a lêt hniin chawi unla, in ip bau bula tangka a pêkkîr hai cheu khawm kha chawi kîr nâwk ro; a thaw pal a ni rawi mawh.

en: take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
hmr: In sangpa khawm chu ṭhuoi unla, tho unla, ama kuoma chun fe nâwk ro,

en: and God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may release unto you your other brother and Benjamin. And if I be bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.
hmr: in sangpa pakhat le Benjamin hi ân suo pêkna ding cheuin, Pathien Iengkimthawthei chun ama chu inlunginsiettir raw se cheu. Ka nau- hai chu chân a ni leh ka chân ding ni el a tih,” a tih a.

en: And the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chun lâwm- man chu an chawi a, tangka khawm chu a lethniin an chawi bawk a. Benjamin khawm an ṭhuoi a: chun, an tho a, Aiguptaa chun an zu feh a, Josef hmaa chun an ngîr nâwk tah a.

en: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the steward of his house, Bring the men into the house, and slay, and make ready; for the men shall dine with me at noon.
hmr: Josef chun Benjamin an kuoma um chu a hmu phingleh, a in enkawltu kuoma chun, “Sawhai saw in sûngah ṭhuoi lût la, sa that la, buotsai rawh, anni sawn sûnah ka kuomah bu an fâk ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And the man did as Joseph bade; and the man brought the men to Joseph’s house.
hmr: Mi chun Josef thupêk ang chun a thawh a; anni chu Josef ina chun a ṭhuoi lût a.

en: And the men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph’s house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.
hmr: Chun, Josef ina ṭhuoi lûta an um leiin an ṭih a, “Fe hmasak ṭuma ei ipa tangka a mi pêk kîrhai lei khan a ni hi a mi ṭhuoi lût: ei chunga remchâng zawnga mi thawin, eini le ei sabengtunghai le hin suoka um dinga mi man a tum a ni hi,” an tih a.

en: And they came near to the steward of Joseph’s house, and they spake unto him at the door of the house,
hmr: Chun, Josef in enkawltu kuoma chun an va feh a, kawtkhâr bula chun an biek a,

en: and said, Oh, my lord, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
hmr: “Aw pu, kan hung hmasak ṭum khan bu inchaw ding ngawta hung thla kan nih a;

en: and it came to pass, when we came to the lodging-place, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man’s money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
hmr: chun, riebûk kan tlung chun kan iphai chu kan hang hawng a; kan tangka seng chu kan ip bau bulah a lo um ta seng a, kan tangka chu a bûk ngai chiein a lo um a; chuongchun, kan hung chawi nâwk a nih.

en: And other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food: we know not who put our money in our sacks.
hmr: Chun, bu inchâwkna dingin tangka dang kan hung chawi a, kan tangka chu kan ipah tuin am a sie ti kan hriet si nawh,” an tih a.

en: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.
hmr: Ama chun, “Lungmuongtakin um unla, ṭi naw ro, in Pathien, in pa Pathien chun in iphaia chun ro a pêk cheu a ni chu: in tangka kha ka hmu sih a,” a tih a. Chun, Simeon chu an kuomah a hung ṭhuoi suokpêk tah a.

en: And the man brought the men into Joseph’s house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
hmr: A in enkawltu chun anni chu Josef in sûngah a ṭhuoi lût a, tui a pêk a, an ke an sâwp tah a; an sabeng- tunghai chu bu a pêk bawk a.

en: And they made ready the present against Joseph’s coming at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
hmr: Anni chun an lâwmman hung chawi chu Josef sûnbu faha a hung inlawi phaa dingin an lo siem lâwk diem a; chutaka chun bu an fâk ding a nih ti an hriet leiin.

en: And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed down themselves to him to the earth.
hmr: Josef chu a inah a hung phingleh, an lawmman hung chawi chu in sûngah a kuomah an chawi lût a, hnuoi sikin chibai an bûk tâwl a.

en: And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?
hmr: Ama chun an chanchin ân dawn a, “In pa a chanchin in hril tarpa kha a dam lai am a nih, damin a la um de maw?” a tih a.

en: And they said, Thy servant our father is well, he is yet alive. And they bowed the head, and made obeisance.
hmr: Anni chun, “Kan pa i siehlaw chu a dam lai a nih, damin a la um,” an tih a. Chun, an lu an kûn a, chibai an bûk nâwk a.

en: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw Benjamin his brother, his mother’s son, and said, Is this your youngest brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a hang dâk a, a sang Benjamin, a nu naupa chu a hmuh a, “Kha kha in mi tlumtak, a chanchin in mi hril kha a ni?” a tih a. Ama bawkin, “Ka naupa, Pathienin lunginsiet raw se che,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph made haste; for his heart yearned over his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
hmr: Chun, Josefin a sang a hmu chun lungriemin a thlâk a, chuong- chun, ṭapna hmun inhmawtakin a zawng ta vat a, pindan sûngah a lût a, chutaka chun a ṭap suok tah a.

en: And he washed his face, and came out; and he refrained himself, and said, Set on bread.
hmr: Chun, a hmai a phih a, a va suok nâwk a, ân sûm hrâm hrâm a, “Bufâk siem ro le,” a tih a.

en: And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, that did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama ta dingin atumin, annirawi ta dingin a tumin, Aigupta mihai a fâkpuihai ta dingin a tumin an siem tah a. (Aigupta mihai chun Hebrai mihai chu buthlêng an awtpui thei si nawh; chuong anga thaw chu Aigupta mihai ta ding chun a thieng naw a nih).

en: And they sat before him, the first-born according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one with another.
hmr: Chuongchun, a upa tak chu a nau lutîr nina angin, a naupang tak chu a nau mitlum nina angin Josef hmaa chun an ṭhung pei a: chuong- chun, mak an ti tâwl seng a.

en: And he took and sent messes unto them from before him: but Benjamin’s mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with him.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a kuoma chanvohai chu an kuomah ân hlân sâwngtir pei a. Benjamin chanvo lem chu an chanvo po po nêkin a lêtngain a tam lem a. Chun, uoin dâm an dâwn a, ama rawi chun an hlim ta hle a.

en: And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a in enkawltu kuoma chun, “Khahai ip kha an phur thei tâwkin buin suksip la, an tangka seng chu an ip bau bulah sie seng rawh.

en: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, and his grain money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
hmr: Chun, ka no, tangkaruo no kha, an naupang tak ip bau bulah sie rawh, a bu man tangka le khan,” tiin thu a pêk a. Ama chun Josef hril ang chun a thaw tah a.

en: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
hmr: Khuo a hung var phingleh anni chu an sabengtunghai le chun an infetir tah a.

en: And when they were gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
hmr: Khuoa inthawka an fe suok chu an la tlung hlat hmain, Josef chun a in enkawltu kuoma chun, “Tho la, mihai kha va hnawt rawh; chun, i hnawt phâk phingleh an kuomah, ‘Iengtizieha thil ṭha thil ṭha nawha thung am in ni lie? Iengdinga ka tangkaruo no kha in inrûk am?

en: Is not this that in which my lord drinketh, and whereby he indeed divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
hmr: Kha kha ka pu uoin dâwnna le aisânna ngei a ni naw am a nih? hieng ang in thaw hi in thaw suol a nih,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these words.
hmr: Chun, a hnawt phâk a, chuong thu chu an kuomah a hril a.

en: And they said unto him, Wherefore speaketh my lord such words as these? Far be it from thy servants that they should do such a thing.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Pu, iengtizie am a na hieng ang thu i hril hi? I siehlawhai hin chuong ang thil kan thaw naw dingzie chu.

en: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?
hmr: Ngai ta, kan ip bau bula tangka kan hmuhai khawm kha Kanaan rama inthawkin i kuomah kan hung chawi nâwk kha: iengtin am i pu ina tangka amanih, rângkachak amanih inru thei kan ti leh?

en: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.
hmr: I siehlawhai laia hin tukhawm i hmuna taphawt chu thi raw se, keini khawm ei pu suokah um el kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my bondman; and ye shall be blameless.
hmr: Ama chun, “Aw le, in thu ang pei chu ni raw se chu: amiruokchu, tukhawm ka hmuna taphawt chu ka suokah um raw se, nangni ruok chu fe thei in tih,” a tih a.

en: Then they hasted, and took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
hmr: Chu phingle chun inhmawtakin mâni ip chu hnuoiah an lâk thlâk seng a, mâni ip chu an hawng seng bawk a.

en: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left off at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an upa takah a phut a, an naupang tak chenin a zawng a: chuongchun, no chu Benjamin ipa chun a hmu tah a.

en: Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
hmr: Chu phingle chun an silfênhai chu an keithlêr a, mâni sabengtung chu an inphurtir nâwk seng a, khuoa chun an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house; and he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
hmr: Chun, Juda le a unauhai chun Josef in chu an va tlung a, ama chu chutaka chun a lo la um zing a; chun, a hmaa chun an bawkkhup tâwl tah a.

en: And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done? know ye not that such a man as I can indeed divine?
hmr: Chun, Josef chun an kuomah, “Ieng thil am an ta leh in thaw hi? Keia ang mi hin ai an sân thiem ngei ngei ti in hriet naw am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord’s bondmen, both we, and he also in whose hand the cup is found.
hmr: Juda chun, “Pu, i kuomah ieng am hril tâng kan ti leh? Ieng am hril kan tih a? Iengtin am in hrilveng tâng kan ti leh? Pathienin i siehlawhai suolna chu a hmu suok tah a ni hi: ngai ta, pu, i suokhai kan ni a ni ta hi, keini le a kuta no an hmuna khawm hi,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Far be it from me that I should do so: the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my bondman; but as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Chuong ang chun ka thaw naw dingzie chu: a kuta no an hmuna bak hi ka suokah um a tih: nangni ruok chu in pa kuomah lungmuongtakin fe ta ro,” a tih a.

en: Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh, my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant; for thou art even as Pharaoh.
hmr: Chu phingleh Juda chun Josef chu a va hnai a, “Aw pu, lungin- siettakin i siehlaw hi i hrietah thu bau khat mîn hriltir rawh, i lunginsen chu i siehlaw chunga hin inchawktir naw la, nang chu Pharao ang el i ni sih a.

en: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
hmr: Pu, nangin, ‘Pa amanih, unau amanih in nei am?’ tiin i siehlawhai hi i mîn dawn a.

en: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother; and his father loveth him.
hmr: Chun, pu, keinîn i kuoma hin, ‘Pa, tarsie le, a tar tieng nau, naupangtak kan nei, chu u chu a thih a, a pa chun ama chu a hmangai ngawt el,’ kan tih a.

en: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
hmr: Chun, nangin i siehlawhai kuoma hin, ‘Ama chu ka mita ka hmu theina dingin ka kuomah hung ṭhuoi thla ro,’ i tih a.

en: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
hmr: Chun, pu, keinîn i kuomah, ‘Bawipu chun a pa mâksan thei naw nih, a mâksan chun a pa chu a thi el ding a ni sih a,’ kan tih a.

en: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
hmr: Chun, nangin i siehlawhai kuoma hin, ‘In mi tlumtak chu nangni le a hung thla ve naw chun ka hmêl hmu ta naw ti niu,’ i tih a.

en: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
hmr: I siehlaw kan pa kuom kan hang tlung chun, pu, i thu chu kan hril a.

en: And our father said, Go again, buy us a little food.
hmr: Chun, kan pa chun, ‘Fe nâwk phawt unla, bu tlâwmte bêk ei ta dingin zûn chaw nâwk ro,’ a tih a.

en: And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down; for we may not see the man’s face, except our youngest brother be with us.
hmr: Chun, keinîn, ‘Zu fe thei ta naw ning ungah: kan mi tlumtak hi kan kuoma a hung ve ding chun zu fe nâwk el kan tih, kan mitlum tak hi kan kuoma a hung ve naw ding chun, ama hmêl chu kan hmu thei naw ding a nih,’ kan tih a.

en: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
hmr: Chun, i siehlaw ka pa chun kan kuomah, ‘Ka nuhmei chun naupasal pahni a mi neipêk ti in hriet;

en: and the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I have not seen him since:
hmr: Chun, pakhat chu ka kuoma inthawkin a fe suok a; keinawi nengin a um ni ngei a tih ka tih a; chutaka inthawk chu ama chu ka hmu ta naw vang vang a.

en: and if ye take this one also from me, and harm befall him, ye will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.
hmr: Ama khawm hi ka kuoma inthawk in ṭhuoi hmang a, tuoksuol a zu tuok chun, ka lu inṭuok hi lungngaitakin thlânah in mîn liemtir ding a nih,’ a tih a.

en: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad is not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad’s life;
hmr: Chuongchun, Bawipu hi kan laia ṭhang loa, i siehlaw ka pa kuom ka hang tlung chun, a hringna chu Bawipu hringna le hin ân zawm tlat leiin hieng ang hi nîng a tih:

en: it will come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants will bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to Sheol.
hmr: Bawipu hi a ṭhang ve nawh ti a hriet phingleh thi el a tih: chuong- chun, i siehlawhai hin i siehlaw kan pa lu inṭuok rak chu lungngaitakin thlânah kan inliemtir ding a ni hi.

en: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then shall I bear the blame to my father for ever.
hmr: I siehlaw hin, ‘I kuoma ka hung ṭhuoi nâwk naw chun a maw chu kumkhuoin i chungah phur ka tih,’ tiin ka pa kuoma chun Bawipu chungthua hin a bul tumtuah kân siem ta sih a.

en: Now therefore, let thy servant, I pray thee, abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
hmr: Chuleiin, lunginsiettakin, i sie- hlaw hi Bawipu aiah, pu, i suokah mîn umtir la, Bawipu hi a uhai kuomah hang infetir rawh.

en: For how shall I go up to my father, if the lad be not with me? lest I see the evil that shall come on my father.
hmr: Bawipu ṭhang loin ka pa kuomah iengtin am hang fe thei ka ti leh? ka pa chunga sietna tlung ding chu hmu ngam naw ning,” a tih a.

en: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
hmr: Chun, Josef chu a kâwla ngîr po pohai hmaa chun ân sûm zo ta nawh a, “Mi po po ka kuoma inthawk hin infe suoktir vawng ro,” tiin a khêk a.

en: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef a unauhai kuoma ân hriettir sûng po a kâwlah tukhawm an ngîr nawh. Chun, a ṭap ta rak rak a, chuongchun, Aigupta mihai chun an hriet a. Pharao sûnghai khawmin an hriet bawk a.

en: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a unauhai kuom- ah, “Josef kha ka nih, ka pa chu a la dam maw?” a tih a. Nisienlakhawm, a unauhai chun an dawn thei nawh a, a hmaa chun lungzîngtaka an um leiin.

en: And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you. And they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
hmr: Josef bawkin a unauhai kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin mi hung hnai ta u,” a tih a. Chuongchun, an va hnai a. Ama chun, “In unaupa Josef, Aiguptaa lûtpui dinga in izawr kha ka nih.

en: And now be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life.
hmr: Tuhin hitaka fe dinga in mi zawr leiin lungngai naw ro, nangni le nangni intheida bawk naw ro: mihai hringna sanhim dingin Pathienin in hmaah a mi tir hmasa a ni hi.

en: For these two years hath the famine been in the land: and there are yet five years, in which there shall be neither plowing nor harvest.
hmr: Hi kum hni sûng hi hi rama hin ṭâm a hung tla tah a: kum nga a la bâk a, chu sûng po chu hnuoi inlet um naw nih a, bu sîk khawm um naw bawk a tih.

en: And God sent me before you to preserve you a remnant in the earth, and to save you alive by a great deliverance.
hmr: Chuongchun, hnuoia hin chithla- hai hlapêk ding cheu le, sanhimna ropuitaka in ta dinga mi tamtak sanhim ding cheuin, Pathienin in hmaah a mi lo tir hmasa a nih.

en: So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, hitaka mîn kaitirtu hi nangni in ni nawh a, Pathien a ni lem, ama chun Pharao paa le a sûnghai po po hotuah le Aigupta ram po po rorêltuah a mi siem tah a.

en: Haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down unto me, tarry not;
hmr: Inhmâwtakin ka pa kuomah hang fe unla, a kuomaah, ‘I naupa Josef chun hieng ang hin a tih, Pathienin Aigupta ram po po hotuah a mi siem tah a, ka kuomah hung thla rawh, sâwt hung riel naw rawh;

en: and thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children’s children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:
hmr: Gosen ramah um i ta, ka kâwl hnaiah i um ding a nih, nang le i nauhai le i tuhai leh, i berâm ruolhai le i bâwng ruolhai leh, i nei po pohai leh;

en: and there will I nourish thee; for there are yet five years of famine; lest thou come to poverty, thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast.
hmr: chutaka chun keiin châwm ka ti cheh a, ṭâm ding kum nga a la um sih a; chuong naw chun nang le i sûnghai le, i nei po po rimsi rawi in tih,’ ti ro.

en: And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.
hmr: Tuhin nangni mit ngei le, ka sangpa Benjamin mit ngeiin, keia bau ngeiin a hril ti in hmu hi.

en: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen: and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.
hmr: Aigupta rama ka ropuina po po thu le, in thil hmu po po thu hi ka pa hril in ta, ka pa chu inhmâwtakin hitaka hin in hung ṭhuoi thlâk ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.
hmr: Chun, a ir le a sang Benjamin ir chu suktuoin a ṭap bawk a.

en: And he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him.
hmr: Chun, a unauhai po po chu a fâwp a, a ṭap khum seng tah a; chu hnunga chun, a unauhai chun thukhawchâng an hrilpui tah a.

en: And the report thereof was heard in Pharaoh’s house, saying, Joseph’s brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.
hmr: Chun, “Josef unauhai an hung,” ti thuthang Pharao ina an lo hriet chun Pharao le a siehlawhai a suklâwm hleh a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren, This do ye: lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan;
hmr: Pharao chun Josef kuomah, “I unauhai kuomah, ‘Hieng hin thaw ro, in sahai bu inphurtir unla, Kanaan ramah fe ro:

en: and take your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.
hmr: chun, in pa le in sûnghai chu hung ṭhuoi unla, ka kuoma hin hung ro; chuongchun, Aigupta ram ṭhatna lai tak pêng ka ti cheu a, chu rama thil ṭha takhai chu in fâk ding a nih,’ ti rawh.

en: Now thou art commanded, this do ye: take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hin hril bawk la: in nauhai ta ding le in nuhmeihai ta dingin Aigupta rama inthawk hin tawlailîrhai lain fe unla, in pa ṭhuoiin hung ro.

en: Also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of Egypt is yours.
hmr: In thuomhnaw khawm ngaituo nuom naw ro, Aigupta ram po poa thil ṭha taphawt hi in ta a ni sih a, tiin,” a tih a.

en: And the sons of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel nauhai chun chuong ang chun an thawh a: chun, Josef chun Pharao thupêk ang chun tawlailîrhai a pêk a, lampuia dingin fâk ding a pêk bawk a.

en: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.
hmr: An rênga kuomah silfên in- thlengna ding a pêk seng a; Benjamin kuoma lem chu tangka za thum le silfên inthlengna panga a pêk a.

en: And to his father he sent after this manner: ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with grain and bread and provision for his father by the way.
hmr: Chun, an pa kuoma chun sabengtung sâwm Aigupta rama thil ṭha phur le, sabengtungpui sâwm, bu le bei le, lampuia a pa ta dinga mamaw danghai phur ân phur a.

en: So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, See that ye fall not out by the way.
hmr: Chun, a unauhai chu a tir suok a, an fe tah a: chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Lampuia inhal lo dingin fimkhur ro,” a tih a.

en: And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacob their father.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aiguptaa inthawk chu an fe tung a, Kanaan rama, an pa Jakob kuom chu an hang tlung a.

en: And they told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt. And his heart fainted, for he believed them not.
hmr: A kuomah, “Josef kha a la dam a, Aigupta ram po po rorêltu a nih,” tiin an hril a. Chun, a lung chu a chau sul a, an thu hril chu a awi si nawh a.

en: And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:
hmr: Chun, a kuomah Josef thu hril po po chu an hril a; a chuongna ding tawlailîrhai Josefin a inphur chu a hmu chun an pa Jakob lungril chu a har ta huoi a:

en: and Israel said, It is enough; Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.
hmr: chun, Israel chun, “A hun tah ie, ka naupa Josef chu damin a la um a ni tak tak hi: ka thi hmain ama zu hmûng ka tih,” a ti tah a.

en: And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of his father Isaac.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel chu a nei po po leh a suok a, Beer-seba chu a tlung a, a pa Isak Pathien kuomah inthâwinahai ân hlân a.

en: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin zâna a mang- haia chun Israel chu a biek a, “Jakob, Jakob,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Hitaka hi ka um,” a tih a.

en: And he said, I am God, the God of thy father: fear not to go down into Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation:
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Kei Pathien, i pa Pathien chu ka nih: Aiguptaa zu fe chu ṭi naw rawh: chutaka chun chi ropuitakah ka siem ding che a nih.

en: I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again: and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes.
hmr: Aiguptaa chun nang leh fe vêng ka ta; chun, zu ṭhuoi kai nâwk ngei ngei ka ti che: chun, Josef chun i thi pha i mit a siempêk ding che a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba: and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu Beer- sebaa inthawk chun a suok a, Israel naupahai chun an pa Jakob le an nauhai le an nuhmeihai chu chuong- na dinga Pharao tawlailîr inphurhaia khan an inchuongtir a.

en: And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacob, and all his seed with him:
hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob le a thlahai po po chun, Kanaana an them suok,an ranhai le an thuomhnawhai chu an sawm a, Aigupta chu an tlung tah a.

en: his sons, and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters, and his sons’ daughters, and all his seed brought he with him into Egypt.
hmr: Jakob chun a naupasalhai, a tupahai, a naunuhmeihai, a tunuhai, a thlahai po po chu, Aiguptaa chun a lûtpui tâwl tah a.

en: And these are the names of the children of Israel, who came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob’s first-born.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi Israel thla Aiguptaa lût, Jakob le a naupasalhai hming chu a nih: Reuben, Jakob nau lutîr chu.

en: And the sons of Reuben: Hanoch, and Pallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.
hmr: Chun, Reuben naupasalhai chu: Hanok, Pallu, Hezron le Karmi.

en: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.
hmr: Simeon naupasalhai chu Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Johar le Kanaan nuhmei le an naupasal Saula.

en: And the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
hmr: Levi naupasalhai chu Gerson, Kohath le Merari.

en: And the sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Perez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
hmr: Juda naupasalhai chu Er, Onan, Selah, Perez le Zera. (Er le Onan chu Kanaan ramah an thi tah). Perez naupasalhai chu Hezron le Hamul.

en: And the sons of Issachar: Tola, and Puvah, and Iob, and Shimron.
hmr: Issakar naupasalhai chu Tola, Puva, Job le Simron.

en: And the sons of Zebulun: Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel.
hmr: Zebulun naupasalhai chu Sered, Elon le Jahleel.

en: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bare unto Jacob in Paddan-aram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.
hmr: Hienghai po hi Leah naupahai, a naunu Dina leh Paddan-aram rama Jakob a neipêkhai chu an nih: a naupasalhai le a naunuhmeihai po po chu sâwmthum pathum an nih.

en: And the sons of Gad: Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.
hmr: Gad naupasalhai chu: Ziphion, Haggi, Suni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi le Areli.

en: And the sons of Asher: Imnah, and Ishvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister; and the sons of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel.
hmr: Aser naupasalhai chu: Imna, Isva, Isvi, Beria le an farnu Sera. Chun, Beria naupasalhai chu: Heber le Malkiel.

en: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter; and these she bare unto Jacob, even sixteen souls.
hmr: Hienghai hi Labanin a naunu Leah a ipêk Zilpah naupasalhai chu an nih, hienghai hi Jakob a neipêk a, mi sâwmparuk an nih.

en: The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
hmr: Jakob nuhmei Rakil naupasal- hai chu: Josef le Benjamin.

en: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera priest of On, bare unto him.
hmr: Josef chun Aiguptaah naupasal Manasse le Ephraim chu a nei a, chuhai chu On khaw thiempu Potiphera naunu Asenathin ama a neipêk a nih.

en: And the sons of Benjamin: Bela, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.
hmr: Chun, Benjamin naupasalhai chu: Bela, Beker, Asbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim le Arda.

en: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.
hmr: Hienghai hi Rakil naupasalhai Jakob a neipêkhai chu an nih; hienghai hi Jakob a neipêk a, an rêng chun sâwmpali an nih.

en: And the sons of Dan: Hushim.
hmr: Chun, Dan naupa chu Husim.

en: And the sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shillem.
hmr: Naphtali naupasalhai chu: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer le Sillem.

en: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter, and these she bare unto Jacob: all the souls were seven.
hmr: Hienghai hi Labanin a naunu Rakil kuoma a pêk Bilha naupasalhai chu an nih; hienghai hi Jakob a neipêk a, an rêng chun pasari an nih.

en: All the souls that came with Jacob into Egypt, that came out of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives, all the souls were threescore and six;
hmr: Jakob naupasalhai nuhmeihai tiem loin Jakob le Aiguptaa lût ve, a ṭhalbea suok po pohai chu, an rêng chun sâwmruk paruk an nih;

en: and the sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt, were two souls: all the souls of the house of Jacob, that came into Egypt, were threescore and ten.
hmr: chun, Josefin Aiguptaa naupa- sal a neihai chu pahni an nih: Jakob sûnghai po po Aiguptaa lût chu sâwmsari an nih.

en: And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph, to show the way before him unto Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.
hmr: Gosen ram tieng lo khikhmu dingin Juda chu Josef kuomah Jakob- in a lo in fe hmasatir a: chuongchun, Gosen rama chun an lût tah a.

en: And Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father, to Goshen; and he presented himself unto him, and fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a tawlailîr chu a siemrêl a, Gosenah a pa Israel tuok dingin a hang feh a: chun, a kuomah ân hriettir a, a ir a suktuoh a, sâwt fe a ir suktuoin a ṭap a.

en: And Israel said unto Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen thy face, that thou art yet alive.
hmr: Israel chun Josef kuomah, “Damin i la um a, i hmêl ka hmu nâwk ta lei hin tuhin chu nuom leh thi ta de ning,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph said unto his brethren, and unto his father’s house, I will go up, and tell Pharaoh, and will say unto him, My brethren, and my father’s house, who were in the land of Canaan, are come unto me;
hmr: Josef chun a unauhai le a pa sûnghai kuomah, “Hang fêng ka ta, Pharao hril ka ta, a kuomah, ‘Ka unauhai le ka pa sûnghai, Kanaan rama umhai kha, ka kuom an hung tlung tah;

en: and the men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.
hmr: anni chu ran vaituhai an ni leiin berâm vêngtuhai an nih a, an berâm ruolhai le an bâwng ruolhai le an nei po po an hung sawm vawng a nih,’ tiin, hang hril ka tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun a ko cheu a, ‘Ieng sin am in thaw hlak?’ a ti pha cheu chun,

en: that ye shall say, Thy servants have been keepers of cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
hmr: nangnîn, ‘I siehlawhai hi kan thlatuhai chenah naupang chite kan ni laia inthawk tu chen hin ran vaituhai kan nih,’ ti ro: chuongchun, Gosen ramah um thei in tih. Berâm vêngtu hrim hrim chu Aigupta mihai tirdak zâwngtak a ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: Then Joseph went in and told Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have, are come out of the land of Canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of Goshen.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun Pharao chu a hang hril a, “Ka pa le ka unauhai, an berâm ruol dâm, an ran ruol dâm, an nei po po leh Kanaan rama inthawkin an hung tlung thla tah a: tuhin Gosen ramah an um,” a tih a.

en: And from among his brethren he took five men, and presented them unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, a unauhai laia mi panga a ṭhuoi a, Pharao chu ân hrietttir a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto his brethren, What is your occupation? And they said unto Pharaoh, Thy servants are shepherds, both we, and our fathers.
hmr: Pharao chun a unauhai kuoma chun, “Ieng sin am in thaw a?” a tih a. Anni chun Pharao kuomah, “I siehlawhai hi kan thlatuhai chenah berâm vêngtuhai kan nih,” an tih a.

en: And they said unto Pharaoh, To sojourn in the land are we come; for there is no pasture for thy servants’ flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of Canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.
hmr: Anni bawk chun Pharao kuomah, “Hi rama um phawt ding hin kan hung a nih: kan ramah i siehlawhai berâm ruolhai fâk ding a um ta si nawh, ṭâm hi Kanaan ramah a tla nasa hle sih a; chuleiin, lunginsiettakin i siehlawhai hi Gosen ramah mîn umtir rawh,” an tih a.

en: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee:
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun Josef a biek a, “I pa le i unauhai hi i kuomah an hung tah a.

en: the land of Egypt is before thee; in the best of the land make thy father and thy brethren to dwell; in the land of Goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest any able men among them, then make them rulers over my cattle.
hmr: Aigupta ram chu a um duoi annâwm: i pa le i unauhai chu ram ṭhatna lailiah umhmun inkhuortir ta la, Gosen ramah umhmun khuor raw se; chun, anni laia mi thilthawtheitak hriet i nei lem chun ka ran chungah hotuah siem rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a pa Jakob chu a ṭhuoi lût a, Pharao hmaa chun ân ngîrtir a: chuongchun, Jakob chun Pharao chu mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto Jacob, How many are the days of the years of thy life?
hmr: Chun, Pharaoin Jakob kuomah, “Kum iengzat am i ni tah a?” a tih a.

en: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are a hundred and thirty years: few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, and they have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
hmr: Jakob chun Pharao kuomah, “Ka khuol inzin kum chen chu kum za le sâwmthum a nih a, ka dam sûng kumhai hi a tlâwmin a rimsikthlâk a nih, a mi thlatuhai an khuol inzin laia an dam sûng kum khawm a zât ve bawk nawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from the presence of Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin Pharao chu mal a sâwm nâwk a, Pharao kuoma inthawk chu a suok tah a.

en: And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a pa le a unauhai chu umhmun ân khuortir a, Pharao thupêk angin, Aigupta rama ram ṭhatak laia Rameses rama chun ro dingin ram a pêk a.

en: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father’s household, with bread, according to their families.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a pa le a unauhai le a pa sûnghai po po chu, an sûngkuo ang peiin fâk ding a pêk a, a châwm tah a.

en: And there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very sore, so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine.
hmr: Chun, chu ram po poa chun fâk ding hrim a um ta nawh a, ṭâm a tla nasa hle sih a; chuongchun, ṭâm lei chun Aigupta le Kanaan ram chu a chau tah a.

en: And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the grain which they bought: and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s house.
hmr: Josef chun an bu inchâwkna manah Aigupta ram le Kanaan rama tangka um po po chu ân khâwm pêk zo vawng tah a; chun, Josef chun chu tangka chu Pharao inah a hung chawi a.

en: And when the money was all spent in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came unto Joseph, and said, Give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for our money faileth.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta ram le Kanaan rama tangka po po an hmang zo hnung chun Aigupta mi po po chu Josef kuoma chun an hung a, “Fâk ding mi pe raw khai, i hmaa hin kan thi el ding am a nih? tangka hlak a um ta si nawh a,” an tih a.

en: And Joseph said, Give your cattle; and I will give you for your cattle, if money fail.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun, “In ranhai hung pe el ro, in ranhai manah fâk ding pêng ka ti cheu,” a tih a.

en: And they brought their cattle unto Joseph; and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, and for the flocks, and for the herds, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread in exchange for all their cattle for that year.
hmr: Chuongchun, an ranhai chu Josef kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a; Josef chun chuong sakawrhai, berâm ruolhai, bâwng ruolhai le sabeng- tunghai mana chun fâk ding a pêk pei a: chu kum chun an ran po po manah fâk ding a pêk a, a châwm tâwl tah a.

en: And when that year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, We will not hide from my lord, how that our money is all spent; and the herds of cattle are my lord’s; there is nought left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies, and our lands:
hmr: Chu kum chu ân vawi a, kum a hung thar chun an hung nâwk a, a kuomah, “Pu, kan tangka po po kan hmang zo tâkzie le, kan ran ruolhai i ta a ni tâkzie hi, pu, i kuoma hin ip naw ning ungah: pu, i mithmua hin kan ramhai le kan tisa bak naw chu iengkhawm a um ta dêr nawh a;

en: wherefore should we die before thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants unto Pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, and that the land be not desolate.
hmr: i hmaa hin keini le kan ram hi kan bohmang el ding am a nih? Keini hi kan ram pumin fâk dingin mîn chaw rawh; chuongchun, keini le kan ram hi Pharao siehlawhai ni el kan tih: chun, thi loa dama kan um theina ding le, ram hi mâk a ni nawna dingin bu chi mi pe bawk la,” an tih a.

en: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh; for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine was sore upon them: and the land became Pharaoh’s.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chun Pharao ta dingin Aigupta ram po po chu ân châwkpêk tah a; ṭâm chu an chunga a tlung nasa bêk leiin Aigupta mihai chun an lo chu an zawr sih a. Chuongchun, ram chu Pharao ta a ni ta vawng a.

en: And as for the people, he removed them to the cities from one end of the border of Egypt even to the other end thereof.
hmr: Mihriemhai chu Aigupta ramri khingtieng tâwpa inthawka khing- tieng tâwp chenin khuoahai chun ân tâwltir tâwl tah a.

en: Only the land of the priests bought he not: for the priests had a portion from Pharaoh, and did eat their portion which Pharaoh gave them; wherefore they sold not their land.
hmr: Thiempuhai ram bak ân châwk nawh a; thiempuhai chun Pharaoa inthawk chanvo an nei a, Pharaoin an chanvo a pêk chu an fâk hlak a nih: chuleiin, an ram chu an zawr ve nawh a.

en: Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this day and your land for Pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye shall sow the land.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Josef chun mihai kuoma chun, “Ngai ta u, vawisûn hin nangni hi in ram pumin Pharao ta dingin kân châwk ta cheu a, hi, hitaka hi in ta ding bu chi a um hi, hnuoiah chîng ro.

en: And it shall come to pass at the ingatherings, that ye shall give a fifth unto Pharaoh, and four parts shall be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.
hmr: Chun, bu lâk pha chun Pharao ta dingin hmun ngaa ṭheha hmun khat pei pêng in ta, a hmun li chu nangni ta nîng a tih, in chîng nâwk ding, in fâk ding le in nau le tehai fâk dingin,” a tih a.

en: And they said, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find favor in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Nangin kan hringna hi i sanhim tah a: pu, mi lunginsiet la, Pharao siehlaw ni el kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And Joseph made it a statute concerning the land of Egypt unto this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth; only the land of the priests alone became not Pharaoh’s.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chun Pha- raoin hmun ngaa ṭheha hmun khat a hmu pei ding thu hi, Aigupta ram ta dingin tu chen hin dânah a siem tah a: thiempuhai ram bak chu a nih Pharao ta ni lo chu.

en: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen; and they gat them possessions therein, and were fruitful, and multiplied exceedingly.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai chun Aigupta rama Gosen rama chun umhmun an khuor tah a; chutaka chun an insukmuk a, chi tamtak an thlah a, nasatakin an pung tah a.

en: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years: so the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were a hundred forty and seven years.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu Aigupta rama chun kum sâwmpasari a um a; chuongchun, Jakob dam sûng kum chu kum za le sâwmli pasari a nih.

en: And the time drew near that Israel must die: and he called his son Joseph, and said unto him, If now I have found favor in thy sight, put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me: bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt;
hmr: Chun, Israel thi hun ding chu a hung hnai tah a; chuongchun, a naupa Josef chu a ko a, a kuomah, “I mi lunginsiet thei chun, lungin- siettakin i kut kha ka êlpui hnuoiah rawl la, ka chungah thuzâwmtak le indiktaka thaw dingin intiem rawh. Aiguptaa hin mi phûm lul naw rawh.

en: but when I sleep with my fathers, thou shalt carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their burying-place. And he said, I will do as thou hast said.
hmr: A mi thlatuhai kuoma ka in pha chun nangin Aiguptaa inthawk hin mi zâwn dawkin, anni phûmna hmunah i mi phûm lem ding a nih,” a tih a. Ama chun, “I hril ang hin hung thâwng ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Swear unto me: and he sware unto him. And Israel bowed himself upon the bed’s head.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ka kuomah inkhâm raw le,” a tih a; chuongchun, a kuomah ân khâm tah a. Chun, Israel chu khum lu sikin a kûn tah a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that one said to Joseph, Behold, thy father is sick: and he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
hmr: Chun, chuong hnunga chun, Josef kuomah, “Ngai ta, i pa a dam nawh ie,” an tih a: chuongchun, a naupasalhai pahni, Manasse le Ephraim chu a ṭhuoi a.

en: And one told Jacob, and said, Behold, thy son Joseph cometh unto thee: and Israel strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chu “Ngai ta, i nau- pa Josef chu i kuomah a hung ie,” tiha an hril chun, Israel chu ân sukhar a, khuma chun a ṭhung tah a.

en: And Jacob said unto Joseph, God Almighty appeared unto me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,
hmr: Chun, Jakobin Josef kuomah, “Pathien Iengkimthawthei chu Ka- naan rama Luz-ah ka kuomah ân lâr a, mal a mi sâwm a, ka kuomah,

en: and said unto me, Behold, I will make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, and I will make of thee a company of peoples, and will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession.
hmr: ‘Chi tamtak inthlatir ka ti cheh a, sukpung bawk ka ti cheh a, chi tum tum um khâwmah siem ka ti che; chun, hi ram hi i hnunga i thlahai kuoma chun kumkhaw ro dingin pêng ka tih,’ a mi tih a.

en: And now thy two sons, who were born unto thee in the land of Egypt before I came unto thee into Egypt, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh, even as Reuben and Simeon, shall be mine.
hmr: Chun, i naupasalhai pahni, Aiguptaa i kuoma ka hung hmaa i neihai hi, ka ta an nih: Ephraim le Manasse hi, Reuben le Simeon ang bawkin ka ta nîng an tih.

en: And thy issue, that thou begettest after them, shall be thine; they shall be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance.
hmr: Anni hnunga nau i neihai chu i ta nîng an ta, an ro chana chun an uhai hming chu inṭâwmpui el an tih.

en: And as for me, when I came from Paddan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan in the way, when there was still some distance to come unto Ephrath: and I buried her there in the way to Ephrath (the same is Beth-lehem).
hmr: Chun, keia thu chu, Paddan- aram rama inthawka ka hung lai khan Rakil chu Kanaan ramah, lam- pui kârlakah, Ephrath chu a la hlat fe laiin, ka bulah a thih a: chutaka Ephrath lampuia chun ka phûm tah a (chu chu Bethlehem a nih)” a tih a.

en: And Israel beheld Joseph’s sons, and said, Who are these?
hmr: Israelin Josef naupahai a hmu chun, “Hieng hi tuhai am an nih a?” a tih a.

en: And Joseph said unto his father, They are my sons, whom God hath given me here. And he said, Bring them, I pray thee, unto me, and I will bless them.
hmr: Josef chun a pa kuomah, “Hieng hi ka naupasalhai, Pathienin hitaka a mi pêkhai chu an nih,” a tih a. Ama chun, “Lunginsiettakin ka kuoma hin hung ṭhuoi rawh, anni chu mal lo sâwm ka tih,” a tih a.

en: Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he could not see. And he brought them near unto him; and he kissed them, and embraced them.
hmr: Israel chu a upat leiin a mit ân thim taha a hmu fie thei naw a nih. Chun, a hung ṭhuoi hnai a; chun, ama chun a lo fâwp a, a lo pawm a.

en: And Israel said unto Joseph, I had not thought to see thy face: and, lo, God hath let me see thy seed also.
hmr: Israel chun Josef kuomah, “I hmêl hmu hi ka beisei ta nawh a, nisienlakhawm, ngai ta, Pathienin i thlahai hmêl chen khawm a mîn hmutir tah a ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph brought them out from between his knees; and he bowed himself with his face to the earth.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun anni chu a pa mal kâra inthawk chun a kei suok a, ama chu hnuoi sikin chibai a bûk a.

en: And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel’s right hand, and brought them near unto him.
hmr: Josef chun an pahni chun a kei a, Ephraim chu a kut changtiengin Israel kut vawitieng pangah, Ma- nasse chu a kut vawitiengin Israel kut changtieng pangah a hung ṭhuoi hnai a.

en: And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it upon Ephraim’s head, who was the younger, and his left hand upon Manasseh’s head, guiding his hands wittingly; for Manasseh was the first-born.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel chun a ban inkal ṭâl a, a kut changtieng chun a ban a, a naupang lem Ephraim lusîpah, a kut vawitieng chu Manasse lusîpah ân nghat a, Manasse chu nau lutîr a ni sih a.

en: And he blessed Joseph, and said, The God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk, the God who hath fed me all my life long unto this day,
hmr: Chun, Josef chu mal a sâwm a, “A mi thlatu Abraham le Isak a hmaa an umna hlak Pathien, vawisûn chena ka dam sûng po poa mi châwmtu Pathien,

en: the angel who hath redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads; and let my name be named on them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac; and let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth.
hmr: suol po poa inthawka a mîn tlantu vântirko chun naupanghai hi malsâwm raw se; chun ka hming le a mi thlatu Abraham le Isak hming chu anni hmingah put raw se: chun, khawvêl lairilah mipui nasatak hung ni dingin hung pung raw hai se,” a tih a.

en: And when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him: and he held up his father’s hand, to remove it from Ephraim’s head unto Manasseh’s head.
hmr: Josef chu a pain a kut changtieng Ephraim lusîpa ân nghat a hmu chun a lungni ta nawh a; chuongchun, a pa kut Ephraim lusîpa chu Manasse lusîpa tâwl dingin a dawm kâng a.

en: And Joseph said unto his father, Not so, my father; for this is the first-born; put thy right hand upon his head.
hmr: Chun, Josefin a pa kuomah, “Pa, hieng ang ding hi a ni nawh, hi hi a nih nau lutîr chu, i kut changtieng hi a lusîpah innghat lem rawh,” a tih a.

en: And his father refused, and said, I know it, my son, I know it; he also shall become a people, and he also shall be great: howbeit his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his seed shall become a multitude of nations.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a pa chun a nuom nawh a, “Ka hriet deh, ka naupa, ka hriet, ama khawm hnama hril khawpin um a ta, ama khawm ropui bawk a tih; amiruokchu, a sang hi ama nêkin ropui lem a ta, a thlahai khawm hi chi tum tum tamtak la hung nîng an tih,” a tih a.

en: And he blessed them that day, saying, In thee will Israel bless, saying, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh: and he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu ni chun anni chu mal a sâwm a: “Israelhai chun, ‘Ephraim le Manasse angin Pathienin inumtir raw se che,’ tiin, nangni hming sâlin mal la sâwmpêk hlak an tih,” tiin. Chuongchun, Ephraim chu Manasse hmaah ân umtir tah a.

en: And Israel said unto Joseph, Behold, I die: but God will be with you, and bring you again unto the land of your fathers.
hmr: Chun, Israel bawk chun Josef kuomah, “Ngai ta, ka thi ding a ni tah a: nisienlakhawm, Pathien chu in kuomah um a ta, in thlatuhai rama chun ṭhuoi nâwk a ti cheu.

en: Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brethren, which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu i unauhai chanvo nêk chun chan khatin ka pêk chuong che, ka kâwlhnâm le ka thalngula Amor mihai kuta inthawka ka lâkpêk kha,” a tih a.

en: And Jacob called unto his sons, and said: Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the latter days.
hmr: Chun, Jakobin a naupasalhai chu a ko a, a hril a; “Ni nuhnunghaia in chunga thil la tlung ding chu ka hril theina ding cheuin hung inkhâwm ro.

en: Assemble yourselves, and hear, ye sons of Jacob; And hearken unto Israel your father.
hmr: Nangni Jakob naupasalhai, hung inkhâwm unla, ngai ro: In pa Israel thu hi ngai ro.

en: Reuben, thou art my first-born, my might, and the beginning of my strength; The pre-eminence of dignity, and the pre-eminence of power.
hmr: Reuben, nang hi ka nau lutîr, Ka thilthawtheina, ka hrâtna ra hmasatak, Insângtakna le thuneitakna neitu i nih.

en: Boiling over as water, thou shalt not have the pre-eminence; Because thou wentest up to thy father’s bed; Then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tui anga det lo i nih a, Chunghnungtakna chu nei naw ti nih, I pa khumpui i kai leiin: Chun, chu chu i sukpawrcheh a, ka zâlnaah i kai kha.

en: Simeon and Levi are brethren; Weapons of violence are their swords.
hmr: Simeon le Levi hi unau an nih: An kâwlhnâmhai chu thisen insuona hriemhrei an nih.

en: O my soul, come not thou into their council; Unto their assembly, my glory, be not thou united; For in their anger they slew a man, And in their self-will they hocked an ox.
hmr: Aw ka thlarau, nang chu an inrâwnnaa chun inrawl ve naw rawh: An lunginsenin mi an that a, An kâwmawnain bâwngchal tha an sat a.

en: Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce; And their wrath, for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob, And scatter them in Israel.
hmr: An lunginsenṭeuna chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se, a ṭium sih a. An lung puom hlena chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se,a nunrâwng sih a. Jakobrawihai lai chun anni chu thedar ka ta, Israelrawihai lai chun anni chu sukdar ka tih.

en: Judah, thee shall thy brethren praise: Thy hand shall be on the neck of thine enemies; Thy father’s sons shall bow down before thee.
hmr: Juda, nang chu i unauhaiin inpâk an ti che, I kut chu i râlhai rîngah innghat a ta, I pa naupasalhai chu i hmaah kûn an tih.

en: Judah is a lion’s whelp; From the prey, my son, thou art gone up: He stooped down, he couched as a lion, And as a lioness; who shall rouse him up?
hmr: Juda hi sakeibakneite a nih; Ka naupa, i sase chu i hang fesan tah a, A kûn a, sakeibakneichal angin a bawk a, Sakeibakneipui ang bawk siin, tuin am suktho ngam an ta?

en: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet, Until Shiloh come; And unto him shall the obedience of the peoples be.
hmr: Lal hmawl chu Judaa inthawk hin bo naw nih a, Rorêltu hmawl chu a ke kâra inthawkin bo naw bawk a tih; A neitu takpa a hung hmakhat chun; Hnam tinin ama thu awi an tih.

en: Binding his foal unto the vine, And his ass’s colt unto the choice vine; He hath washed his garments in wine, And his vesture in the blood of grapes:
hmr: A sakawrte chu Grêp hruiah a thlung a, A sabengtungte chu grêp hrui ṭha miah a thlung bawk a. A silfên chu uoinah a sâwp a, A puon chu grêp thisenah.

en: His eyes shall be red with wine, And his teeth white with milk.
hmr: A mithai chu uoin suksenin um a ta, A hahai chu nenetui sukvârin.

en: Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; And he shall be for a haven of ships; And his border shall be upon Sidon.
hmr: Zebulun hin tuisuoriet pangah umhmun khuor a ta, Lawngchâwlna vapang nîng a tih: A ramri chu Zidonah nîng a tih.

en: Issachar is a strong ass, Couching down between the sheepfolds:
hmr: Issakar hi sabengtung hrâttak, Berâm huong kâra bawk a nih:

en: And he saw a resting-place that it was good, And the land that it was pleasant; And he bowed his shoulder to bear, And became a servant under taskwork.
hmr: Châwlna chu ṭhain a hriet a, Ram chu inhawiin a hriet bawk a. Chuongchun, iengkhat put dingin a liengko chu a sukhnuoi a, Kuli sinthawin siehlawah a hung um tah a.

en: Dan shall judge his people, As one of the tribes of Israel.
hmr: Dan hin a mihai chu,ro rêlpêk a tih. Israel hnam pakhat ni vein.

en: Dan shall be a serpent in the way, An adder in the path, That biteth the horse’s heels, So that his rider falleth backward.
hmr: Dan hi lamliena rûl, Lampuia rûlriel, A chunga chuong a thala tla dêr khawpa Sakawr kea chuk hlaktu hi nîng a tih.

en: I have waited for thy salvation, O Jehovah.
hmr: Aw LALPA i sandamna chu ka nghâk zing.

en: Gad, a troop shall press upon him; But he shall press upon their heel.
hmr: Gad hi râlin thâwng an ta, Nisienlakhawm, ama chun an kekhawng tieng thaw lem a tih.

en: Out of Asher his bread shall be fat, And he shall yield royal dainties.
hmr: Aser hi a fâk ṭhâng a ta, Lal tensietna suklang mi nîng a tih.

en: Naphtali is a hind let loose: He giveth goodly words.
hmr: Naphtali hi sazukpui insuo a nih a, Thu ṭhatakhai a hril hlak.

en: Joseph is a fruitful bough, A fruitful bough by a fountain; His branches run over the wall.
hmr: Josef hi kâu ra nuomtak a nih a, Tuikhur kâwla kâu ra nuomtak chu. A kâu nâwksâwnhai chun lung bang ân zâm khum a.

en: The archers have sorely grieved him, And shot at him, and persecuted him:
hmr: Thal kâphai chun ama chu nasatakin an sukrinum a, An kâp a, an suknawmnah a:

en: But his bow abode in strength, And the arms of his hands were made strong, By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob (From thence is the shepherd, the stone of Israel),
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama thalngul chu ngartakin a um zing a, A kut thahai chu sukhrâtin a um a, Jakob Mihrât kut chun, (Chutaka inthawk chun berâm vêngtu, Israel lungpui chu a hung um a.)

en: Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee, And by the Almighty, who shall bless thee, With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that coucheth beneath, Blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.
hmr: I pa Pathien nangma ṭhangpuitu dinga, Iengkimthawthei, Chungtienga vân malsâwmnahai, Hnuoitienga bawk zing tui inthûktak malsâwmnahai, Nene le sul malsâwmnaa Nang malsâwmtu ding ngei sukhrâtin a um a.

en: The blessings of thy father Have prevailed above the blessings of my progenitors Unto the utmost bound of the everlasting hills: They shall be on the head of Joseph, And on the crown of the head of him that was separate from his brethren.
hmr: I pa malsâwmpêkna hi, A mi thlatuhai malsâwmpêkna nêk hmanin, Chatuon tlâng tâwpkhâwk chenin a nasa ta lem a nih: Chuonghai chu Josef lua hin um a ta, A unauhaia inthawka suktuma umpa lusîpa chun um a tih.

en: Benjamin is a wolf that raveneth: In the morning he shall devour the prey, And at even he shall divide the spoil.
hmr: Benjamin hi satene hnukinrawl a nih, Zîngkâr chun a sase chu fâng a ta, Zântieng chun a râllâk chu sem a tih,” tiin.

en: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel: and this is it that their father spake unto them and blessed them; every one according to his blessing he blessed them.
hmr: Chuong po po chu Israel hnam sâwm le hnam hni chu an nih; chun, hieng hi anni malsâwma an kuoma an pa thu hril chu a nih: an mal- sâwmna dawng ding ang peiin mal a sâwm seng a.

en: And he charged them, and said unto them, I am to be gathered unto my people: bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
hmr: Chun, anni chu thuro a sieh a, an kuomah, “Ka chipuihai kuomah ṭhuoiin ka um ve ding a ni tah. Hit mi Ephron loa pûka khan ka thlatuhai lai mi phûm ve ro,

en: in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a burying-place.
hmr: chu pûk chu Kanaan rama Mamre zâwna Makpelaa loa pûk, Abrahamin inphûmna hmun ro dinga Hit mi Ephron kuoma inthawka a lo puma a închâwk fâwm a nih, chutaka chun Abraham le a nuhmei Sara chu an phûm a:

en: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there I buried Leah—
hmr: chutaka chun Isak le a nuhmei Rebeka chu an phûm a: chutaka bawk chun Leah ka phûm a,

en: the field and the cave that is therein, which was purchased from the children of Heth.
hmr: lo le a sûnga pûk um chu Heth thlahaia inthawka inchâwk a nih,” a tih a.

en: And when Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the ghost, and was gathered unto his people.
hmr: Chun, Jakob chun a naupa- salhai kuoma thuro a sie zo chun, a kehai chu khumah a hlângkai a, a thlarau ân thla tah a, a chipuihai kuoma chun ṭhuoiin a um ve tah a.

en: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;
hmr: Hi hi Adam thlahai chuongna lekhabu chu a nih. Pathienin thu ngawta mihriem a siem ni khan Pathien angpuiin ama chu a siem a;

en: male and female created he them, and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
hmr: thu ngawtin anni chu nuhmei le pasalah a siem a nih, siema an um ni khan mal a sâwm a, an hming dingin “Mihriem,” ân bûk a.

en: And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:
hmr: Adam chun kum za le sâwmthum a niin, ama angtak, ama angpui ngei naupasal a nei a; a hmingah Seth a sak a;

en: and the days of Adam after he begat Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters.
hmr: chun, Seth a nei hnung chun Adam chu kum za riet a la dam a; naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
hmr: Chuongchun, Adam dam sûng po chu kum za kuo le sâwmthum a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Seth lived a hundred and five years, and begat Enosh:
hmr: Chun, Seth chun kum za le panga a niin naupasal Enos a nei a;

en: and Seth lived after he begat Enosh eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: chun, Enos a nei hnung chun Seth chu kum za riet le pasari a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: and all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
hmr: Chuongchun, Seth dam sûng po chu kum za kuo le sâwmpahni a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Enosh lived ninety years, and begat Kenan:
hmr: Chun, Enos chun kum sâwmkuo a niin naupasal Kenan a nei a;

en: and Enosh lived after he begat Kenan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Kenan a nei hnung chun Enos chu kum za riet le sâwmpanga a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Enosh were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
hmr: chuongchun, Enos dam sûng po chu kum za kuo le panga a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Kenan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalalel:
hmr: Chun, Kenan chu kum sâwm- sari a niin naupasal Mahalalel a nei a;

en: and Kenan lived after he begat Mahalalel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Mahalalel a nei hnung chun Kenan chu kum za riet le sâwmli a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Kenan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
hmr: chuongchun, Kenan dam sûng po chu kum za kuo le sâwm a na; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Mahalalel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:
hmr: Chun, Mahalalel chun kum sâwmruk le panga a niin naupasal Jared a nei a;

en: and Mahalalel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Jared a nei hnung chun Mahalalel chu kum za riet le sâwm- thum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
hmr: chuongchun, Mahalalel dam sûng po chu kum za riet le sâwmkuo panga a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Jared lived a hundred sixty and two years, and begat Enoch:
hmr: Chun, Jared chun kum za le sâwmruk le pahni a niin naupasal Enok a nei a;

en: and Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Enok a nei hnung chun Jared chu kum za riet a la dam a, nau- nuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.
hmr: chuongchun, Jared dam sûng chu kum za kuo le sâwmruk le pahni a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:
hmr: Chun, Enok chun kum sâwmruk le panga a niin naupasal Methusela a nei a;

en: and Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Methusela a nei hnung chun Enok chu kum za thum sûng Pathien leh an lêng hmunkhat hlak a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
hmr: chuongchun, Enok dam sûng po chu kum za thum le sâwmruk le panga a nih;

en: and Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.
hmr: Chun, Enok chu Pathien leh an lêng hmunkhat hlak a: chun, a um ta nawh a: Pathienin a lâk hmang tah a nih.

en: And Methuselah lived a hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:
hmr: Methusela chun kum za le sâwmriet le pasari a niin naupasal Lamek a nei a;

en: and Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Lamek a nei hnung chun Methusela chu kum za sari le sâwmriet le pahni a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a;

en: and all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.
hmr: chuongchun, Methusela dam sûng po chu kum za kuo le sâwmruk le pakuo a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Lamech lived a hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:
hmr: Chun, Lamek chu kum za le sâwmriet le pahni a niin naupasal a nei a;

en: and he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, which cometh because of the ground which Jehovah hath cursed.
hmr: “Ama ngei hin LALPA ṭawngse inphur hnuoi leia ei sinthawna le kuta ei sininrimnaa hin mi thlamuon tâng a tih,” tiin a hmingah Noa a sak a.

en: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
hmr: Chun, Noa a nei hnung chun Lamek chu kum za nga le sâwmkuo le panga a la dam a; naunuhmei le naupasalhai a la nei nâwk a;

en: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
hmr: chun, Lamek dam sûng po chu kum za sari le sâwmsari pasari a nih; chun, a thi tah a.

en: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
hmr: Chun, Noa chu kum za nga mi a na; Noa chun naupasal Sem, Ham, le Japheth a nei a.

en: And Joseph fell upon his father’s face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a pa hmai a sik a, a ṭah a, a fâwp a fâwp a.

en: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.
hmr: Chun, Josefin a siehlaw damdawi thiemhai chu a pa ruong chu hmawn thei loa siem dingin thu a pêk a: chuongchun, damdawi thiemhai chun Israel ruong chu hmawn thei loin an siem tah a.

en: And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of embalming: and the Egyptians wept for him threescore and ten days.
hmr: A ruong siemna dingin ni sâwmli an awh a, hmawn thei loa siemna chun ni chuong zât chu a aw hlak hrim a nih; chun, ni sâwmsari sûng Aigupta mihai chun ama an ṭah a.

en: And when the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found favor in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
hmr: Chun, ama an ṭa a bo hnung chun Josefin Pharao sûnghai chu a biek a, “In mi lunginsiet thei chun, lungin- siettakin Pharao hrieta chun,

en: My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die: in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.
hmr: ‘Ka pain, ngai ta, ka thi ding a ni tah, Kanaan rama ka thlân ka chosaah, chutaka ngei chun mi hung phûm rawh,’ tiin a mîn khâmtir a. Chuleiin, tuhin lunginsiettakin, ka pa hi mi hang inphûmtir rawh; chun, hung nâwk el ka tih, a tih a, tiin hril ro,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun, “Ân khâmtir ang che chun i pa chu hang phûm raw chu,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chu a pa phûm dingin a hang fe tah a. Pharao siehlaw po po, a sûnghai laia upahai leh, Aigupta ram upahai po po le,

en: and all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house: only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.
hmr: Josef sûnghai po po leh, a unauhai leh, a pa sunghai chu ama leh an fe veh a. An nauhai rawi le, an berâm ruolhai le, an bâwng ruolhai bak chu Gosen rama chun an mâk- san a.

en: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen: and it was a very great company.
hmr: Anni ruol chun tawlailîrhai le, sakawr chung chuong mihai an hang fe veh a; pâwl ruol lientak an nih.

en: And they came to the threshing-floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, and there they lamented with a very great and sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.
hmr: Chun, Jordan râla Atad hrizâwl chu an tlung a, chutaka chun nasatakin an ṭah a, ni sari a pa sûnna a siem a.

en: And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians: wherefore the name of it was called Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
hmr: Chu rama mi Kanaan mihai chun Atad hrizâwla an mithi sûn chu an hmu chun, “Hi Aigupta mihai mithi sûnna nasatak a ni hi,” an tih a; chuleiin, chu hmun hminga chun Abel-mizraim an inbûk tah a, chu chu Jordan râla um a nih.

en: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them:
hmr: Chun, a naupasalhai chun a thupêk ang peiin an thawpêk a,

en: for his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field, for a possession of a burying-place, of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
hmr: a naupasalhai chun Kanaan ramah an zâwn lût a, Abrahamin inphûmna hmun ro dinga, Hit mi Ephrona inthawka a lo puma a închâwk, Mamre zâwna Makpela loa pûka khan an phûm tah a.

en: And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
hmr: Josef chu a pa phûm zo chun ama le a unauhai le, a pa phûm dinga ama ruola hang fehai po po le chun Aiguptaah an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, It may be that Joseph will hate us, and will fully requite us all the evil which we did unto him.
hmr: Josef unauhai chun an pa thi chu an ngaituoin, “Josef hin mi theidâng a ta, a chunga thil ei suksuol po po phuba kha ei chunga hin la hung la kim nek el a ti aw,” an tih a.

en: And they sent a message unto Joseph, saying, Thy father did command before he died, saying,
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef kuoma hril dingin thu an inchah a, “I pa chun a thi hma khan,

en: So shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the transgression of thy brethren, and their sin, for that they did unto thee evil. And now, we pray thee, forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spake unto him.
hmr: ‘Hieng ang hin Josef kuomah, Lunginsiettakin i unauhai bawsietna le an suolna chu ngaidam rawh, i chungah thil chu an suksuol deha chu, tiin hril ro,’ tiin thu a mi pêk a: tuhin, lunginsiettakin i pa Pathien siehlawhai bawsietnahai chu ngai- dam rawh,” an tih a. Chuonga a kuoma an hang hril chun Josef chu a ṭap tah a.

en: And his brethren also went and fell down before his face; and they said, Behold, we are thy servants.
hmr: A unauhai khawm chu an va feh a, a hmaa chun an bawkkhup tâwl a, “Ngai ta, i siehlawhai kan ni hi,” an tih a.

en: And Joseph said unto them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?
hmr: Josef chun an kuomah, “Ṭi naw ro, Pathien aiaw am ka nih?

en: And as for you, ye meant evil against me; but God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.
hmr: Nangni chun ka chungah thil suol thaw in lungril a; nisienla- khawm, Pathien chun, vawisûna an um ang ngei hin, mi tamtak dama sanhimna dingin thil ṭhaha in- changtir a lo lungril lem a ni sih a.

en: Now therefore fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little ones. And he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them.
hmr: Chuleiin, ṭi naw ro, nangni le in nau-le-tehai chu châwm pei ka tih,” a tih a. Chuongchun, a thlamuon a, bau ṭhatakin a biek tâwl a.

en: And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived a hundred and ten years.
hmr: Chun, Josef chu ama le a pa sûnghai leh Aigupta rama chun a um a: Josef chu kum za le sâwm a dam a.

en: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children of the third generation: the children also of Machir the son of Manasseh were born upon Joseph’s knees.
hmr: Josef chun Ephraim nau a tuhai khûp thum chen a hmuh a, Manasse naupa Makir nauhai khawm Josef mal chungah an pieng a.

en: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die; but God will surely visit you, and bring you up out of this land unto the land which he sware to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
hmr: Chun, Josefin a unauhai kuom- ah, “Ka thi ding a ni tah a, ni- sienlakhawm, Pathienin hung kan ngei ngei a ti cheu a, hi rama inthawk hi hung ṭhuoi suok cheuvin, Abraham, Isak le Jakob hai kuoma inkhâma pêk a tiem ramah ṭhuoi a ti cheu,” a tih a.

en: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun Israel thlahai chu ân khâmtir a, “Pathienin hung kan ngei ngei a ti cheu a, ka ruhai hi hitaka inthawkin khitieng in zâwn ngei ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: So Joseph died, being a hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chu kum za le sâwm mi a niin a thih a; a ruong chu hmawntheiloin an siem a, Aiguptaah kuongin an sie tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the ground, and daughters were born unto them,
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a na, hnuoi chungah mihriem an hung pung a, naunuhmeihai an hung nei tâwl chun,

en: that the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all that they chose.
hmr: Pathien naupasalhai chun mi- hriem naunuhmeihai chu hmêl ṭhatakin an hmuh a; chuongchun, an dit zâwng taphawthai chu nuhmeiah an nei tâwl hlak a.

en: And Jehovah said, My Spirit shall not strive with man for ever, for that he also is flesh: yet shall his days be a hundred and twenty years.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Ka thlarau chu mihriemah chêng kumkhuo naw ni; chun mihriem chu kumkhuoin thaw rawp naw nih; ama chu tisa a ni sih a; chuongchun, a dam sûng hun khawm kum za le sâwmhni ni raw se,” a tih a.

en: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them: the same were the mighty men that were of old, the men of renown.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Milienhai chu hnuoia hin an um a; chu hnunga khawm Pathien naupasalhai chun mihriem naunuhmeihai chu an pâwl a, anni leh nauhai an nei hlak lai khan, an um bawk a; chuonghai chu tienlaia mi hrât, mi hming inthanghai kha an nih.

en: And Jehovah saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun hnuoia hin mihriem suolzie chu nasatak a nih ti le, a lungril ngaituonahai hrim hrim chu suol ruok a nih ti a lo hriet a.

en: And it repented Jehovah that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
hmr: Chuongchun, hnuoia hin mi- hriem a lo siem ta lei chun LALPA chu ân sîr a, lungril natnain a hmang pha tah a.

en: And Jehovah said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the ground; both man, and beast, and creeping things, and birds of the heavens; for it repenteth me that I have made them.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun, “Ka mihriem siem hi hnuoi chunga inthawk hin sukbohmang el ka tih a, mihriem dâm, sa dâm, thilhring dâm, chunglêng vate dâm chen hin; ka siem ta leiin kân sîr a nih,” a ta.

en: But Noah found favor in the eyes of Jehovah.
hmr: Noa ruok chun LALPA lungin- sietna a chang a.

en: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, and perfect in his generations: Noah walked with God.
hmr: Hienghai hi Noa thlahai chu an nih: Noa chu mi feltak a na, a dam ruolpuihai lai chun sawisêlbo a nih: Noa chu Pathien leh an lêng hmunkhat hlak.

en: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
hmr: Noa chun naupasal pathum, Sem, Ham le Japheth a nei a.

en: And the earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi hi Pathien mit- hmuin a se zo tah a, hnuoi hi inpâwngnêknain a sip zo ta bawk a.

en: And God saw the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin hnuoi hi a en a; chun, ngai ta, a se zo tah: tisa po poin hnuoia hin an umdân an suksiet zo ta sih a.

en: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Noa kuoma chun, “Tisa po po suktâwpna ding thu ka sukthlûk tah: anni leiin hnuoi hi inpâwngnêknain a sip zo ta sih a: chuongchun, ngai ta, a hnuoi pumin ka sukbohmang ding a nih.

en: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
hmr: I ta dingin fâr thingin lawng siem rawh: lawnga chun pindan- hai siem i ta, a puo tieng le a sûng tieng chu fâr hnai nâl vawng bawk i tih.

en: And this is how thou shalt make it: the length of the ark three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
hmr: Hi hi i siem dân ding chu a nih: lawng dung tieng chu tawng za thum ni sienla, a khang tieng chu tawng sâwmnga, ân sâng tieng chu tawng sâwmthum ni raw se.

en: A light shalt thou make to the ark, and to a cubit shalt thou finish it upward; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
hmr: Lawnga chun tukver siem i ta, a chung tieng tawng khat chinah i zo ding a nih; chun, lawng kawtkhâr chu a pangah i hawng ding a nih; sâwng hnuoihnung le sâwng hnina le sâwng thumna neiin i siem ding a nih.

en: And I, behold, I do bring the flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; everything that is in the earth shall die.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, keima ngeiin, tisa po po hringna thuoka inthuok taphawt chu vân hnuoia inthawka sukbohmang dingin hnuoia hin tui ka suklêt ding a nih; hnuoia thil tinrêng um hi thi vawng an tih.

en: But I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
