hmr: Amiruokchu, ka thuthlung chu i kuomah sukdet lem ka tih, lawnga chun i lût ding a nih, nang lût i ta, i naupasalhai leh, i nuhmei leh, i nauhai nuhmeihai khawm i kuomah an lût ve ding a nih.

en: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
hmr: Chun, tisa po poa thilhring tinrêng laia mi, chi tin pahni peiin i kuoma a hringa um ve dingin lawnga chun i ṭhuoi lût ding a nih, a pui le a chal an ni seng ding a nih.

en: Of the birds after their kind, and of the cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
hmr: Vatehai anni chi umdân ang sengin, ranhai anni chi umdân ang sengin, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâk chi tinrêng anni chi umdân ang sengin, chi tin pahni pei a hringa um dingin, i kuomah an hung ve ding a nih.

en: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
hmr: Chun, bu fâk hlak ang chi po po la la, i kuomah sie khâwm rawh; chuongchun, nangni le anni ta dingin bu nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Noa chun a thawh a, Pathienin a kuoma thu a pêk po po ang ngei chun a thaw tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Noa kuoma chun, “Nang le i sûnghai po po chu lawngah lût ro; nang chu tulai ṭhangthar lai hin ka mithmuin mi feltak i nih ti ka hriet che a nih.

en: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee seven and seven, the male and his female; and of the beasts that are not clean two, the male and his female:
hmr: Sa thieng tinrêng laia mi, a chal le a kawppui a pui seng leh, tuok sari peiin i kuomah ṭhuoi i ta, sa thieng- naw laia mi, a chal le a kawppui, a pui seng leh tuok khat peiin.

en: of the birds also of the heavens, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
hmr: Chunglêng vate laia mi khawm, a pui le a chal seng, tuok sari peiin, hnuoi chung po poa chi thla dinga hring dingin i ṭhuoi ding a nih.

en: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living thing that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the ground.
hmr: Ni sari a la bâk a, chu hnunga chun hnuoi chunga hin ni sâwmli le zân sâwmli sûng ruo insûrtir ka ta; ka thilhring siem tinrêng hi hnuoi chunga inthawkin sukbohmang ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Noah did according unto all that Jehovah commanded him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Noa chun LALPAIN a kuoma thu a pêk ang pei chun a thaw tah a.

en: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia tui a hung lêt lai chun Noa chu kum za ruk mi a nih.

en: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
hmr: Chun, tui a hung lêt ding a ni lei chun Noa chu lawnga chun a lût a, a naupasalhai le a nuhmei le a nauhai nuhmeihai khawm an lût ve a.

en: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of birds, and of everything that creepeth upon the ground,
hmr: Sa thieng laia mi le, sa thiengnaw laia mi le, vate laia mi le, hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn tinrêng laia mi khawm,

en: there went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
hmr: a pui le a chal a tuok peiin Pathienin Noa kuoma thu a pêk ang khan, Noa kuomah lawngah an lût tah a.

en: And it came to pass after the seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, ni sari hnunga chun hnuoia hin tui chu a hung lêt tah a.

en: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
hmr: Noa chu kum za ruk a ni kum, a thla hnina ni sâwm le ni sari niah, chu ni ngei chun tui inthûk lientak hnâr po po chu a hung pût ta vawng a, vân tukverhai khawm a hung inhawng ta bawk a.

en: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
hmr: Chun, ni sâwmli le zân sâwmli sûng chu hnuoia hin ruopui nasatak a sûr tah a.

en: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
hmr: Chu ni ngei chun Noa le a naupasalhai Sem, Ham, Japheth le Noa nuhmei chu lawnga chun an lût tah a, a naupasalhai nuhmei pa- thum khawm an kuomah an lût veh a;

en: they, and every beast after its kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.
hmr: anni chu an lût a, sa tinrêng mâni chi um dân ang sengin, ran po po mâni chi um dân ang sengin, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn chi tinrêng mâni chi um dân ang sengin, vate tinrêng mâni chi um dân ang sengin, vate thla nei tinrêng chu an lût seng bawk a.

en: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh wherein is the breath of life.
hmr: Chuongchun, tisa po po hringna thuok nei taphawt chu a tuok peiin Noa kuomah lawnga chun an lût tah a.

en: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him: and Jehovah shut him in.
hmr: Chun, a lûthai chu Pathienin a kuoma thu a pêk angin, tisa nei laia mi tinrêng chu a pui le a chal a tuok peiin an lût a; chun, LALPAIN ama chu a khâr khum tah a.

en: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.
hmr: Chun, tui chu hnuoia hin ni sâwmli sûng po a lêt a, tui chu a hung pung a, lawng chu a hung lên kâng a, hnuoi chunga chun a chîm lâng pei tah a.

en: And the waters prevailed, and increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
hmr: Tui chu a hung um ta puou a, hnuoi chunga hin a hung pung rak el tah a, lawng chu tui chunga chun ân lâng pei a.

en: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high mountains that were under the whole heaven were covered.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chunga hin tui chu nasatakin a hung um puou el tah a, vân hnuoia tlâng insânghai po po chu a chîm zo tah a.

en: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
hmr: Tawng sâwmpanga zeta in- sângin tui chu a hung um ta puou el a, tlânghai chu a tlum hmang ta dai a.

en: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both birds, and cattle, and beasts, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:
hmr: Chuongchun, tisa hnuoia chângthei po po, vate dâm, ran dâm, sa dâm, thilhring hnuoi chunga bawk- invâka lâwn tinrêng dâm, mihriem tinrêng leh an thi zo vawng tah a;

en: all in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, of all that was on the dry land, died.
hmr: an hnâra hringna thlarau thuok umna po po, khawmuola um ta- phawthai chu an thi ta vawng a.

en: And every living thing was destroyed that was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and creeping things, and birds of the heavens; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only was left, and they that were with him in the ark.
hmr: Chuongchun, hnuoi chunga thil hringna nei tinrêng, mihriem dâm, ran dâm, thilhring bawkinvâk chi dâm, chunglêng vate dâm, hnuoia inthawka sukbohmangin an um tah a: Noa le a kuoma lawnga umhai chau chu hlain an um tah a.

en: And the waters prevailed upon the earth a hundred and fifty days.
hmr: Chun, tui chu ni za le sâwmnga sûng po chu hnuoia hin a um ta puou el a.

en: And God remembered Noah, and all the beasts, and all the cattle that were with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged;
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Noa le lawnga a kuoma thilhring tinrêng le ran um po po chu a hriet zing a; chun Pathienin hnuoi chunga hin thli ân hrângtir a, chuongchun, tui chu a hung kang ṭan tah a,

en: the fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
hmr: tui inthûktak hnarhai le vân tukverhai khawm chu a hung inkhâr tah a, vâna inthawka ruo hung sûr chu sukchâtin a um ta bawk a;

en: and the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters decreased.
hmr: chuongchun, tui chu hnuoi chunga inthawk chun a kang ta deu deu a, ni za le sâwmnga chu a bo hnung chun tui chu a tlâwm ta deu a.

en: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
hmr: Chuongchun, lawng chu thla sarina, ni sâwm le ni sari nia chun Ararat tlânga chun a lo innghat tah a.

en: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
hmr: Chun, tui chu thla sâwmna chenin a tlâwm deu deu pei a; thla sâwmna ni khat nia chun, tlâng sîphai chu a hung inlang tah a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
hmr: Chun, ni sâwmli hnunga chun Noa chun lawng tukver a siem kha a hawng tah a:

en: and he sent forth a raven, and it went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
hmr: chun, vaâk pakhat ân vuong suoktir a; chu chu a suok a, hnuoia inthawka tui chu a kang zo hmakhat chu a vuong vêl a vuong vêl a.

en: And he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chunga tui a tlâwm ta le tlâwm ta naw hrietna dingin vaṭhu ân vuong suoktir nâwk a;

en: but the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him to the ark; for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: and he put forth his hand, and took her, and brought her in unto him into the ark.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, vaṭhu chun fûkna ding hrim hrim a hmu nawh a, a kuomah lawngah a kîr nâwk tah a, tui chu hnuoi chung po poa chun a la um sih a; chuongchun, a kut a hang pur dawk a, a man a, lawng sûngah a kuomah a lâk lût nâwk tah a.

en: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
hmr: Chun, ni sari dang a nghâk nâwk a, vaṭhu chu lawnga inthawk ân vuong suoktir nâwk a;

en: and the dove came in to him at eventide; and, lo, in her mouth an olive-leaf plucked off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
hmr: vaṭhu chu zântieng chun a kuomah a hung lût nâwk a; chun, ngai ta, oliv hna suktlawng hlim a hmûra chun a hung put a: chuongchun, Noa chun hnuoiah tui a tlâwm tah ti a hriet a.

en: And he stayed yet other seven days, and sent forth the dove; and she returned not again unto him any more.
hmr: Chun, ni sari dang a nghâk nâwk a, vaṭhu chu ân vuong suoktir nâwk a; a kuomah a hung kîr nâwk ta nawh a.

en: And it came to pass in the six hundred and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dried.
hmr: Chun, a kum za ruk le a kum khatnaah, a thla khatna ni khat nia chun tui chu hnuoia inthawk chun a kang zo tah a: chuongchun, Noa chun lawng inkhumna chu a hâwk a, a en a; chun, ngai ta, hnuoi chung chu a lo inhil ta huou el a.

en: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dry.
hmr: A thla hnina ni sâwmhni le ni sari nia chun hnuoi chu a hung ṭâwl zo tah a.

en: And God spake unto Noah, saying,
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Noa kuoma chun a hril a,

en: Go forth from the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.
hmr: “Lawnga inthawkin suok ro, nang le i nuhmei, i naupasalhai le an nuhmeihai leh.

en: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee of all flesh, both birds, and cattle, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
hmr: Tisa po po laia mi thil hringna nei tinrêng i umpuihai, vate dâm, ran dâm, thilhring hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn tinrêng dâm le khan i kuomah ṭhuoi suok rawh, hnuoia hin te neiin chi tamtak thlaha an hung pung theina dingin,” tiin.

en: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:
hmr: Chuongchun, Noa chu a suok a, a naupasalhai le a nuhmei le a nauhai nuhmeihai khawm a kuomah an suok veh a;

en: every beast, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatsoever moveth upon the earth, after their families, went forth out of the ark.
hmr: sa tinrêng dâm, thilhring tinrêng dâm, vate tinrêng dâm, hnuoi chunga chângthei taphawthai chu anni chi umdân ang sengin lawnga inthawk chun an suok tah a.

en: And Noah builded an altar unto Jehovah, and took of every clean beast, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt-offerings on the altar.
hmr: Chun, Noa chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm a siem a; chun, sa thieng tinrêng laia mi le, vate thieng tinrêng laia mi a lâk a, mâichâma chun pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai ân hlân tah a.

en: And Jehovah smelled the sweet savor; and Jehovah said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake, for that the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more everything living, as I have done.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN riminhnik chu a hriet a; chun, LALPA chun a lungrilin, “Hnuoi chu mihriem lei chun ṭawngsie inphur nâwk ta naw ning, mihriem lungril ngaituonahai chu an chîntea inthawkin a suol sih a; tuta ka hrem ang hin thilsiem hringna nei tinrêng chu hrem nâwk ta naw bawk ka tih.

en: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
hmr: Hnuoi um sûng po bu tu le bu lâk, khaw dei le khaw lum, nipui le phalbi le, sûn le zân dâm hi bo naw nih,” a ta.

en: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Noa le a naupasalhai chu mal a sâwm a, an kuomah, “Chi tamtak inthlain hung pung unla, hnuoi hi hluo sip ro.

en: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every bird of the heavens; with all wherewith the ground teemeth, and all the fishes of the sea, into your hand are they delivered.
hmr: Nangni ṭîna le pawisakna hnuoia sa tinrêng le chunglêng vate tinrêngin nei an ta; chuonghai le hnuoia bawkinvâka lâwn po po le, tuisuorieta nga po pohai chu, in kuta pêk an ni vawng tah.

en: Every moving thing that liveth shall be food for you; as the green herb have I given you all.
hmr: Thilhring chângthei tinrênghai chu in ta dingin fâk ding nîng an ta; thlai hring ka pêk ang cheu khan iengkim ka pêk vawng cheu.

en: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
hmr: Amiruokchu, sa a hringna (a thisen) pumin in fâk ding a ni nawh.

en: And surely your blood, the blood of your lives, will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it: and at the hand of man, even at the hand of every man’s brother, will I require the life of man.
hmr: Chun, in thisen, in hringna phuba chu la ngei ngei ka tih; sa tinrêng chunga chun lâng ka tih, mihriem kuoma inthawk khawmin, mi tin an unauhaia inthawk chun, mihriem hringna phuba chu la seng ka tih.

en: Whoso sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.
hmr: Tukhawm mihriem thisen in- suotu chu mihriem vêkin ama thisen chu an insuo ve ding a nih: Pathienin ama angpuiin mihriem a siem sih a.

en: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
hmr: Chun, nangni chu chi tamtak inthlain hung pung ro; hnuoia hin nau tamtak nei unla, a chunga hin hung pung ro,” a ta.

en: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Noa le a kuoma um a naupasalhai kuoma chun,

en: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
hmr: “Ngai ta u, keima ngeiin in kuoma le in hnunga in thlahai kuoma khawm ka thuthlung chu ka sukdet a nih;

en: and with every living creature that is with you, the birds, the cattle, and every beast of the earth with you; of all that go out of the ark, even every beast of the earth.
hmr: in kuoma thilhring tinrêng um, in umpui vate dâm, ran dâm, ramsa tinrêng kuoma dâm khawm; lawnga inthawka hung suok po po, hnuoia sa tinrêng kuoma chen khawm.

en: And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of the flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
hmr: In kuomah ka thuthlung chu ka sukdet a; tisa po po tuilêta sukbo- hmangin um ta naw ni hai a, hnuoi sukse dingin tui lêt nâwk ta naw bawk a tih,” tiin a hril a.

en: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
hmr: Chun, Pathien bawkin, “Hi hi kei le nangni le in kuoma thilsiem hringna nei tinrêng umhai kâra, suon tâwp loa um peihai ta dingin, ka thuthlung inchikna chu a nih.

en: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
hmr: Sûmah ka sumrisâng kân zâmtir a, chu chu kei le hnuoi inkâra thuthlung inchikna ding nîng a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud,
hmr: Chun, hieng hi nîng a ta, hnuoi chunga sûm kân zâmtirin sumrisâng chu sûma chun inlang a ta,

en: and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
hmr: kei le nangni le tisa po po laia thilsiem hringna nei tinrêng inkâra ka thuthlung hi hre zing ka tih. Chuongchun, tui chu tisa po po sukbohmang dingin hung lêt nâwk ta naw nih.

en: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, sumrisâng chu sûmah inzâm hlak a ta; chuongchun, Pathien le hnuoi chunga tisa um po po laia thilsiem hringna nei tinrêng inkârah kumkhaw thuthlung um chu ka hriet zing theina dingin en hlak ka tih,” a ta.

en: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bawkin, Noa kuoma chun, “Chu chu kei le hnuoi chunga tisa um po po inkâra thuthlung sukdetna inchikna a nih,” a ti bawk a.

en: And the sons of Noah, that went forth from the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham is the father of Canaan.
hmr: Chun, Noa naupasal lawnga inthawka suokhai chu Sem, Ham, le Japheth an nih: Ham chu Kanaan pa a nih.

en: These three were the sons of Noah: and of these was the whole earth overspread.
hmr: Chuonghai pathum chu Noa naupasalhai an na: chuonghaia inthawka suokhai chun hnuoi po po hi an dâp zo tah a nih.

en: And Noah began to be a husbandman, and planted a vineyard:
hmr: Noa chu hnuoi inlettu hmasa- tak a nih a, Grêp huon a siem a,

en: and he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
hmr: uoin chu a dâwn a, ân rui a: chuongchun, a puon inah puon boin a zâl a.

en: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
hmr: Chun, Ham, Kanaan pa chun a pa saruokna chu a hmuh a, tuola a unauhai pahni chu a hril a.

en: And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father’s nakedness.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sem le Japheth chun puon an lâk a, liengkoa inzâwnin hnungtâwlin an feh a, an pa saruokna chu an inkhum tah a; an hmai chu khingtieng nghain a um a, an pa saruokna chu an hmu nawh a.

en: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done unto him.
hmr: Noa chu a uoin inrui chu a hung har a, a naupasal naupang takin a chunga a thawzie chu a hung hriet tah a.

en: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; A servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
hmr: Chuongchun, “Kanaan chu ṭawngsephurin um raw se; A unauhai siehlawhai siehlaw nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Shem; And let Canaan be his servant.
hmr: “LALPA, Sem Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se. Kanaan chu Sem siehlawah um raw se

en: God enlarge Japheth, And let him dwell in the tents of Shem; And let Canaan be his servant.
hmr: Pathienin Japheth chu suklien sienla, Sem puon inhaiah um raw se; Kanaan chu a siehlawah um raw se,” a ti bawk a.

en: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
hmr: Chun, Noa chu tuilêt hnung chun kum za thum sâwmnga a dam a.

en: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
hmr: Noa dam sûng po po chu kum za kuo le sâwmnga a na; chun a thi tah a.
